name: Capsicum Chutney
instructions: In a wide pan, heat a tbsp of oil. add urad dal, channa dal and red chillis. fry till they turn golden brown.
Then add a chopped garlic. fry for a minute till the raw smell of garlic goes away.
Now add finely chopped onions and fry till they sweat.
Add chopped tomatoes and fry till they become soft and gets cooked well.
Finally, add capsicum and fry till they shrink. capsicum doesn't take more time to cook.
Allow the mixture to cool completely before you blend.
Once they are cooled completely, take them in a blender and add some salt and a tbsp of water.
Blend to smooth chutney.
Prepare the tempering. add a tsp of oil in a small kadai. along with mustard seeds, urad dal and hing. once they splutter add curry leaves and pour the tempering over chutney.
Enjoy capsicum chutney with your favourite dosa, idli or with plain rice.
description: Capsicum chutney is a very good alternative if you are looking for different chutney recipes for the daily breakfast and also for rice and rotis. The sweet and spicy taste of capsicums gives a rich and beautiful texture to this chutney.

name: Paneer Masala Recipe – Dhaba Style
instructions: Firstly, in a large bowl take 20 cubes paneer.
Also add ½ tsp chilli powder, ¼ tsp turmeric, ¼ tsp garam masala, 1 tsp ginger garlic paste, ¼ tsp salt.
Mix well and marinate for 30 minutes.
Now heat 1 tbsp ghee and marinated paneer.
Fry for a minute making sure all the sides are cooked well. keep aside.
Firstly, in a heavy-bottomed pan take 2 tsp coriander seeds, 1 tsp cumin, ¼ tsp pepper, 3 cloves, 2 pods cardamom, ½ inch cinnamon and ½ tsp fennel.
Dry roast on low flame until the spices turn aromatic.
Cool completely, and blend to a fine powder. keep aside.
Firstly, in a large kadai heat 2 tbsp ghee and 2 tbsp oil.
Add 1 bay leaf, 2 pods cardamom, 1 inch cinnamon, 2 cloves and 1 tsp cumin.
Saute until the spices turn aromatic.
Now add 1 onion and 1 tsp ginger garlic paste. saute until the onions turn golden brown.
Further keeping the flame on low, add the prepared spice powder, ¼ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp chilli powder and ¾ tsp salt.
Saute on low flame until the spices turn aromatic.
Now add 2 tomato and saute until tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
Further, keeping the flame on low add ½ cup curd.
Stir continuously until the curd is combined well and oil separates out from the mixture.
Add ½ cup water or as required adjusting the consistency.
Now add fried paneer and mix well.
Cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until the flavours are absorbed well.
Add 1 tsp kasuri methi, ¼ tsp garam masala and 2 tbsp coriander. mix well.
Finally, enjoy paneer masala recipe dhaba style with roti, naan or phulka.
description: Easy paneer masala recipe dhaba style with basic spices and creamy yoghurt

name: Samosa
instructions: In a large bowl, combine all-purpose flour, semolina, carom seeds, and salt.
Add oil or ghee and mix well until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.
Gradually add water and knead into a firm dough. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix mashed potatoes, green peas, ginger, green chilies, garam masala, amchur, red chili powder, salt, and coriander leaves.
Divide the dough into small portions and roll each portion into a small circle.
Cut the circle in half and shape each half into a cone. Seal the edges with water.
Fill the cone with the potato mixture and seal the top.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
Fry the samosas until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
description: Make the perfect crunchy & flaky samosas at home!

name: Masoor Dal
instructions: Rinse the masoor dal and soak for 30 minutes.
Cook the dal with 2 cups of water, turmeric, and salt until soft.
In a separate pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Once they splutter, add curry leaves.
Add chopped onions and green chilies and saute until golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste and saute for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Pour the cooked dal into the pan and mix well.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with rice or roti.
description: A simple and flavorful Indian red lentil recipe.

name: Indian Rice Pudding

ingredients.name: Rice
ingredients.quantity: 1/2 cup uncooked rice (preferably short-grain like Basmati or Sona Masuri, rinsed well.)

ingredients.name: Milk
ingredients.quantity: 4 cups whole milk (or a mix of milk and cream for richer flavor)

ingredients.name: Saffron Strands
ingredients.quantity: a few saffron strands (soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk, optional)

instructions: Rinse the rice: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. This helps remove excess starch.
Soak saffron (optional): Soak a few strands of saffron in 2 tablespoons of warm milk. This will infuse the milk with color and flavor.
Cook the rice: In a heavy-bottomed pot, add the rinsed rice and milk. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.

Continue simmering: Continue to simmer the mixture for about 45-60 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the pudding has thickened to your desired consistency. Stir more frequently as the pudding thickens.
Add sugar and flavorings: Once the rice is cooked, add the sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron-infused milk (if using). Stir well to combine.
Simmer further: Continue to simmer for another 5-10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Sauté nuts (optional): In a small pan, heat ghee over low heat. Add the chopped cashews and almonds and sauté until lightly golden. Add the raisins and sauté for a few seconds more.
Garnish and serve: Pour the sautéed nuts and raisins over the rice pudding. Serve warm or chilled.

instructions: Soak cashews, almonds, and poppy seeds in warm water for 30 minutes.
Grind the soaked nuts and seeds into a fine paste.
Heat ghee/oil in a pressure cooker or pot.
Add whole spices and saute for a minute.
Add sliced onions and saute until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, saute until fragrant.
Add mutton pieces and saute until browned.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Saute for a few minutes.
Add the nut paste and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add water (enough to cover the mutton) and pressure cook for 4-5 whistles or until the mutton is tender.
Once the pressure is released, open the cooker and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Add garam masala and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with mint and coriander leaves.
Serve hot with naan or rice.
description: Hyderabadi Marag is a rich and flavorful mutton soup, traditionally served at weddings and special occasions.

name: Bread Upma

ingredients.name: Bread
ingredients.quantity: 6-8 slices, cubed or torn into small pieces (brown, white, or multigrain bread can be used. Stale bread works best.)

instructions: Prepare the bread: Cut the bread into cubes or tear into small pieces. If the bread is too soft, you can lightly toast it in a pan or oven to dry it out a bit.
Heat oil in a pan or wok over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn translucent and slightly golden.
Add ginger and sauté for a few seconds until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala (if using). Cook for a minute until the spices are fragrant.
Add the bread pieces to the pan. Mix well to coat the bread with the spice mixture.
Sprinkle some water (2-3 tablespoons) over the bread to moisten it. Be careful not to add too much water, as the bread should not become soggy.
Season with salt to taste. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the bread is heated through and the flavors have melded.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and a squeeze of lemon juice (if using).
Serve hot as a breakfast or snack.

name: Tandoori Roti (Butter Roti)

ingredients.name: flour
ingredients.quantity: 2 cups (estimated from common roti recipes, exact quantity not in provided text, assuming whole wheat flour for healthier version.)

ingredients.name: water
ingredients.quantity: As needed (estimated, quantity not in provided text. Usually warm water is used.)

ingredients.name: salt
ingredients.quantity: 1/2 tsp (estimated, quantity not in provided text.)

ingredients.name: butter or ghee
ingredients.quantity: For brushing (estimated, quantity not in provided text.)

instructions: Combine flour, water, and salt to form a soft dough.
Knead the dough well for about 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Cover the dough and let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
Divide the dough into small, equal-sized balls.
Roll each ball into a thin, circular roti.
Heat a tawa or griddle over medium-high heat.
Place the roti on the hot tawa and cook for a few seconds until small bubbles appear.
Flip the roti and cook the other side for a few seconds.
Using tongs, carefully hold the roti directly over an open flame (or on the tawa) to puff it up.
Brush the cooked roti with butter or ghee.
Serve hot.
description: Tandoori Roti, also known as Butter Roti, is a popular Indian flatbread.

name: Coconut Chickpea Curry

ingredients.name: chickpeas
ingredients.quantity:
1.5 cups cooked or 1 can (15 ounces), drained and rinsed well if using canned chickpeas. Do not use the canned liquid as it can cause bloating to some people. If using dried chickpeas, soak them overnight and cook until tender. You will need about ¾ cup dried chickpeas to yield 1.5 cups cooked chickpeas. I used homemade cooked chickpeas in the video and pictures. You can also use instant pot chickpeas. Check notes for details.)
Coconut Milk: 1 ½ cups (full fat, canned or homemade. Shake the can well before opening. Homemade coconut milk is best and tastes delicious.)
Onion: 1 medium (chopped, about ¾ cup)
Tomatoes: 2 medium (chopped, about 1 ½ cups)
Ginger Garlic Paste: 1 tablespoon (or 1 inch ginger + 3 to 4 cloves garlic, crushed in a mortar pestle)
Green chilies: 1 to 2 (slit or chopped, adjust to taste)
Cilantro: 2 tablespoons (chopped, for garnish)
Lemon or Lime Juice: 1 teaspoon (optional, adjust to taste)
Oil or Ghee: 2 tablespoons (any cooking oil)
Mustard Seeds: ½ teaspoon
Cumin Seeds: ½ teaspoon
Curry Leaves: 1 sprig (about 10 to 12 leaves)
Asafoetida (hing): ¼ teaspoon (optional, gluten-free)
Turmeric Powder: ½ teaspoon
Red Chili Powder: ½ to ¾ teaspoon (adjust to taste)
Coriander Powder: 1 ½ teaspoons
Garam Masala: ½ teaspoon
Salt: to taste (about ¾ teaspoon or more)

instructions: Heat oil or ghee in a pot or pan over medium heat.
Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. When they start to splutter, add curry leaves and asafoetida (hing).
Add chopped onion and saute until golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste and green chilies. Saute for a minute until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Saute for a minute.
Add cooked chickpeas and coconut milk. Stir well.
Add salt to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the curry thickens slightly.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and lemon or lime juice (optional).
Serve hot with rice or roti.
description: A delicious and easy coconut chickpea curry recipe.

instructions: In a bowl, mix together yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, tandoori masala, garam masala, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt to create the marinade.
Apply the marinade evenly to the salmon fillets, ensuring they are well coated.
Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours, to allow the flavors to meld.
Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) or prepare your tandoor if you have one.
Place the marinated salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or lightly oiled.
Brush the salmon fillets with oil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Adjust cooking time depending on the thickness of the fillets.
If using a tandoor, follow the manufacturer's instructions for cooking salmon.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
Serve the tandoori salmon hot with a side of rice, salad, or naan bread.

name: Grilled Sandwich - Indian Street Style Sandwich

ingredients.name: Bread slices
ingredients.quantity: 4-6 slices (as needed for 2-3 sandwiches, adjust as needed based on preference and loaf size.)

ingredients.name: Butter
ingredients.quantity: 2 tablespoons (for spreading on bread, adjust as needed.)

ingredients.name: Green chutney
ingredients.quantity: 2-3 tablespoons (or as needed, adjust to taste.)

ingredients.name: Coriander leaves
ingredients.quantity: 1/4 cup (finely chopped, for garnish and flavor.)

ingredients.name: Mint leaves
ingredients.quantity: 1/4 cup (finely chopped, for garnish and flavor.)

ingredients.name: Turmeric powder
ingredients.quantity: a pinch (for color and health benefits.)

instructions: Make the green chutney: In a blender, combine coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chilies, ginger, lemon juice, salt, and black salt. Add a little water and blend to a smooth paste. Adjust consistency as needed.

Prepare the potato filling: In a bowl, mix mashed boiled potatoes, chopped onion, capsicum, tomato, grated carrot, chaat masala, red chili powder, cumin powder, and turmeric powder. Mix well to combine.
Butter the bread slices: Spread butter on one side of each bread slice.
Apply green chutney: Spread green chutney on the buttered side of two bread slices.
Add the potato filling: Spread the potato filling evenly on one of the chutney-covered bread slices.
Top with cheese (optional): Sprinkle grated cheese over the potato filling, if desired.
Cover with the other bread slice: Place the other chutney-covered bread slice on top, chutney-side down.

Grill the sandwich: Heat a grill pan or sandwich maker. Place the sandwich on the grill and cook until golden brown and crispy on both sides. You can also cook it on a tawa (flat pan) with some butter.
Cut and serve: Once grilled, cut the sandwich into halves or quarters and serve immediately. Enjoy your Indian street-style grilled sandwich!
description: A popular Indian street food featuring a spiced potato filling and chutney, grilled to perfection.

instructions: Begin by preparing the ingredients. First rinse the fenugreek leaves thoroughly in water. Drain the water completely and then chop the leaves.
Meanwhile cook the green peas. Though fresh green peas taste best, you can use frozen peas too.
Rinse them a few times in water. To cook green peas in a small pan, just add them in about 1½ cups water or as needed. Boil for 7 to 8 minutes or until the peas are softened and tender.
Once the peas are softened, strain them. At this point you could reserve about ½ cup of the green peas cooked water, if you prefer.
For garnish, opt to set aside about 1 to 2 tablespoon of the cooked green peas.
You could also steam the green peas in a 6 quart Instant Pot for 3 to 5 minutes adding about 1 to 1.25 cups water in the steel insert.
You can also boil the green peas in a 2 litre stove-top pressure cooker for 5 to 6 minutes adding water as required. The water should cover the green peas completely.
Reserve ½ cup of the cooked water if you have boiled the peas.
In a grinder jar or blender, add cumin seeds, chopped onions, cashews, garlic, ginger and green chilies.
Blend or grind to a fine and smooth paste without adding any water.
If your blender or grinder is not able blend or grind effectively, then you can add 1 to 2 tablespoons of water to the ingredients and continue to blend or grind to a fine paste.
Heat ghee (clarified butter) or oil in a pan or kadai.
When the ghee melts or becomes lightly hot, add the ground paste.
Sauté the paste for 6 to 7 minutes on a low to medium-low heat until you see the fat separating from the sides.
Stir often when sautéing so that the paste does not stick to the pan. You should see fat releasing from the sides and the paste will also have a nice aroma.
You will see the paste coming together and becoming glossy. Do not brown the paste.
If the ground paste sticks to the pan or gets browned add a few splashes of water. Mix, deglaze and continue to sauté.
Add in the chopped fenugreek leaves and sauté further for 2 to 3 minutes.
Then add ½ cup water or the stock/water in which the green peas were cooked in two parts.
First add ¼ cup water or green peas stock and mix thoroughly. Next add the remaining ¼ cup and mix again.
Simmer the gravy for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir at intervals.
Add the boiled peas and cream. Stir and mix to combine.
Continue to simmer the gravy for 5 to 6 minutes on a low heat.
If the consistency appears to be too thick, add some water to thin it slightly.
Finally add the sugar, salt and mix again. At this step, you can opt to sprinkle 2 to 3 pinches of garam masala powder.
Feel free to adjust the salt and sugar according to your taste.
If the consistency looks too thick for your liking, add a bit of water to thin the consistency slightly.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve Methi Matar Malai hot or warm with naan, paratha or roti.
description: Methi Matar Malai recipe is a rich and delicious North Indian curry made with fenugreek leaves, green peas, cream, onions, cashews and spices. Smooth and creamy this flavorful recipe is a surefire winner with kids and adults alike.

name: Paneer Lababdar (Restaurant Style Recipe)

ingredients.name: chopped tomatoes
ingredients.quantity: 1.5 cups (250 grams) ripe and red tomatoes that are not too tangy or sour are recommended for the tomato-cashew paste preparation.)

ingredients.name: red chili powder or kashmiri red chili powder or cayenne pepper
water
ingredients.quantity: 1 or 1.25 cups or add as required

ingredients.name: sugar
ingredients.quantity: ¼ to ½ teaspoon or add as required

ingredients.name: low-fat cream or heavy whipping cream
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup low-fat cream or 1 to 2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream

instructions: Take chopped tomatoes, cashews, chopped ginger and garlic, green cardamom, cloves and water in a small pan. Use tomatoes which are not too tangy or sour.
Turn on the stovetop and simmer this mixture on a low heat.
Cook until the tomatoes are softened. If the water dries up and the tomatoes are not softened, then add about 2 to 3 tablespoons water and continue to cook.
Allow this mixture to become warm or cool completely and add to a grinder or blender jar.
Grind to a smooth paste without any cashews or tomato chunks or pieces. You may add some water if required while grinding. Keep this ground tomato-cashew-spices paste aside.
Heat butter in pan or kadai or wok. Add the tej patta and sauté for a couple of seconds.
Add finely chopped onions. Stir well.
Then continue to saute as well as stir and cook till the onions become light golden or golden.
Then add the tomato-cashew-spices paste. The mixture will splutter if there is water in it, so be careful. Stir very well.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder and red chili powder.
Stir and saute this masala. You will see the masala clumping and gathering around itself.
Saute till you see fat leaving the sides of the masala paste.
Then add water. Mix very well.
Add the slit green chilies.
Stir and allow the gravy to come to a simmer. Then season with salt and sugar.
Add paneer cubes and grated paneer.
Gently mix and combine.
Then sprinkle kasuri methi which has been crushed with the garam masala powder. Stir very well again.
Lastly add the low-fat cream or heavy whipping cream. Switch off the heat & combine very well. You can also add 1 tablespoon butter at this step. This is optional.
Garnish paneer lababdar with chopped coriander leaves and ginger julienne. Serve with chapati, tandoori roti or naan. It also goes well with cumin rice or veg pulao.
To a small pan add chopped tomatoes, cashews, chopped ginger, chopped garlic cloves, green cardamom, cloves and water.
Switch on the stovetop and simmer this mixture on a low heat.
Cook until the tomatoes are softened. If the water dries up and the tomatoes are not softened, then add about 2 to 3 tablespoons water and continue to cook.
Allow this mixture to become warm or cool completely at room temperature. Transfer all of the ingredients to a grinder or blender jar.

Grind or blend to a smooth paste. There should not be any cashews or tomato chunks in the paste. You may add some water if required while grinding or blending. Set this ground tomato-cashew-spices paste aside.
Heat butter in a pan, kadai or wok. You can also use ghee (clarified butter) or a neutral-tasting oil. Heat the butter on a low to medium heat ensuring that it does not burn.
Add tej patta (Indian bay leaf) and saute for a couple of seconds.
Add finely chopped onions.
Stir and mix well.
Then continue to saute as well as stir and cook until the onions become light golden or golden on medium-low to medium heat.
Then add the tomato-cashew-spices paste. The mixture will splutter if there is water in it, so be careful.
Stir and mix thoroughly.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder and red chili powder.
Stir the ground spices. Saute this masala on low to medium-low heat. You will see the masala clumping and gathering around itself.
Sauté until you see fat leaving the sides of the masala paste. The masala will also look glossy and shiny.
Then add water to the perfectly sauteed masala.
Mix very well.
Add 1 or 2 slit green chilies.
Stir and allow the gravy to come to a simmer on medium-low to medium heat.
Then season with salt according to your taste preferences.
Add sugar. I added ½ teaspoon of sugar but you can add as per your taste.
Add paneer which has been cut into cubes or squares. Also add grated paneer. If using frozen paneer, then keep it in warm water for some minutes and then slice as well as grate it.
Gently mix and switch off the heat.
Then sprinkle kasuri methi (dry fenugreek leaves) which have been crushed along with garam masala powder. Mix very well again.
Add low fat cream or heavy whipping cream.
Mix again gently very well taking care that the paneer cubes do not break. You can also add 1 tablespoon of butter at this step or dot the gravy with butter while serving. This is optional.
Garnish paneer lababdar with chopped coriander leaves (cilantro) and ginger julienne.
description: Paneer Lababdar is an easy-to-prepare, restaurant-style curry of paneer (cottage cheese cubes) in a creamy, mildly tangy and faintly sweet gravy. This vegetarian Paneer Lababdar recipe is also naturally gluten-free.

ingredients.name: garlic cloves
ingredients.quantity: 3 to 4 small to medium sized, chopped or ½ teaspoon chopped garlic

ingredients.name: kashmir red chili powder
ingredients.quantity: 1 to 1.5 teaspoon or deghi mirch or sweet paprika

ingredients.name: paneer
ingredients.quantity: 250 to 300 grams cut into cubes or squares (cottage cheese)

ingredients.name: light cream
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup or cooking cream of low-fat cream

ingredients.name: sugar
ingredients.quantity: ½ teaspoon or add as required

instructions: First mix chopped onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, cashews, mace, cinnamon, cloves and cardamoms with 1 cup water in a medium saucepan.
Cook everything without a lid till the tomatoes and onions soften. Cook for about 14 to 15 minutes on a medium flame. Allow this mixture to cool.
When the ingredients are warm or cool, add everything including the stock (the water in which the ingredients were cooked) in a good blender or grinder. Grind to a smooth and fine paste.
Remember there should be no small pieces of cashews or spices. Everything should be ground very well till fine and smooth.
Heat butter in the same pan or another pan. Make sure the pan is dry when you add the butter. Add tejpatta (Indian bay leaf) and sauté for a few seconds.
Add the ground makhani paste. Stir well to mix with the butter
Add kashmiri red chili powder which gives a good color and is less spicy. You can also use deghi mirch or sweet paprika
Stir well and saute the masala on a medium heat.
Keep stirring often. You have to sauté the masala till you see the butter leaving the sides. It has to sautéed really well. This takes time but patience is the key.

Sauteing the masala paste takes about 20 to 22 mins on a medium to medium-high heat. Check the step by step photos (picture number 9) for the consistency of how the masala paste should be before you proceed to the next step.
Add slit green chilies, salt and water. Again stir very well to make an even curry mixture. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes.
Then add sugar and again stir. If you want to add honey instead of sugar then kindly check the notes section below.
Add the paneer cubes. Mix gently and switch off the heat.
Lastly add the light cream, crushed kasuri methi (dry fenugreek leaves) and garam masala powder.
Mix very well and switch off the heat. Check the taste of gravy and add more salt or sugar as needed.
Serve paneer makhanwala garnished with cream, grated paneer, ginger julienne, and cilantro leaves, hot or warm with naan or roti.
description: Paneer Makhanwala has soft paneer cubes (Indian cottage cheese) in a buttery, creamy, tangy, lightly sweet gravy or sauce made with onion, tomato, cashews, herbs and spices.

name: Sabudana Khichdi

ingredients.name: sabudana
ingredients.quantity: 2 cup (soaked for 5 hours, rinsed 3-4 times to remove excess starch, medium size preferred, check for no water at the bottom after soaking, should mash easily when pressed between fingers. If hard, sprinkle water and soak for 30 minutes more.)

ingredients.name: potato
ingredients.quantity: 1, chopped (boiled and diced potatoes are added to the khichdi. This helps to hasten the cooking process. But you may add them directly to the cooking pan or even microwave them before using them.)

instructions: In a large bowl take 2 cup sabudana and rinse in water for 3 to 4 times. Make sure to rub the sabudana to remove excess starch.
Add 1½ cup water. Dip the sago completely, and rest for 5 hours. Soaking time varies depending on the quality of Sabudana.

Once the Sabudana is soaked well, ensure there is no water at the bottom. Otherwise, the khichdi will turn mushy. The Sabudana must be able to mash easily when pressed between fingers. If it is still hard, sprinkle some water and soak for an additional 30 minutes.
Now, in a heavy-bottomed pan, roast ¼ cup of peanuts.
Roast on a low flame until the peanuts turn crunchy.
Cool completely, peel the skin and transfer to the mixer jar. Pulse and powder to a coarse peanut powder. Keep aside.
Now, in a large kadai, heat 2 tbsp ghee. Fry 2 tbsp peanuts till they turn golden brown, keep aside.
Also, fry 1 potato till it turns golden brown and crispy. Keep aside.
In the same ghee, splutter 1 tsp cumin and a few curry leaves. Add 1-inch ginger, 2 chili and saute well till the spices turn aromatic.
Furthermore, add the soaked sabudana, 1 tsp senda namak, crushed peanut powder and 1 tsp sugar.
Mix well, ensuring they are thoroughly combined.
Cover and cook until the sago pearls turn translucent.
Now add fried peanuts, potatoes, ½ lemon and 2 tbsp coriander. Mix well.
Finally, enjoy SABUDANA KHICHDI or pack it in your lunchbox.

name: Mutton Nihari

ingredients.name: Mutton
ingredients.quantity:
500g - 750g with bones or boneless (cut to 2 inch pieces. Bone-in pieces are preferred for flavor.) Use goat meat or lamb if you do not eat mutton. Adjust quantity to preference.)

Marination 1:
Ginger Garlic Paste – 2 tablespoons
Turmeric – ½ teaspoon
Red Chilli Powder – 1 teaspoon
Salt – 1 teaspoon (adjust to taste)
Lemon Juice – 1 tablespoon

Marination 2:
Onions – 2 large, finely chopped or pureed
Ginger Garlic Paste – 1 tablespoon
Green chilies – 2 to 3 slit or chopped
Red Chilli Powder – 1 to 2 teaspoons (adjust to taste)
Turmeric – ½ teaspoon
Coriander Powder – 2 teaspoons
Cumin Powder – 1 teaspoon
Garam Masala – ½ teaspoon
Nihari Masala – 2 to 3 tablespoons (adjust to taste. I used Shan Nihari Masala)
Salt – ½ to ¾ teaspoon (adjust to taste)

Other Ingredients:
Oil – 3 to 4 tablespoons (ghee or vegetable oil)
Whole Spices – 1 black cardamom, 1 inch cinnamon, 4 cloves, 2 green cardamoms
Wheat Flour (atta) – 2 to 3 tablespoons (for thickening. Do not use maida)
Water – 5 to 6 cups (or as needed)
Cilantro – 2 tablespoons chopped (for garnish)
Lemon wedges – for serving
Ginger – julienned for garnish (optional)
Fried onions – for garnish (optional)

Nihari Masala (Homemade, optional):
Cumin Seeds – 1 tablespoon
Coriander Seeds – 1 tablespoon
Fennel Seeds – 1 tablespoon
Dry Ginger Powder – 1 tablespoon
Black Peppercorns – 1 teaspoon
Long Pepper – 2 (pippali)
Black Cardamom – 1
Green Cardamom – 2
Cloves – 4
Nutmeg – ¼ (grated)
Mace – ¼ teaspoon
Dried Rose Petals – 1 tablespoon (optional)
Kashmiri Red Chilli – 1 (optional, for color)

For Tempering (Baghar):
Ghee – 2 tablespoons
Red Chilli Powder – ½ to 1 teaspoon (adjust to taste)

Optional Ingredients:
Bone marrow – from mutton bones (if available)
Saffron strands – a few (soaked in warm milk or water, for aroma and color)
Rose water – a few drops (for aroma)
Kewra water – a few drops (for aroma)
Edible silver leaves (varak) – for garnish (optional, for festive occasions)
Cream or yogurt – 1 to 2 tablespoons (for richness, optional)
Browned onions – for garnish (optional, for flavor and texture)
Mint leaves – for garnish (optional, for freshness)
Chaat masala – a pinch (for extra tang, optional)
Amchoor powder – a pinch (for sourness, optional)
Black salt – a pinch (for flavor, optional)

Serving Suggestions:
Naan, roti, or sheermal – for serving
Onions – sliced for serving
Lemon wedges – for serving
Green chilies – for serving
Cilantro – for serving
Ginger – julienned for serving
Fried onions – for serving
Chaat masala – for serving
Amchoor powder – for serving
Black salt – for serving

Tips & Notes:

Meat Quality: Use good quality mutton with some fat and bones for the best flavor. You can also use goat meat or lamb if you prefer.
Nihari Masala: Nihari masala is the key ingredient for the authentic taste. You can use store-bought or homemade nihari masala.
Thickening: Wheat flour (atta) is used to thicken the nihari. You can also use cornstarch or all-purpose flour (maida), but atta gives the best texture and flavor.
Slow Cooking: Slow cooking is essential for the mutton to become tender and the flavors to meld together. You can use a pressure cooker, slow cooker, or Dutch oven for slow cooking.
Tempering: Tempering with ghee and red chili powder adds a smoky and spicy flavor to the nihari. You can also add other spices like cumin seeds, mustard seeds, or curry leaves to the tempering.
Garnishing: Garnish with cilantro, ginger, lemon wedges, and fried onions for the best presentation and flavor.
Serving: Serve hot with naan, roti, or sheermal. You can also serve with sliced onions, lemon wedges, green chilies, and chaat masala.
Storage: Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat thoroughly before serving.
Freezing: Freeze in an airtight container for up to 2 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator before reheating.
Variations: You can add bone marrow, saffron, rose water, kewra water, edible silver leaves, cream, browned onions, mint leaves, chaat masala, amchoor powder, or black salt to customize the flavor and presentation of your nihari.

name: Masala Vada (Chana dal vada)

ingredients.name: Chana dal
ingredients.quantity: 1 cup (soaked overnight or for at least 4 hours, then drained well.)

instructions: Soak chana dal for at least 4 hours or overnight. Drain well.
Grind the soaked chana dal coarsely. Do not add water while grinding, or add very little if needed.
Transfer the ground dal to a mixing bowl.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, cilantro, fennel seeds, asafoetida, and salt.
Mix everything well.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadai.
Take a small portion of the mixture and shape it into a small vada (fritter).
Gently slide the vada into the hot oil.
Fry the vadas on medium heat until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Remove the vadas from the oil and drain on a paper towel.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce of your choice.

name: Aloo Kofta Recipe (Potato Kofta Curry)

ingredients.name: potatoes
ingredients.quantity: 250 grams or 2 large or 3 medium potatoes or 1.25 cups tightly packed mashed potatoes

ingredients.name: processed cheese
ingredients.quantity: 20 grams or ¼ cup grated cheese, substitute paneer instead of cheese

ingredients.name: corn starch
ingredients.quantity: 1.5 to 2 tablespoon – (substitutes are bread crumbs or rice flour), add accordingly

ingredients.name: oil
ingredients.quantity: 4 to 5 tablespoon for shallow frying koftas

ingredients.name: onion
ingredients.quantity: 100 grams or 1 large or 2 medium onion – quartered

ingredients.name: tomatoes
ingredients.quantity: 200 grams or 2 large or 3 medium tomatoes

ingredients.name: tej patta (Indian bay leaf)
ingredients.quantity: 2 small or 1 medium to large tej patta

ingredients.name: ginger garlic paste
ingredients.quantity: 1 teaspoon or 1 inch ginger and 3 to 4 small to medium garlic cloves – crushed to a paste in mortar-pestle

ingredients.name: kashmiri chilli powder
ingredients.quantity: ½ teaspoon or deghi mirch or sweet paprika

ingredients.name: sugar
ingredients.quantity: ¼ to ½ teaspoon or add as required

instructions: First boil or steam the potatoes until they are thoroughly cooked. Allow them to become warm.
Opt to cook potatoes in a pan, steamer, instant pot or a stovetop pressure cooker, adding water as required.
In another pan or bowl, heat water until it boils and add the tomatoes, onion (quartered) and almonds. Turn off the heat.
Instead of almonds, you can use cashews.
Cover with lid and set aside to blanch for 20 minutes.
You can opt to heat water in a pan, electric heater or microwave.
After 20 minutes of blanching, drain all the water. Set the onions, tomatoes and almonds aside.
Roughly chop the onions, tomatoes and add to a grinder or blender.
Also peel the almonds and add to the grinder or blender.
Grind to a smooth and fine paste without adding water. Set this curry paste aside.
When the potatoes, become warm, peel them. Mash very well with a potato masher.
Grate the processed cheese.
Now add the grated cheese, cornstarch, salt and crushed black pepper to the mashed potatoes.
Mix very well.
Shape to medium sized patties.
Heat 4 tablespoons oil in a tawa or flat skillet. First place a small portion of the mixture to check if it breaks or not.
If the tiny kofta does not break, then you can safely place the koftas in the hot oil.
If breaking, then add more cornstarch to bind the mixture and form the patties.
Turn over when one side gets golden.
Fry the other side and flip again to get an even golden color. You can also air-fry these potato kofta instead of shallow frying.
Place the aloo koftas which are done on kitchen paper towels. Continue frying the ones which are not done. Set the koftas aside.
Add 2 tablespoons oil to a sauté pan or a pot. Add the cumin seeds and tej patta. Let the cumin seeds splutter.
Next add the finely ground tomato-onion-almond paste.
Stir and mix very well. Add ginger-garlic paste and mix again.
Next add the spice powders – turmeric powder, kashmiri chili powder or deghi mirch or coriander powder.
Stir and sauté until the mixture thickens and you see oil specks releasing from the sides and top of the mixture.
Add water. Mix very well and bring the aloo kofta gravy to a simmer for 3 to 4 minutes.
Add salt and sugar. Stir to combine.
Next add cream, garam masala powder and crushed dry fenugreek leaves (kasuri methi).
Mix very well and turn off the stovetop.
Pour the hot curry or gravy in a serving plate or bowl. Place the aloo kofta on the gravy.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve Aloo Kofta with roti, naan or jeera rice.
description: Aloo Kofta are potato and cheese patties or koftas dunked in a creamy, rich, tangy and perfectly spiced makhani gravy or sauce. The makhani curry base is made with tomatoes, almonds, spices, herbs and cream. Serve this rich Potato Kofta Curry with Naan, Roti, Paratha or with steamed rice.

name: Aloo Gobi Matar

ingredients.name: oil
ingredients.quantity:
2 tablespoons oil

▢

½ teaspoon cumin seeds

▢

2 small tej patta or 1 medium tej patta

▢

¼ cup onions – chopped

▢

½ teaspoon turmeric powder (ground turmeric)

▢

½ teaspoon red chili powder or cayenne pepper or paprika

▢

½ teaspoon garam masala

▢

1 teaspoon coriander powder (ground coriander)

▢

2 cups cauliflower – chopped in florets

▢

2 cups potatoes – peeled and chopped

▢

1 or 1¼ cup green peas – fresh or frozen

▢

1 or 2 green chillies – slit

▢

3 cups water or add as required

▢

1 teaspoon dried fenugreek leaves – crushed (kasuri methi)

▢

1 to 2 tablespoons coriander leaves – chopped (cilantro), for garnish

▢
salt as required

For the curry masala paste

▢

½ cup onions – chopped

▢

1½ cups tomatoes – chopped

▢

1 inch ginger

▢

3 to 4 garlic cloves – medium-sized
INSTRUCTIONS
Preparation
Firstly, rinse and chop all the vegetables.
Keep the cauliflower florets in hot salted water for 15 to 20 minutes. Then, drain the florets and keep aside.
Blend the the onion, tomatoes, ginger and garlic till fine and smooth in a blender with no water or very little water.
Making aloo gobi matar
Heat oil in a pan. Keeping the heat to low fry the cumin seeds with bay leaves first. Fry cumin seeds until they crackle in the hot oil.
Add the chopped onions and fry stirring often till lightly browned. Next add the ground onion-tomato curry paste.
Stir to combine and then add the following ground spice powders, one by one – turmeric powder, red chili powder,
coriander powder and garam masala powder.
Fry the curry masala paste on low to medium-low heat until the oil starts to leave the sides of the masala paste. Keep on stirring so that the masala does not stick to the pan. This might take around 7 to 9 minutes.
Now, add the cauliflower florets, potatoes and peas. Then add 3 cups of water and mix thoroughly.
Finally, add the slit green chilies and salt. Let the curry come to a boil. Do check in between when the curry is simmering and the veggies are getting cooked.
Then, cover with a lid and let the curry simmer till the vegetables are fork tender. When the veggies are tender and softened, finally, add the crushed dried fenugreek leaves. Gently stir to mix.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve Aloo Gobi Matar hot with roti, paratha or steamed rice.
DASSANA’S NOTES
You can also cook this curry in a stove-top pressure cooker or Instant Pot. For cooking in a stove-top pressure cooker or instant pot, add 2 or 2.5 cups water instead of 3 cups water.
Adjust the ground spices according to your taste preferences.

instructions: Firstly, rinse and chop all the vegetables.
Keep the cauliflower florets in hot salted water for 15 to 20 minutes. Then, drain the florets and keep aside.
Blend the the onion, tomatoes, ginger and garlic till fine and smooth in a blender with no water or very little water.
Heat oil in a pan. Keeping the heat to low fry the cumin seeds with bay leaves first. Fry cumin seeds until they crackle in the hot oil.
Add the chopped onions and fry stirring often till lightly browned. Next add the ground onion-tomato curry paste.

Stir to combine and then add the following ground spice powders, one by one – turmeric powder, red chili powder,
coriander powder and garam masala powder.

Fry the curry masala paste on low to medium-low heat until the oil starts to leave the sides of the masala paste. Keep on stirring so that the masala does not stick to the pan. This might take around 7 to 9 minutes.
Now, add the cauliflower florets, potatoes and peas. Then add 3 cups of water and mix thoroughly.
Finally, add the slit green chilies and salt. Let the curry come to a boil. Do check in between when the curry is simmering and the veggies are getting cooked.
Then, cover with a lid and let the curry simmer till the vegetables are fork tender. When the veggies are tender and softened, finally, add the crushed dried fenugreek leaves. Gently stir to mix.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve Aloo Gobi Matar hot with roti, paratha or steamed rice.

name: Hyderabadi Mirchi Ka Salan

ingredients.name: green chilies
ingredients.quantity: 10 to 12 or 5 to 6 large sized chillies (not of the hot variety )

ingredients.name: tamarind
ingredients.quantity: 1 tablespoon soaked in ⅓ cup hot water

ingredients.name: onions
ingredients.quantity: ⅓ cup thinly sliced or 1 medium-sized onion

ingredients.name: red chili powder or cayenne pepper
water
ingredients.quantity: ½ cup for grinding or add as required

instructions: In a pan add 1 tablespoon oil.
Add sliced onions. Stirring often sauté onions until lightly browned.
Next add the desiccated coconut. Mix and sauté until the coconut turns light golden.
Later, add roasted peanuts and sesame seeds to this mixture and roast for 1 to 2 minutes on low heat
Make a smooth paste of the above roasted mixture with garlic cloves, ginger and all the ground spice powders with ½ cup water.
In a small bowl, soak tamarind with ⅓ cup hot water for 20 to 30 minutes.
When the tamarind has softened, squeeze the tamarind pulp in the water in the bowl. Keep the tamarind water aside.
Remove the green chilli crowns or you can also keep them intact.
Rinse and wipe dry the green chillies.
Slit the chillies vertically, but do not break them. You can opt to remove the seeds from the chillies if you prefer.
Heat about 2 tablespoons oil in a pan. Fry the chillies lightly until you see some blisters on them.
Remove and drain on kitchen paper towels.
Now, in the same pan add 2 tablespoons oil. Fry the mustard seeds on low heat till they crackle.
Then, add nigella seeds, cumin seeds and curry leaves. Fry for a minute.
Add the ground masala paste. Sauté for 3 to 4 minutes on low to medium-low heat or till the oil floats on the top and sides of the masala.
Now, add tamarind pulp and 1.5 or 2 cups water. Stir to combine. Simmer for 5 minutes on low to medium-low heat.
Add fried green chilies, salt and simmer for 5 to 6 minutes more.
Garnish with coriander leaves.
Serve Mirchi Ka Salan hot with veg biryani, plain steamed rice or any Indian flatbread.
description: A Hyderabadi special, Mirchi Ka Salan is a lightly spiced, creamy and slightly tangy curry made with green chillies in a gravy base of nuts, seeds and aromatics. This dish is a must-have with a Biryani in Hyderabad.

name: Palak Corn Recipe (Curried Spinach & Corn)

ingredients.name: spinach (palak)
ingredients.quantity: 1 bunch (250 grams yields approx 2 to 2.5 cups spinach puree )

ingredients.name: water
ingredients.quantity: 4 to 5 cups (for boiling the water and blanching the spinach )

ingredients.name: ice cold water or chilled water
ingredients.quantity: 2 to 3 cups (for adding the blanched spinach leaves )

ingredients.name: red chili powder or cayenne pepper
light cream or cooking cream (20% to 25% low fat cream)

instructions: In a small grinder or blender, add all the ingredients listed under "Masala paste" above.
Grind or blend to a smooth paste. Add very little water if required while grinding.
Keep this masala paste aside.
Rinse the spinach very well in water. Boil water with ½ teaspoon salt. Let the water comes to a boil. Then switch off the flame. Immediately add the spinach leaves to this hot water.
And let the spinach leaves be immersed in the water for 2 to 3 minutes.
Drain the water and quickly pour ice water over the spinach or immerse the spinach in ice cold or cold water. Keep for 2 to 3 minutes.
Drain the ice cold water or remove the blanched spinach leaves with the help of pasta tongs and place them in a blender.
Blend to a semi-fine or smooth spinach puree adding very little water, if needed. Set aside.
First steam or boil the corn kernels and keep aside. You can choose to steam the raw corn kernels or corn cobs in a pan or steamer or stovetop pressure cooker or Instant Pot.
In the step wise instructions above I have detailed the steps to cook corn kernels in a stovetop pressure cooker. You can also use canned corn kernels to cut down on cooking time.
After you have cooked the corn kernels drain all the water from them and set aside.
For the cooked corn cobs, let them cool completely. Then carefully remove the corn kernels with a knife.
Heat oil or butter or ghee in a thick bottomed pan. Fry the cumin first till they crackle, become aromatic and are browned.
Now add the ground masala paste and mix very well.
Then add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, asafoetida and garam masala powder.
Keep on stirring and sautéing the masala, till the oil starts to leave the sides of the paste.
When you see that the oil has started leaving the sides of the masala paste and its color has changed, the paste has thickened and have become glossy, then add the spinach puree. Mix very well.
Then pour water and season with salt as required. Simmer the curry for 6 to 7 minutes on a low heat. Later add the boiled corn kernels and simmer for 1 to 2 minutes more.
Whip or beat cream till smooth in a bowl with a wired whisk or spoon.
Now add cream and dry fenugreek leaves. Stir and cook further for ½ to 1 minute.
Garnish with ginger julienne and serve corn palak hot with naan, roti, paratha or jeera rice or steamed rice.
description: This curried Palak Corn recipe is a rich, saucy preparation that's made with fresh spinach and sweet corn. It is lightly spiced and perfectly creamy, and great to pair with classic Indian sides.

name: Masala Dum Arbi

Temper with mustard oil, ajwain, ginger, salt, and black salt.

Prepare gravy with mustard oil, heeng, ajwain, cumin, garlic, ginger, green chilli, onion, water, turmeric, kashmiri chilli powder, coriander powder, salt, black salt, curd, tomato, water, kasoori methi, coriander, and garam masala powder.
Cook arbi on "Dum" in the gravy.

name: Caramel Kheer
instructions: Start with full-fat milk, ghee, unsoaked rice, sugar, and mixed nuts.
For Classic White Kheer: Boil milk, add rice, and cook until rice is soft.
Add sugar and nuts to the classic kheer and simmer until desired consistency is reached.
For Caramel Kheer: Caramelize sugar in a pan without burning it.
Add caramelized sugar to the boiling milk.
Add rice to the caramel milk and cook until soft.
Add nuts to the caramel kheer and simmer until desired consistency is reached.
description: Two variations of Kheer (Rice Pudding): Classic White and Caramel. The caramel version is creamier and nuttier.

name: Lasooni Palak Paneer

ingredients.name: Spinach leaves
ingredients.quantity:
500-700 gms (पालक ) - 500 gms - 700 gms

Salt (नमक) - a large pinch

For Chilli Garlic Oil:

instructions: Want to know the secret to that bright green, restaurant-style Palak Paneer? It’s all about the Ice Bath and the Double Garlic Tadka! 🟢🧄

In this video, I’m sharing my authentic recipe for Lasooni Palak Paneer. Unlike regular Palak Paneer, this version uses "burnt" garlic (Lasoon) to infuse a smoky, nutty flavor that completely transforms the dish. No heavy cream needed—just pure flavor!

In this video, you will learn: 
✅ How to keep spinach bright green (blanching hack). 
✅ The difference between Saag and Palak Paneer. 
✅ How to make the perfect "Burnt Garlic" Tadka. 
✅ Tips for soft, melt-in-your-mouth Paneer.

name: Mirch Ajwain Paratha
instructions: Knead a medium-soft dough using salt, water, and whole wheat flour.
Let the dough rest for 5 minutes.
After resting, cut the dough into small portions (pedas), roll them in dry flour, and let them rest for an additional 2 minutes.
Roll each portion out into discs with light pressure to ensure they spread evenly.
Spread ghee on top of each disc and sprinkle it with salt, carom seeds, coriander powder, and chili flakes.
Shape the discs as demonstrated in the video.
Heat some ghee in a tawa (flat pan), and cook the parathas on both sides until they puff up and turn golden brown.
Your mirch ajwain ka parantha is ready to be enjoyed!
description: Mirchi Ajwain Paratha is a flavorful Indian flatbread made with whole wheat flour and seasoned with chili flakes and carom seeds.

instructions: Soak the kala chana overnight.
In the morning, grind the soaked kala chana.
Chop the vegetables (green chillies, ginger, carrots, beans, onions, curry leaves).
Mix the ground kala chana with the chopped vegetables, cumin, salt, turmeric, gram flour, and curd.
Add water to adjust the consistency.
Heat oil on a pan.
Pour a ladleful of the batter onto the hot pan and spread to form a pancake (chilla).
Cook until golden brown on both sides.

name: Suji Halwa 2 Ways

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.quantity: 4 cups (for classic halwa syrup) + 4 cups (for caramel banana halwa syrup) = 8 cups total, divided as needed for each recipe's syrup preparation steps below.  Note: The recipe calls for two separate syrups, one for each halwa type.  Adjust quantity accordingly when preparing either halwa type individually, using only the water amount specified for that particular syrup preparation step below (either 4 cups for the classic halwa syrup or 4 cups for the caramel banana halwa syrup).  Do not combine these quantities unless making both halwa types simultaneously.)

ingredients.name: Sugar
ingredients.quantity: 1 cup (for classic halwa syrup) + ¾ cup (for caramel banana halwa syrup), divided as needed for each recipe's syrup preparation steps below.  Note: The recipe calls for two separate syrups, one for each halwa type.  Adjust quantity accordingly when preparing either halwa type individually, using only the sugar amount specified for that particular syrup preparation step below (either 1 cup for the classic halwa syrup or ¾ cup for the caramel banana halwa syrup).  Do not combine these quantities unless making both halwa types simultaneously.)

ingredients.name: Ghee
ingredients.quantity: ¾ cup (for classic halwa) + ¾ cup (for caramel banana halwa) + 1 tbsp (optional for classic halwa) + 1 tbsp (optional for caramel banana halwa), divided as needed for each recipe's halwa preparation steps below.  Note: The recipe calls for two separate halwa preparations, one classic and one caramel banana.  Adjust quantity accordingly when preparing either halwa type individually, using only the ghee amounts specified for that particular halwa preparation step below (either ¾ cup + 1 tbsp optional for the classic halwa, or ¾ cup + 1 tbsp optional for the caramel banana halwa).  Do not combine these quantities unless making both halwa types simultaneously.)

ingredients.name: Semolina (Suji)
ingredients.quantity: 1 cup (for classic halwa) + 1 cup (for caramel banana halwa) = 2 cups total, divided as needed for each recipe's halwa preparation steps below.  Note: The recipe calls for two separate halwa preparations, one classic and one caramel banana.  Adjust quantity accordingly when preparing either halwa type individually, using only the semolina amount specified for that particular halwa preparation step below (either 1 cup for the classic halwa or 1 cup for the caramel banana halwa).  Do not combine these quantities unless making both halwa types simultaneously.)

ingredients.name: Mixed nuts, chopped
ingredients.quantity: handful (for classic halwa) + handful (for caramel banana halwa) = 2 handfuls total, divided as needed for each recipe's halwa preparation steps below.  Note: The recipe calls for two separate halwa preparations, one classic and one caramel banana.  Adjust quantity accordingly when preparing either halwa type individually, using only the mixed nuts amount specified for that particular halwa preparation step below (either 1 handful for the classic halwa or 1 handful for the caramel banana halwa).  Do not combine these quantities unless making both halwa types simultaneously.)

ingredients.name: Cardamom powder
ingredients.quantity: ½ tsp (for classic halwa) + ½ tsp (for caramel banana halwa) = 1 tsp total, divided as needed for each recipe's halwa preparation steps below.  Note: The recipe calls for two separate halwa preparations, one classic and one caramel banana.  Adjust quantity accordingly when preparing either halwa type individually, using only the cardamom powder amount specified for that particular halwa preparation step below (either ½ tsp for the classic halwa or ½ tsp for the caramel banana halwa).  Do not combine these quantities unless making both halwa types simultaneously.)

instructions: Classic Suji Halwa: For Syrup - Combine water and sugar in a pot. Heat until sugar dissolves and syrup is formed.
Classic Suji Halwa: For Halwa - Heat ghee in a pan. Add semolina and roast until golden brown.
Classic Suji Halwa: Add chopped almonds, cashewnut, and mixed nuts. Mix well.
Classic Suji Halwa: Add cardamom powder and the prepared syrup. Mix until the halwa thickens.
Classic Suji Halwa: Add optional ghee for extra richness. Serve hot.
Caramel Banana Suji Halwa: For Syrup - Heat sugar in a pan until it caramelizes. Add water carefully and dissolve the caramel.
Caramel Banana Suji Halwa: For Halwa - Heat ghee in a pan. Add semolina and roast until golden brown.
Caramel Banana Suji Halwa: Add mashed banana and mixed nuts. Mix well.
Caramel Banana Suji Halwa: Add cardamom powder and the prepared caramel syrup. Mix until the halwa thickens.
Caramel Banana Suji Halwa: Add optional ghee for extra richness. Serve hot.

name: Masala Aloo Sandwich

ingredients.name: Chaat masala
ingredients.quantity: 2 tsp + a large pinch (for fried chilli)

instructions: Heat oil in a pan.
Add dry red chilli, mustard seeds, and cumin.
Add heeng, chopped onion, ginger, and green chilli.
Add curry leaves.
Add boiled and mashed potato.
Add salt, turmeric, chilli powder, coriander, and chaat masala.
Mix well and cook the filling.
Apply butter on bread slices.
Spread green chutney on bread slices.
Place the aloo filling on bread slices.
Cover with another bread slice.
Grill the sandwiches with butter until golden brown and crispy.
For fried chilli, heat oil in a pan.
Add slit green chillies and chaat masala.
Fry until blistered.
Serve the masala aloo sandwich with fried chilli.

name: Bhakarwadi
instructions: Make Imli Chutney: Boil water, add tamarind, sugar, salt, black salt, Kashmiri chilli powder, cumin, roasted & pounded.
For the Dough: Mix all purpose flour, gram flour, salt, carom seed, oil, and water as required.
For Filling: Mix cumin seed, coriander seed, fennel seeds, sesame seeds, desiccated coconut, salt, chilli powder, turmeric, asafoetida, ginger powder, sugar, and Imli chutney.
Strain Chutney.
Shape Bhakarwadi.
Fry Bhakarwadi.
Tips & Tricks.

name: Kaddu Ki Sabzi
instructions: Heat mustard oil in a pan.
Add dried red chillies, fenugreek seeds, fennel seeds, and bay leaves.
Add asafoetida, chopped green chillies, and chopped ginger.
Add diced pumpkin and salt to taste.
Add black salt, turmeric powder, Kashmiri chilli powder, cumin powder, and coriander powder.
Add amchur and sugar.
Add water and cook until the pumpkin is tender.
Garnish with chopped coriander, kasoori methi leaves, and garam masala.
description: Sweet and sour pumpkin recipe

instructions: Mix all dals together.

name: Laccha Aloo Pancakes with Chilli Cheese Sauce
instructions: Grate the potatoes.
Strain the grated potatoes.
Add coriander seeds, cumin, salt, asafoetida, green chillies, chilli flakes, ginger, fresh coriander, and chaat masala to the potatoes.
Mix well.
Heat oil in a pan.
Make laccha aloo pancakes and shallow fry slowly.
For the cheese sauce, melt butter in a pan.
Add all-purpose flour and cook for a minute.
Gradually add milk, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Add Kashmiri chilli powder and cheese.
Cook until the sauce thickens.
Serve the laccha aloo pancakes with the chilli cheese sauce.

name: Kesar Badam Katli
instructions: 1. Boil the almonds for 1 minute and then peel them.
2. Soak the peeled almonds in 1 cup of water for 2-3 hours.
3. In a pan, add 1 cup of sugar and ¾ cup of water. Cook until you get a one-string consistency syrup.
4. Add a generous pinch of saffron to the syrup and mix well.
5. Grind the soaked almonds into a fine paste.
6. In a pan, add 2 tbsp of ghee and roast the almond paste on low heat until it starts to leave the sides of the pan.
7. Pour the sugar syrup into the almond paste and mix continuously until it forms a dough-like consistency.
8. Add 5 crushed cardamoms and mix well.
9. Transfer the mixture onto a greased tray or parchment paper and spread it evenly.
10. Let it set for a few hours until it cools down and becomes firm.
11. Cut the set katli into desired shapes (diamond or square).
12. Demold the katli pieces and serve.
description: Kesar Badam Katli is a simple, delicious, and easy-to-make recipe perfect for Rakshabandhan.

name: Paneer Schezwan

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.quantity: 1½ cups (for Chilli Paste ) + ½ cup (for Schezwan Sauce) + 1 cup (for Schezwan Sauce) + a dash (for Schezwan Sauce )

ingredients.name: Ginger
ingredients.quantity: 1½” piece (for Chilli Paste ) + 1 tbsp (for Schezwan Sauce)

ingredients.name: Garlic cloves
ingredients.quantity: 5-6 nos (for Chilli Paste ) + 1 tbsp (for Schezwan Sauce)

ingredients.name: Oil
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup (for Chilli Paste ) + 3 tbsp (for Schezwan Sauce) + for frying

ingredients.name: Schezwan pepper, crushed
ingredients.quantity: 2 tsp (for Chilli Paste ) + 2 tsp (for Marination) + 1 tsp (for Schezwan Sauce)

ingredients.name: Chilli paste
ingredients.quantity: 2-3 tbsp (for Chilli Paste ) + 2-3 tbsp (for Schezwan Sauce)

ingredients.name: Cornflour
ingredients.quantity: 3-4 tbsp (for Chilli Paste ) + 3 tbsp (for Marination) + 1 tbsp (for Schezwan Sauce)

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.quantity: 1 tsp (for Marination) + to taste (for Schezwan Sauce)

instructions: Make Chilli Paste: Boil water and add dried Kashmiri Chillies, Ginger, Garlic cloves.
Grind the mixture to a paste.
In a pan, add oil, Schezwan pepper, crushed, Chilli paste and cook for a while.
Add Cornflour and cook until the paste thickens.
Marinate Paneer: In a bowl, add Paneer cubes, Schezwan pepper, crushed, Salt, Light Soya sauce and Cornflour.
Mix well and keep aside for marination.
Make Schezwan Sauce: In a pan, add oil, Schezwan Pepper crushed, Garlic chopped, Ginger chopped, Chilli paste and saute.
Add Onion and Capsicum and saute.
Add Water, Tomato Ketchup, Vinegar, Light Soya sauce, Salt and cook.
Add Cornflour mixed with water and cook until the sauce thickens.
Fry Paneer: Heat oil in a pan and fry the marinated paneer until golden brown.
Add the fried paneer to the Schezwan sauce and mix well.
Garnish with Spring onion, chopped.
description: Schezwan Paneer recipe with loads of flavors and desi chinese tadka.

name: No Onion No Garlic Malai Kofta

ingredients.name: Oil
ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp + 1 tbsp for finishing + for frying kofta's (approximate amount not specified in the recipe). Assuming vegetable oil or similar neutral oil for cooking and frying purposes.  Estimate based on common usage for such recipes.)

ingredients.name: Ginger
ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp roughly chopped + 2 tsp chopped for finishing

instructions: Heat oil and butter in a pan for the curry.
Add cinnamon stick, bay leaf, cloves, cardamom, and black cardamom.
Add roughly chopped ginger and green chillies.
Add roughly chopped tomatoes and cashewnuts.
Add salt to taste, turmeric, coriander powder, cumin powder, and Kashmiri chilli powder.
Add ½ cup of water and cook until the tomatoes are soft and the gravy thickens.
For the kofta, mash paneer and boiled potato.
Add chopped green chilli, ginger, toasted and chopped cashewnuts, and chopped coriander.
Add salt to taste and cornstarch. Mix well to form a dough.
Shape the dough into 15 koftas, each weighing approximately 40 gms.
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Fry the koftas until golden brown.
For finishing, heat oil and butter in a pan.
Add slit green chillies and chopped ginger.
Add 2 cups of water, salt to taste, Kasoori Methi powder, and sugar.
Add the fried koftas and let them simmer in the gravy.
Finish with fresh cream.

name: Spice Shikanji 4 Ways - Lychee, Jamun, Mango & Spice
instructions: For Shikanji masala, dry roast cumin and coriander seeds. Once cooled, add black pepper, cloves, dry ginger powder, mint powder, black salt and salt. Grind to a fine powder and set aside.
For Masala Shikanji: In a glass, add sugar, mint leaves, shikanji masala, water and lemon juice. Mix well.
Add ice cubes and chilled water. Garnish with lemon wedges.
For Lychee Shikanji: In a blender, add lychee, lemon juice and chilled water. Blend well.
Strain the mixture and add shikanji masala, sugar and basil seeds. Mix well.
Garnish with lemon wedges.
For Jamun Shikanji: In a blender, add jamun, sugar, shikanji masala, lemon juice and mint leaves. Blend well.
Add ice cubes and chilled water. Mix well.
For Mango Shikanji: In a blender, add mango, lemon juice, sugar, shikanji masala and chilled water. Blend well.
Add ice cubes and mix well.

name: Chilli Garlic Pasta (Desi Twist)
instructions: Boil water with 2 tbsp salt.
Add spaghetti pasta and 1 tbsp salt to the boiling water.
Cook pasta until al dente.
In a pan, melt butter.
Add chopped garlic and green chilli, saute.
Add chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Add all-purpose flour and cook for a minute.
Add Kashmiri chilli powder and mix well.
Gradually add milk, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Add salt to taste.
Add chopped coriander and grated cheese.
Mix well until the cheese melts and the sauce thickens.
Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and mix well.
Serve hot, garnished with more cheese and coriander if desired.
description: Chilli Garlic Pasta with a Desi Twist, infusing Indian spices into a classic pasta dish.

name: Aloo Jeera - 3 Ways

ingredients.name: Potato, large, boiled
ingredients.quantity: 4 nos (Simple Aloo Jeera), 4-5 nos (Heeng Jeera Aloo), 40 nos baby potatoes (Masala Jeera Aloo, boiled )

ingredients.name: Desi Ghee
ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp (Simple Aloo Jeera), 2.5 tbsp (Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Ginger, chopped
ingredients.quantity: 2 tsp (Simple Aloo Jeera & Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Green chilli, chopped
ingredients.quantity: 2 nos (Simple Aloo Jeera & Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Red chili powder
ingredients.quantity: 1 tsp (Simple Aloo Jeera & Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Onion, medium
ingredients.quantity: 3 nos (Heeng Jeera Aloo), 1 cup chopped (Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Chaat masala
ingredients.quantity: 1 tbsp (Heeng Jeera Aloo & Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Kasoori Methi Powder
ingredients.quantity: 2 pinches (Heeng Jeera Aloo), a large pinch (Masala Jeera Aloo)

instructions: Simple Aloo Jeera: Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds and dry red chilli (optional).
Add ginger, green chilli, and boiled potato cubes.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and amchur powder. Mix well.
Garnish with chopped coriander.
Heeng Jeera Aloo: Heat mustard oil in a pan, add heeng and cumin seeds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add boiled potato cubes, salt, black salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, chaat masala, and chilli flakes. Mix well.
Add kasoori methi powder and chopped coriander. Mix well.
Masala Jeera Aloo: Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, ginger, green chilli, and garlic.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add boiled baby potatoes, salt, chaat masala, garam masala, and water. Mix well.
Add kasoori methi and chopped coriander. Mix well.

name: Chicken Jalfrezi

ingredients.name: Chicken breast
ingredients.quantity: 600 gms (cut into large size strips), Chicken 1 1/2 tsp Degi red chili powder, 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp Coriander powder, Salt to taste, 2 tsp Curd (beaten)

instructions: In a bowl, add chicken, degi red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, salt to taste, curd and mix it well.
Keep it aside to marinate for a while.
In a handi, add ghee, oil, once it's hot, add bay leaf, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, onion and saute until onions are translucent.
Add crushed black peppercorns and mix it well.
Add tomato puree, ginger garlic paste and cook it for 4-5 minutes until oil is separated from the masala.
Add degi red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder and cook it for a minute.
Add little water, salt to taste and give it a quick boil.
Add marinated chicken, water, ghee, cover it with a lid and let it cook for a while until cooked well.
Add onion, tender coriander stems, fresh coriander leaves and give it a good mix.
Add capsicum, tomatoes and toss it well.
Finish it with fresh cream, ghee and give it a good mix.
Transfer it to a serving dish, garnish it with fresh cream and coriander sprig.
Serve hot with roti or naan.

name: Egg Ghee Roast

ingredients.name: Ghee
ingredients.quantity: 2-3 tbsp + 3-4 heaped tbsp + 2-3 tbsp (for stock and Anda Ghee Roast )

ingredients.name: Tender Coriander stem
ingredients.quantity: ½ tbsp (chopped) + ½ tbsp (finely chopped), धनिया के डंठल

instructions: In a stock pot, add ghee, once it's hot, add onions and saute for 2-4 minutes.
Add tender coriander stem, black peppercorn, black cardamom, water, cashewnut, salt to taste, tamarind and simmer it for a while.
Blend the mixture with the help of a hand blender and grind it to smooth puree.
Strain the stock and keep it aside for further use.
In a bowl, add soaked bedgi dry red chillies and garlic cloves.
Transfer it to a grinder jar and grind into a smooth paste.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a handi, add ghee, once it's hot, add cinnamon stick, prepared paste and saute it for 4-5 minutes.
Gradually add stock, salt to taste, curry leaves and cook it on medium flames for a while.
Add ghee and let it simmer until oil is separated.
Add boiled eggs and cook it well.
Transfer it to a serving dish and garnish it with coriander sprig.
Serve hot with lachha paratha or neer dosa.

name: Malai Pyaaz Ki Sabji

ingredients.name: large Onions (cut into quarters)
ingredients.quantity: 3 no. large onions (cut into quarters), प्याज (for Smoked Onions) + 2 large onions (cut into quarters), प्याज (for Malai Pyaaz ke sabji )

ingredients.name: Ginger
ingredients.quantity: 2 inch Ginger (peeled & roughly chopped), अदरक (For Ginger Green chilli Paste)

ingredients.name: Green chillies (less spicy & roughly chopped)
ingredients.quantity: 5 no. Green chillies (less spicy & roughly chopped), हरी मिर्च (For Ginger Green chilli Paste)

ingredients.name: Coriander powder
ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp Coriander powder, धनिया पाउडर (For Curd Mixture)

ingredients.name: Turmeric powder
ingredients.quantity: ½ tsp Turmeric powder, हल्दी पाउडर (For Curd Mixture)

ingredients.name: Degi red chilli powder
ingredients.quantity: 1 tbsp Degi red chilli powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर (For Curd Mixture)

ingredients.name: Oil
ingredients.quantity: 2-3 tbsp Oil, तेल (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji) + 2 tbsp Oil, तेल (For Frying Nuts)

ingredients.name: Cumin seeds
ingredients.quantity: ½ tsp Cumin seeds, जीरा (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji)

ingredients.name: Fennel seeds
ingredients.quantity: ½ tsp Fennel seeds, सौंफ (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji)

ingredients.name: Black cardamom
ingredients.quantity: 3 no. Black cardamom, बड़ी इलायची (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji)

ingredients.name: Bay leaf
ingredients.quantity: 3 no. Bay leaf, तेज पत्ता (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji)

ingredients.name: Button chillies
ingredients.quantity: 6-7 no. Button chillies, बटन मिर्च (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji)

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.quantity: Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji)

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.quantity: Little water, पानी (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji)

ingredients.name: Fresh cream
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup Fresh cream, ताज़ा मलाई (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji)

ingredients.name: Cashew nuts
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup Cashewnuts, काजू (For Frying Nuts) + Fried Cashew nuts, तले हुए काजू (For Malai Pyaaz ke sabji and Garnish)

instructions: Take a cooking rack, add onions and place onto the gas range.
Cook it for 2-3 minutes on high flames until onions get charred and brown in colour.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a bowl, add curd, prepared ginger green chili paste, coriander powder, degi red chili powder, turmeric powder and give it a good mix.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a mortar pestle, add green chillies, ginger and grind it into a coarse paste.
Keep it aside for further use.

In a kadai or handi, add oil, once it's hot, add cumin seeds, fennel seeds, black cardamom, bay leaf, button chillies, prepared curd mixture and cook it for 5-6 minutes until oil is separated from the gravy.
Add salt to taste, smoked onions, onions, little water, cover it with the lid and let it cook for a while.
Finish it with fresh cream, fried cashew nuts and give it a good mix.
Transfer it to a serving dish, garnish it with fried cashewnuts, ratlami sev and coriander sprig.
Serve hot with roti.
In a pan, add oil, once it's hot, add cashew nuts and fry them until golden in colour.
Transfer it to an absorbent sheet and keep it aside for further use.
description: Rajasthani style Malai Pyaaz ki Sabji ready in 10 minutes.

Preparation time 10 minutes 
Cooking time 20-25 minutes 
Serve 2-4 

Ingredients
For Lucknowi Aloo Korma
¼ cup Oil, तेल
3 medium Onions (roughly sliced), प्याज
4 no. Green cardamom, हरी इलायची
2 no. Black cardamom, बड़ी इलायची 
Prepared curd mixture, तैयार किया हुआ दही का मिश्रण
2 cups Water, पानी
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
4-5 no. Dried apricots, खुबानी
Prepared rice flour slurry, चावल के आटे का घोल
1 heaped tbsp Tender Coriander stems (finely chopped), धनिया के डंठल
4-5 Dried apricots, खुबानी
Fried potatoes, तले हुए आलू
Little water, पानी
½ tsp Sugar, चीनी
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
1 tsp dry Fenugreek leaves (crushed), कसूरी मेथी
1 tsp Black peppercorns (crushed), कुटी हुई काली मिर्च
2-3 tbsp fresh Coriander leaves (finely chopped), धनिया पत्ता

For Curd Mixture
2 cups Curd (beaten), दही
1 tsp Degi red chili powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर
2 tsp Turmeric powder, हल्दी पाउडर
1 tbsp Coriander powder, धनिया पाउडर
¼ tsp Cumin powder, जीरा पाउडर
1 tbsp Ginger Garlic paste, अदरक लहसुन का पेस्ट

For Frying Potatoes
Oil for frying, तलने के लिए तेल
3-4 large Potatoes (peeled & cut into wedges), आलू

For Rice Flour Slurry
1 tbsp Rice flour, चावल का आटा
½ tbsp Ghee, घी 
Water as required, पानी

For Garnish
Coriander sprig, धनिया पत्ता

Process
For Lucknowi Aloo Korma
● In a handi, add oil, once it's hot, add onions and saute it for 5-6 minutes until golden in colour.
● Add green cardamom, black cardamom, prepared curd mixture and cook until oil separates from the masala.
● Add water, salt to taste, dried apricots and let it simmer for a while.
● Add prepared rice flour slurry, tender coriander stems, dried apricots, fried potatoes, little water and cook it for 7-8 minutes on medium flames.
● Add sugar, salt to taste and mix it well.
● Finish it with crushed dry fenugreek leaves, black peppercorns and fresh coriander leaves.
● Transfer it to a serving dish and garnish it with coriander sprig.
● Serve hot with roti and naan.

For Curd Mixture
● In a bowl, add curd, degi red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, ginger garlic paste and give it a good mix.
● Keep it aside for further use.

For Frying Potatoes
● In a kadai, heat oil for frying, add potatoes and fry them until crispy and golden in colour.
● Transfer it to an absorbent sheet and keep it aside for further use.

For Rice Flour Slurry
● In a bowl, add rice flour, ghee, water as required and give it a good mix.
● Keep it aside for further use.

name: Winter Spl Palak Chicken Curry

ingredients.name: Coriander leaves
ingredients.quantity:
1 cup (roughly torn), धनिया पत्ता
2 large bunch Spinach, (roughly torn), पालक
3 no. Green chillies (less spicy & chopped), हरी मिर्च
1 large Tomato (diced), टमाटर

For Chicken Marination  
900 gms Chicken legs, चिकन
1 tsp Degi red chilli powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर
½ tsp dry Mango powder, आमचूर पाउडर
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
1 tbsp Ginger Garlic paste, अदरक लहसुन का पेस्ट
3 tbsp Mustard oil, सरसों का तेल

For Garam Masala
2 heaped tbsp Black peppercorns, काली मिर्च के दाने
5-6 no. Cloves, लौंग
10-12 no. Black cardamom, बड़ी इलायची
2 tbsp Coriander seeds, धनिये के बीज
½ tsp Fenugreek seeds, मेथी दाना
½ tbsp Cumin seeds, जीरा
3 no. Mace, जावित्री
2-3 no. Green cardamom, हरी इलायची
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार

For Winter Chicken Curry
¼ cup Mustard oil, सरसों का तेल
Little water, पानी
2 no. Cloves, लौंग
1 no. Black cardamom, बड़ी इलायची
2 medium Onions (chopped), प्याज
Prepared paste, तैयारी की हुई पेस्ट
½ cup Curd (beaten), दही
Marinated chicken, मैरीनेट किया हुआ चिकन
2 tbsp Prepared garam masala, तैयार किया हुआ गरम मसाला
Smoked ghee, स्मोक्ड घी
2 cups Water, पानी
2 tbsp prepared garam masala, तैयार किया हुआ गरम मसाला
2 tsp Fenugreek leaves, कसूरी मेथी
2-3 tbsp Ghee, घी

Other Ingredients
Coal, कोयला
1 tbsp Ghee, घी

For Garnish 
Coriander sprig, धनिया पत्ता
Lemon wedge, नींबू की फांक

Process
For Winter Paste
● In a bowl, add coriander leaves, spinach, green chillies and tomato.
● Transfer it to a mixer grinder jar and grind into a smooth paste.
● Keep it aside for further use.
 
For Chicken Marination  
● In a bowl, add chicken legs, degi red chilli powder, dry mango powder, salt to taste, ginger garlic paste, mustard oil and mix it well.
● Keep it aside to marinate for a while.

For Garam Masala
● In a kadai, add black peppercorns, cloves, black cardamom, coriander seeds, mace, green cardamom, salt to taste and dry roast it for a minute.
● Transfer it to a mixer grinder jar and grind it into a smooth powder.
● Keep it aside for further use.

For Winter Chicken Curry
● In a kadai, add mustard oil, once it's smoky hot, add cloves, black cardamom and let it splutter.
● Add onion and saute it for a while until golden in color.
● Add winter paste and cook it for 2-3 minutes.
● Add curd and cook it for 5-6 minutes until cooked well.
● Add marinated chicken and cook it until tender.
● Heat a coal on a gas range and place it in a steel bowl.
● Add prepared garam masala, place the bowl in the kadai, add ghee and cover it with a lid.
● Add the same smoked ghee, water, prepared garam masala and let it simmer for a while until oil is separated.
● Finish it with fenugreek leaves, ghee and mix it well.
● Transfer it to a serving dish, garnish it with coriander sprig and lemon wedge.
● Serve hot with roti or rice.

instructions: For Stuffing: Soak chana dal overnight. Grind it coarsely with green chilies, ginger, and coriander leaves. Add salt, cumin seeds, and crushed black peppercorns.
For Dough: Boil water with salt and oil. Add semolina powder and mix well to form a dough.
For Roasting Vegetables: Roast onion, tomatoes, and green chilies on an open flame or in the oven until charred.
For Chutney: Grind the roasted vegetables with ginger and salt to make a chutney.

For Tari Wala Fara: Heat oil, add cumin seeds and asafoetida. Add dry Kashmiri red chilies and tomato puree. Add degi red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and cumin powder. Cook until the oil separates. Add water, butter, and salt. Add fried fara and cook for a few minutes. Finish with butter.

For Tadka: Heat oil, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and fennel seeds. Add dry Kashmiri red chilies, green chilies, coriander leaves, and curry leaves. Add fried fara and salt. Finish with lemon juice.

Process: Grease your hands with oil, take a small portion of the dough and flatten it. Fill it with the chana dal mixture and shape it into a dumpling. Steam or boil the dumplings until cooked through. Shallow fry the dumplings until golden brown.
Serve with chutney and tari wala fara. Garnish with coriander sprig and lemon wedges.
