instructions: For Paste: Grind together onion, green chillies, ginger and coriander leaves into a coarse paste.
For Amritsari Bhurji: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add the prepared paste and saute until golden brown.
Add deghi red chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add water as required to prevent burning. Add salt to taste.
Add ¾ cup water and bring to a boil. Add roughly chopped tomatoes and diced tomatoes. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add ghee and mix well. Add beaten eggs and cook, stirring continuously, until the eggs are cooked through but still moist.
Add a little water if the mixture becomes too dry. Garnish with finely chopped coriander leaves, cubed butter, finely chopped tomato, chopped coriander leaves and ghee.
For Hyderabadi Khagina: Heat oil in a pan, add sliced onions and saute until golden brown.
Add green chillies and ginger and saute for a minute. Add finely chopped tomatoes and salt to taste. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add deghi red chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add ¼ cup water and cook until the mixture thickens. Add a little water if the mixture becomes too dry.
Add eggs and cook, stirring continuously, until the eggs are cooked through but still moist.
Add the prepared tadka and mix well.
For Tadka: Heat oil in a small pan, add dry Kashmiri red chillies and crushed garlic. Saute until the garlic is golden brown.
Add curry leaves and saute for a few seconds. Remove from heat.
For Parsi Akuri: Heat ghee in a pan, add cashew nuts and saute until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add onion, green chillies, ginger and tender coriander stems. Saute until the onions are golden brown.
Add ghee and butter and let them melt. Add finely chopped tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add ghee, salt to taste, turmeric powder, deghi red chilli powder and garam masala. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add beaten eggs and salt to taste. Cook, stirring continuously, until the eggs are cooked through but still moist.
Garnish with roughly chopped coriander leaves.
For Garnish: Garnish with fried onions, coriander sprig and fried cashew nuts.

name: 3 Types Besan Snacks (Diwali Spl)

ingredients.name: Gram Flour
ingredients.quantity: 800 gms (for dough) + 200 gms (for masala mixture) = 1000 gms total, बेसन

ingredients.name: Asafoetida
ingredients.quantity: ¼ tsp (for dough) + ½ tsp (for masala mixture) = ¾ tsp total, हींग

ingredients.name: Turmeric powder
ingredients.quantity: 1 tsp (for dough) + 1 tbsp (for masala mixture) = 1 tsp + 1 tbsp total, हल्दी पाउडर

ingredients.name: Oil
ingredients.quantity: 1 tbsp (for dough) + 1 tbsp (after kneading) + 2 tbsp (for shallow frying) + as needed for greasing and frying, तेल

ingredients.name: Degi red chili powder
ingredients.quantity: 1 heaped tbsp (for masala mixture) + A pinch (for Bhakarwadi) + ½ tsp (for Sev), देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर

ingredients.name: Dry mango powder
ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp (for masala mixture) + A pinch (for Bhakarwadi) + ½ tsp (for Sev), आमचूर पाउडर

ingredients.name: Black pepper powder
ingredients.quantity: 1 heaped tbsp, काली मिर्च का पाउडर

ingredients.name: Bhavnagri chillies
ingredients.quantity: 12-15 no., slit into middle, भावनगरी मिर्च

instructions: For Dough: In a bowl, add gram flour, rice flour, salt to taste, a pinch of asafoetida, turmeric powder, oil, water as required and knead it into a semisoft dough.
Add oil, knead it well and keep it aside for further use.
For Masala Mixture: In a pan, add ghee, once it's hot, add gram flour and roast it for 5-6 minutes on low flames.
Add white sesame seeds, carom seeds, salt to taste and cook it for a minute.
Add turmeric powder, asafoetida, coriander powder, degi red chili powder, salt to taste and mix it well.
Add fennel powder, dry mango powder, black pepper powder, peanut powder and cook it on medium flames for 3-4 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a tray or bowl and keep it aside for further use.
For Bhakarwadi: In a bowl, add prepared masala mixture, tamarind paste and give it a good mix.
Take prepared dough, flatten it with a rolling pin and spread prepared masala mixture evenly.
Carefully roll it like a swiss roll, apply water and seal the edge properly.
Cut the roll into small slices and keep it aside for a while.
Heat oil in a kadai, once it's hot, add prepared bhakarwadi and fry them until golden in colour.
Transfer it to a tray, sprinkle a pinch of degi red chili powder, a pinch of dry mango powder, salt to taste and toss it gently.
Transfer it to a serving bowl and serve hot.
For Sev: Apply oil in the chakli/sev mould, add prepared dough and seal the mould with the lid, gently drop the sev in the hot oil and fry it until golden in colour on medium flames.
Transfer it to a tray, sprinkle a pinch of degi red chili powder, dry mango powder, salt to taste and toss it well.
Transfer it to a serving bowl and serve hot.
For Bharwa Mirchi: Take bhavnagri chillies, slit the chillies from the middle and make a cavity.
Add a spoonful of prepared masala mixture and stuff the chillies well.
In a pan, add oil, once it's hot, add stuffed chillies and cook it for 7-8 minutes until it's cooked.
Transfer it to a serving dish and garnish it with coriander sprig.
Serve hot with steam rice, dal tadka.

name: Cham Cham (Malai Sandwich)

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.quantity: 1 ltr (for sugar syrup), पानी (for sugar syrup)

ingredients.name: Sugar
ingredients.quantity: 500 gms (for sugar syrup), चीनी (for sugar syrup)

ingredients.name: Green cardamom
ingredients.quantity: 2 no. (for sugar syrup), हरी इलायची (for sugar syrup)

ingredients.name: Milk
ingredients.quantity: 700 ml (for rasmalai mixture), दूध (for rasmalai mixture)

ingredients.name: Cardamom powder
ingredients.quantity: A pinch (for rasmalai mixture), इलायची पाउडर (for rasmalai mixture)

ingredients.name: Powdered sugar
ingredients.quantity: 110 gms (for rasmalai mixture), पिसी हुई चीनी (for rasmalai mixture)

ingredients.name: Saffron water
ingredients.quantity: 2-3 tbsp (for rasmalai mixture), केसर का पानी (for rasmalai mixture)

ingredients.name: Bread slices
ingredients.quantity: 4 no. (trim edges & cut into diced) (for rasmalai mixture), ब्रेड स्लाइस (for rasmalai mixture)

ingredients.name: Milk powder
ingredients.quantity: 450 gms (for rasmalai mixture), मिल्क पाउडर (for rasmalai mixture)

ingredients.name: Bread slices
ingredients.quantity: 4 no. (trim edges & cut into diced) (for rasmalai mixture), ब्रेड स्लाइस (for rasmalai mixture)

ingredients.name: Paneer
ingredients.quantity: 600 gms (for cham cham mixture), crumble, पनीर (for cham cham mixture)

ingredients.name: Refined flour
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup (for cham cham mixture), मैदा (for cham cham mixture)

ingredients.name: Baking soda
ingredients.quantity: ¼ tsp (for cham cham mixture), बेकिंग सोडा (for cham cham mixture)

ingredients.name: Refined flour
ingredients.quantity: 2-3 tbsp (for cham cham mixture), मैदा (for cham cham mixture)

ingredients.name: Semolina powder
ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp (for cham cham mixture), सूजी का पाउडर (for cham cham mixture)

ingredients.name: Prepared cham cham
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), तैयार किया हुआ चम चम (for assembling)

ingredients.name: Prepared rasmalai mixture
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), तैयार किया हुआ रसमलाई का मिश्रण (for assembling)

ingredients.name: Soaked rasmalai bread
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), भीगी हुई रसमलाई वाली ब्रेड (for assembling)

ingredients.name: Tutti frutti
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), टूटी फ्रूटी (for assembling)

ingredients.name: Almonds
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), sliver, बादाम (for assembling)

ingredients.name: Silver vark
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), चाँदी का वर्क (for assembling)

ingredients.name: Pistachios
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), sliced, पिस्ता (for assembling)

ingredients.name: Candied cherries
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), cut into half, कैंडिड चेरी (for assembling)

ingredients.name: Fresh rose petals
ingredients.quantity: As needed (for assembling), ताजे गुलाब की पंखुड़ियाँ (for assembling)

instructions: In a saucepot, add water, sugar, green cardamom and give it a good mix.
Let it simmer for 10-12 minutes on medium flames.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a saucepot or kadai, add milk, a pinch of cardamom powder and give it a quick boil.
Add powdered sugar, saffron water and give it a good mix.
Add bread slices and cook it for 2-3 minutes until bread absorbs the milk.
Transfer the bread to a tray and keep it aside for further use.
Add milk powder in the milk and mix it well.
Again Add bread slices and mix it well.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and grind it into a smooth paste with the help of a hand blender.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a parat or bowl, add paneer and mash it well until it's smooth in texture.
Add refined flour, baking soda and give it a good mix.
Add refined flour, semolina powder and knead it into a smooth dough.
Divide the mixture in small lemon size balls and give it a desired shape.
Transfer the cham cham balls in sugar syrup and cook it for 10-12 minutes until it's cooked well.
Transfer it to a tray, pour prepared sugar syrup on the cham cham and keep it in a fridge to chill for a while.
Take cham cham, layered it with prepared rasmalai mixture and place soaked rasmalai bread.
Garnish it with tutti frutti, almond sliver, silver vark, sliced pistachios, candied cherries and fresh rose petals.
Serve.
description: Cham Cham / Malai Sandwich recipe

name: Thukpa with Laphing

ingredients.name: Refined flour (Maida)
ingredients.quantity:
4 cups Refined flour, मैदा
Water as required, पानी
1 tsp Yeast, खमीर
Water as required, पानी

For Chilli Oil 
2 cups Oil, तेल 
3 no. Bay leaf, तेज पत्ता
2 inch Cinnamon Stick, दालचीनी
2-3 no. Star anise, चक्र फूल 
¼ cup Chilli flakes, कुटी हुई लाल मिर्च
1 tsp Vinegar, सिरका
1 tsp Light Soy sauce, सोया सॉस 
¼ cup Toasted white sesame seeds, सफेद तिल
¼ cup Spring onion, chopped, प्याज़ पत्ता 

For Thukpa
1 tbsp Oil, तेल
2-3 no. Garlic cloves, crushed, लहसुन
6-7 no. Mushroom, roughly chopped, मशरूम 
2 large Carrots (peeled & chopped) गाजर
½ small Cabbage, chopped, पत्ता गोभी
Water as required, पानी
Spring onion, chopped, प्याज़ पत्ता 
½ inch Ginger (peeled & chopped) अदरक
1 no. Green chilli, finely chopped, हरी मिर्च
1 tbsp Tender coriander stems, finely chopped, धनिया के डंठल 

Other Ingredients 
Oil for greasing, तेल
Starch Batter, स्टार्च बैटर

For Assembling 
Prepared Laphing, cut into strips, तैयार किया हुआ लाफिंग
Seitan, roughly chopped, सेइटन
Chilli oil, तैयार किया हुआ चिल्ली ऑइल
Prepared Thukpa, तैयार किया हुआ थुकपा

For Laphing Roll
Prepared laphing, तैयार किया हुआ लाफिंग  
Seitan, roughly chopped, सेइटन
Spring onion, chopped, प्याज़ पत्ता 
Chilli oil, तैयार किया हुआ चिल्ली ऑइल

For Garnish 
Coriander sprig, धनिया पत्ता
Spring onion, chopped, प्याज़ पत्ता 

Process 
For Gluten & Starch Batter
● In a bowl, add refined flour, water as required, yeast and knead it into smooth dough.
● Leave it aside for 15-20 minutes for resting.
● Add water as required and wash the dough until the dough loses all its starch.
● Transfer the starch batter into the greased tray or plate and the remaining gluten transfer it into the plate.
● Now, place the plate into the steamer and cook for 10-12 minutes or until it's cooked.

For Chilli Oil
● In a saucepan, add oil, once it's slightly hot, add bay leaf, cinnamon stick, star anise, chilli flakes and cook for 2-3 minutes on low flames.
● Add vinegar, light soy sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
● Now, add white sesame seeds, spring onion and give it a good mix.
● Transfer it into the bowl and keep it aside for further use.

For Thukpa
● In a saucepot, add oil, once it's hot, add garlic, mushrooms, carrot, cabbage and cook for 2-3 minutes on high flames.
● Add water as required and let it simmer for a while.
● Add spring onion, ginger, green chilli, tender coriander stems and give it a quick boil.
● Keep it aside for further use.

For Assembling
● In a serving bowl, add prepared laphing, seitan, drizzle some prepared chilli oil, pour prepared thukpa and garnish it with coriander sprig and spring onion.
● Serve hot.

For Laphing Roll
● Take a prepared laphing sheet, stuff it with prepared seitan, spring onion and drizzle some chilli oil and roll it tightly.
● Cut into desired shape and transfer it into the serving platter and garnish it with coriander sprig and spring onion.
● Serve hot with prepared thukpa.

instructions: For Vegetable Stock
In a saucepot, add mushrooms, baby corn, carrots, oil and saute it for a minute.
Add tender coriander stems, black peppercorns, bay leaf, water, cabbage stem and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes on low flames.
Strain the stock and keep it aside for further use.
For Manchurian Soup
In a wok, add oil, once it's hot, add ginger, green chillies, onion, salt to taste and saute it on high flames for a while.
Add mushrooms, cabbage, carrots, french beans, tender coriander stems and cook it on high flames for 2-3 minutes.
Add prepared sauce mixture and give it a good mix.
Add prepared vegetable stock, salt to taste and simmer it for 5-6 minutes.
Add cornstarch slurry, prepared manchurian balls and give it a quick boil.
Finish it with spring onion and fresh coriander leaves.
Transfer it to a serving bowl, garnish it with fried noodles, prepared manchurian balls, spring onion and chilli oil.
Serve hot.
For Manchurian Mixture
In a bowl, add ginger, green chillies, cabbage, black pepper powder, refined flour, dark soy sauce, ginger garlic paste, salt to taste, baking soda, water, vinegar and give it a good mix.
Heat oil in a kadai, once it's hot, drop lemon size manchurian balls in hot oil and fry them until golden in colour.
Transfer it to an absorbent sheet and keep it aside for further use.
Add boiled noodles in hot oil and fry them until golden in colour.
Transfer the noodles to an absorbent sheet and keep it aside for further use.
For Sauce Mixture
In a bowl, add dark soy sauce, green chilli sauce, red chilli sauce, vinegar, black pepper powder, crushed black peppercorns, tomato ketchup and give it a good mix.
Keep it aside for further use.

name: Sindhi Mutton Curry
instructions: In a pressure cooker, add oil, once it's hot, add cloves, black peppercorns, black cardamom, green cardamom, bay leaf, onions, salt to taste and saute it for 3-4 minutes until onions are golden in colour.
Add mutton with bones, coriander leaves and saute it for a minute.
Add turmeric powder, degi red chili powder, coriander powder and cook it for a minute.
Add tomatoes, salt to taste, fresh tomato puree and cook it for a while until oil separates from the gravy.
Add water to adjust the consistency, green chillies, cover it with a lid and cook it for 7-8 whistles until cooked well.
Add tender coriander stems and give it a good mix.
Finish it with dry fenugreek leaves and mix it well.
Transfer it to a serving dish and garnish it with coriander sprig.
Serve hot with roti.

ingredients.name: Oil
ingredients.quantity:
¼ cup oil, तेल
1 no. Black cardamom, बड़ी इलायची
4-5 no. Dry kashmiri red chillies (broken into half & seedless) सूखी कश्मीरी लाल मिर्च
2-3 no. Cloves, लौंग
½ tbsp Cumin seeds, जीरा
2 large Onions, sliced, प्याज
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
1 kg large Potatoes, cut into half, आलू
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
1 tsp Turmeric powder, हल्दी पाउडर
2 tbsp Degi red chilli powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर
Salt to taste,  नमक स्वादअनुसार
½ cup Water, पानी
1 tsp Ginger Garlic paste, अदरक लहसुन का पेस्ट
1 tbsp Coriander powder, धनिया पाउडर
2 cups Tamarind water, इमली का पानी
2-3 heaped tbsp Prepared paste & 2-3 tbsp water, तैयार किया हुआ पेस्ट और पानी
1 tbsp Tender coriander stems, finely chopped, धनिये के डंठल
1 tsp Jaggery, गुड़
2 tbsp Sugar, चीनी
1 tbsp Ghee, घी

For Peanut Paste 
⅓ cup Peanuts, मूंगफली
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
¼ cup White sesame seeds, सफेद तिल

For Garnish 
Coriander sprig, धनिया पत्ता

Process 
For Hyderabadi Khatta Aloo
● In a handi, add oil, once it's hot, add black cardamom, dry kashmiri red chillies, cloves, cumin seeds and let it splutter well.
● Add onions, salt to taste and saute it  for 2-3 minutes until it's translucent.
● Add potatoes, salt to taste, turmeric powder, degi red chili powder, salt to taste and cook it for a minute.
● Add water, ginger garlic paste, cover it with a lid and cook it for 7-8 minutes until potatoes are 80% cooked.
● Add coriander powder, tamarind water, prepared paste & water and let it cook well.
● Finish it with tender coriander stems, jaggery, sugar, ghee and give it a good mix.
● Transfer it to a serving dish and garnish it with coriander sprig.
● Serve hot with roti.

For Peanut Paste
● In a pan, add peanuts, salt to taste and roast them for 2-3 minutes.
● Add white sesame seeds and roast it for a minute.
● Transfer it to a mixer grinder jar and grind it into a coarse paste.
● Keep it aside for further use.

instructions: In a pressure cooker, add water, cleaned banana flower, water chestnuts, sendha namak and mix well.
Cover it with the lid and cook for 2-3 whistles or until it's cooked.
Turn off the flames and keep it aside for further use.
In a bowl, add coriander leaves, green chillies, ginger, roasted peanuts & cumin seeds, sendha namak, sugar and mix well.
Transfer it into the mixer grinder jar and grind it into the smooth fine paste.
Transfer it into the serving bowl and serve with prepared kele ke phool ke pakode.
In a pan, add peanuts and dry roast them for a while.
Add oil, once it's hot, add cumin seeds and roast them until fragrant.
Turn off the flames and transfer it into the bowl and keep it aside for further use.
In a bowl, add cooked bana flower & water chestnuts, fresh coriander leaves, green chillies, cumin seeds, curd, sendha namak, buckwheat flour and give it a good mix.
Heat oil in a kadai, drop a small spoonful of pakoda mixture into the hot oil and cook until it's cooked well.
Remove it into the absorbent sheet.
Transfer it into the serving dish and garnish it with lemon wedge and coriander sprig.
Serve hot with prepared vrat ki chutney.

name: Garlic Lachha (Chur Chur) Paratha & Matar Masala

ingredients.name: Refined flour
ingredients.quantity:
350 gms Refined flour, मैदा
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
Water as required, पानी
1 tsp Oil, तेल

For Cooking Matara 
⅓ cup Mustard oil, सरसों का तेल
1 tsp Cumin seeds, जीरा
4-5 no. Garlic cloves, crushed, लहसुन
4-5 no. dry Kashmiri red chillies, सूखी कश्मीरी लाल मिर्च
2 cups White peas (soaked overnight) भीगे हुए सफेद मटर
½ tsp Asafoetida, हींग
1 tsp Turmeric powder, हल्दी पाउडर
1 heaped tsp Degi red chili powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर
1 tbsp Coriander powder, धनिया पाउडर
3 cups Water, पानी
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
Prepared tadka, तैयार किया हुआ तड़का
2 tsp dry Mango powder, आमचूर पाउडर

For Tadka
¼ cup Ghee, घी
1 tsp Cumin seeds, जीरा
½ tsp Fennel seeds, सौंफ
A pinch of Asafoetida, हींग
1 tsp Degi red chili powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर

For Garlic Flavoured Oil
3-4 no. Garlic cloves, finely chopped, लहसुन
2-3 heaped tbsp Ghee, घी
2 tbsp Oil, तेल

For Coating
¼ cup Semolina, सूजी
¼ cup Poppy seeds, खसखस
1 tbsp Degi red chili powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार

Other Ingredients
1-2 tbsp Oil (for coating dough) तेल
1-2 tbsp prepared Garlic flavoured oil (for cooking paratha) तैयार किया हुआ लहसुन का तेल

For Garnish
1 large Onion, finely chopped, प्याज
1 no. Lemon, cut into quarters, नींबू
4 no. Green chillies (less spicy & finely chopped) हरी मिर्च
2 tbsp fresh Coriander leaves, finely chopped, धनिया पत्ता
1 inch Ginger (peeled & julienned) अदरक
2 no. Green & red chillies, हरी और लाल मिर्च
A pinch of Chilli flakes, चिल्ली फ्लेक्स

Process
For Dough
● In a bowl or parat, add refined flour, salt to taste, water as required, oil and knead it into semisoft dough.
● Cover it with a damp cloth and leave it aside  to rest for at least 30 minutes.
● Take a large sized ball of dough, roll and flatten it.
● Roll it into a thin sheet, grease it with oil or prepared garlic flavoured oil.
● Fold it in pleats with the help of fingers. stretch and roll the pleated dough.
● Rest the roll dough for 10 minutes. 
● Take the rolled ball, place it into the coating mixture and coat it evenly.
● Roll the coated dough ball into a thin sheet and thoroughly  apply the prepared garlic flavoured oil on the paratha.
● Heat a tawa, add prepared garlic flavoured oil, place the rolled paratha and cook it on both sides until golden in color.
● Grease with ghee and crush the naan to form layers.

For Cooking Matara
● In a pressure cooker, add mustard oil, once it's smoky hot, add cumin seeds, garlic cloves, dry kashmiri red chillies, soaked white peas and mix it well.
● Add asafoetida, turmeric powder, degi red chili powder, coriander powder, water and give it a good mix.
● Cover it with a lid and cook it for 3-4 whistles until cooked well.
● Add salt to taste and give it a quick boil.
● Finish it with prepared tadka, dry mango powder and give it a good mix.
● Transfer it to a serving dish, garnish it with onion, lemon, green chillies, fresh coriander leaves, ginger and green & red chillies.
● Serve hot with prepared laccha paratha and curd.

For Tadka
● In a pan, add ghee, once it's hot, add cumin seeds, asafoetida, degi red chili powder and cook it for a minute.
● Turn off the flames and keep it aside for further use.

For Garlic Flavoured Oil
● In a pan, add garlic, ghee, oil and cook it for 5-6 minutes on low flames until garlic turns golden in colour.
● Turn off the flames and keep it aside for further use.

For Coating
● In a tray, add semolina, poppy seeds, degi red chili powder, salt to taste and give it a good mix.
● Keep it aside for further use.

instructions: In a pressure cooker, add oil, ghee, once it's hot, add cumin seeds & black peppercorns, garlic, onion, dry kashmiri red chillies and saute it for 2-3 minutes.
Add potatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, degi red chili powder, coriander powder, dry fenugreek leaves and cook it for a minute.
Add soaked soya chunks, salt to taste and cook it for a while on medium flames.
Add water and give it a quick boil.
Add chana dal, water, cover it with the lid and let it cook for 2-3 whistles until it's cooked.
Keep it aside to cool down at room temperature.
Transfer the mixture into a mixer grinder jar and grind it into fine paste.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a handi, add oil, once it's hot, add cumin seeds, fennel seeds, onion and saute it for a while until golden in colour.
Add green chillies, ginger, tender coriander stems and saute it for a minute.
Add curd and cook it for 2-3 minutes until oil separates from the masala.
Add fresh tomato puree, salt to taste and cook it well for a while.
Add water and let it simmer for 7-8 minutes on medium flames.
Finish it with cooked soya mixture, salt to taste and mix it well.
Transfer the gravy into a serving dish, place fried koftas, garnish it with green chillies, ginger and coriander sprig.
Serve hot with roti.
In a bowl, add cooked soya mixture, dry fenugreek leaves, salt to taste, dry mango powder, soya chunks powder and give it a good mix.
Divide the mixture into small lemon size balls and coat it with soya chunks powder.
Heat oil in a kadai, add prepared koftas and fry them until golden brown.
Transfer it into an absorbent sheet and keep it aside for further use.

name: Pav Bhaji Paratha

ingredients.name: Green chillies
ingredients.quantity: 4 no. (less spicy & finely chopped) हरी मिर्च

instructions: In a bowl, add whole wheat flour, salt to taste, a pinch of carom seeds, oil, water and knead it into the semisoft dough.
Add oil and knead it nicely.
Cover it with damp cloth and keep it aside to rest for a while.
Divide the dough into medium lemon size balls and make a cavity in the middle.
Add the spoonful of prepared stuffing in the cavity, seal the edges and roll it with the help of a rolling pin.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a pan, add ghee, once it's hot, add ginger, green chillies and cook it for a minute.
Add fresh green peas, salt to taste, water, cover it with the lid and let it cook for a while.
Add carrots, water and saute it for 4-5 minutes.
Add boiled potatoes, butter, pav bhaji masala, degi red chili powder, salt to taste and mash it well.
Finish it with butter, fresh coriander leaves, lemon juice and give it a good mix.
Transfer it to a tray and keep it aside to cool down the temperature.
In a tawa, add ghee, once it's hot, place prepared rolled paratha and cook it evenly on both sides.
Transfer it to the serving dish, garnish it with fried chillies and butter.
Serve hot.

name: Instant Poha Kheer & Laddu
instructions: In a saucepot, add milk, cardamom, almonds and let it boil for a while.
Add washed poha and cook it for 5-6 minutes until it's cooked.
Add condensed milk, sugar, and give it a quick boil.
Finish it with fried nuts and give it a good mix.
Transfer it to a serving bowl, garnish it with pistachio powder, almonds sliver and a few saffron strands.
Serve hot.
In a pan, add ghee, once it's hot, add raisins, cashew nuts and toss until golden in colour.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a pan, add ghee, once it's hot, add ripe banana, jaggery and cook it until the jaggery is cooked.
Add desiccated coconut, almond powder and saute it for a minute.
Add washed poha, cardamom powder, a few saffron strands and give it a good mix.
Transfer the mixture into the tray and leave it aside to cool down at room temperature.
Divide the mixture into small lemon size balls and make it the desired shape.
Transfer it to a serving platter, garnish it with pistachio powder, almonds sliver and a few saffron strands.

instructions: For Chicken Marination: In a bowl, add egg, ginger garlic paste, salt to taste, light soy sauce, chicken thighs and mix it well.

Transfer it to a bowl and keep it aside for further use.
For Coating: In a bowl, add refined flour, rice flour, salt to taste and mix it well.
Add marinated chicken and coat it well on all sides.

Transfer it to an absorbent sheet and keep it aside for further use.

Transfer it to a serving platter, serve hot with prepared korean sauce and salad.

name: Chilli Paneer Momos

instructions: In a bowl, add refined flour, salt to taste, sugar, water and knead it into a smooth dough.
Drizzle some oil and keep it aside for a while.
In a bowl, add carrots, cabbage, salt to taste, a pinch of sugar, light soy sauce and mix it well.
Keep it aside for a while until vegetables lose their moisture.
Squeeze out the moisture and transfer vegetables into a bowl.
Add green chillies, ginger, paneer, fresh coriander leaves, salt to taste, black pepper powder and mix it well.
Keep it aside for further use.
In a bowl, add vinegar, light soy sauce, green chilli sauce, red chilli sauce, sugar, ginger, tender coriander stems with roots, tomato ketchup, water and give it a good mix.
Keep it aside for further use.
Take prepared dough, divided into small lemon size balls, flatten with the rolling pin and add a spoonful of prepared stuffing.
Close the edges, shape them by making pleats on one side and sticking on the other side. Make it a crescent or any desired shape.
Heat oil in a kadai, add prepared momos in oil and fry them until crispy and golden in colour.
Transfer it to an absorbent sheet and keep it aside for further use.
In a wok, add oil, once it's hot, add dry kashmiri red chillies and saute it for a minute.
Add onions, capsicum and toss it on high flames.
Add prepared sauce mixture and cook it for 2-3 minutes.
Add fried momos and saute it on high flames for a while.
Transfer it to a serving dish, garnish it with toasted sesame seeds, spring onion greens and coriander sprig.
Serve hot.

instructions: For Chili Paste: In a pan, add water, salt to taste, oil, degi red chili powder, jaggery, ginger garlic paste and cook it for 4-5 minutes until cooked well.
Add oil and give it a good mix.
Keep it aside for further use.
For Bohri Style Aloo Dum Biryani: Heat oil in a handy. Once it's hot, add curry leaves, cumin seeds, garlic, green chillies, ginger and saute until translucent.
Add baby potatoes, salt to taste, fried onions and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add the curd, green & black cardamom, cloves and let it cook for a while until well cooked.
Add prepared chilli paste, water, cover with the lid and cook for 10-12 minutes on medium flame.
Layer it with cooked rice, fried onions, saffron water, rose water, fresh coriander leaves, ghee, garam masala.
Transfer to a serving dish, garnish with coriander sprigs and mint sprigs.
Serve hot with prepared right.
For Cooking Rice: In a saucepot, add water as required, salt to taste, bay leaf, block peppercorns, cloves & green cardamom and ghee.
Once the water gets to a roaring boil, add soaked sella basmati rice and cook it for 7-8 minutes until rice is 80% cooked.
Strain the rice and set aside for further use.
For Writer: In a pan, add oil, once it's hot, add garlic and sauté it for a minute.
Add peanuts, dry kashmiri red chillies and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Strain the garlic, peanuts, dry kashmiri red chillies, transfer to a mortar pestle and grind it into a coarse paste.
In a bowl, add fresh coriander leaves, curd, salt to taste, prepared chutney mixture and give it a good mix.
Transfer to a serving bowl and serve with prepared biryani.

ingredients.name: Paneer
ingredients.quantity:
800 gms, cut into large cubes, पनीर
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
1 ½ tsp Degi red chilli powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर
½ tsp Coriander powder, धनिया पाउडर
2 heaped tbsp Curd, beaten, दही
1 tsp Oil, तेल
1 tbsp Ginger garlic paste, अदरक लहसुन का पेस्ट

For Frying Onions
½ cup Oil, तेल
3 medium Onions, roughly sliced, प्याज

For Paste 
Fried Onion, तले हुए प्याज
10-12 no. Cashewnut, काजू
1 tbsp Coriander powder, धनिया पाउडर
½ tsp Turmeric powder, हल्दी पाउडर
1 tbsp Degi red chilli powder, देगी लाल मिर्च पाउडर
Few Coriander stem with roots, धनिये के डंठल
4-5 no. Green cardamom, हरी इलायची
1 no. Mace, जावित्री 
3-4 no. Garlic cloves, लहसुन 
2 no. Green chillies, less spicy & broken into half, हरी मिर्च

For Frying Paneer 
Remaining oil, बचा हुआ तेल
Marinated paneer, मैरिनेटेड पनीर

For Paneer Changezi 
½ tsp Cumin seeds, जीरा
2 no Green cardamom, हरी इलायची
3 no Cloves, लौंग
1 no. Bay leaf,  तेज पत्ता
Remaining oil, बचा हुआ तेल
1 ¼ cup Tomato puree, ताज़े टमाटर की प्यूरी  
½ cup Curd, beaten, दही
½ tbsp Ginger garlic paste, अदरक लहसुन का पेस्ट
Prepared paste, तैयार किया हुआ पेस्ट
Salt to taste, नमक स्वादअनुसार
1 ½ cups Water, पानी
1 tbsp Fried onion oil, तले हुए प्याज का तेल
Fried paneer, तला हुआ पनीर

For Smoke 
Coal, कोयला
2-3 no. Cloves, लौंग
1 tsp Ghee, घी

For Garnish 
Coriander sprig, धनिया पत्ता
Chilli oil, मिर्च का तेल
Fried onion, तले हुए प्याज

Process
For Marination
● In a bowl, add paneer, salt to taste, degi red chili powder, coriander powder, curd, oil, ginger garlic paste and give a good mix.
● Keep it aside to marinate for a while.

For Frying Onions
● In a pan, add oil, once it's hot, add onions and fry them until golden in colour.
● Transfer it to an absorbent sheet and keep it aside for further use.

For Paste
● In a bowl, add fried onions, cashewnuts, coriander powder, turmeric powder, degi red chili powder, coriander stems with roots, green cardamom, mace, garlic, green chillies and mix well.
● Transfer it to a mixer grinder jar and grind it into a smooth paste.
● Keep it aside for further use.

For Frying Paneer
● In a pan, add remaining oil, once it's hot, add marinated paneer and shallow fry them on all sides until golden in colour.
● Transfer it to a tray and keep it aside for further use.

For Paneer Changezi
● In a handi, add cumin seeds, green cardamom & cloves, bay leaf, remaining oil and let it splutter on high flames.
● Add tomato puree, curd and saute it for 5-6 minutes until oil is separated.
● Add ginger garlic paste, prepared paste and cook it for a while.
● Add water to adjust the consistency and let it simmer for a while.
● Finish it with fried onion oil, fried paneer and cook it for 4-5 minutes on medium flames.
● Turn off the flames, place a small steel bowl into handi, add burnt coal in the steel bowl, add cloves, ghee, cover it with a lid and give smoke to the gravy for a while.
● Transfer it to a serving dish, garnish it with coriander sprig, chilli oil and fried onion.
● Serve hot with roti or naan.

● Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with coriander sprigs and fried onions. 
● Serve hot with onion salad.

For Ginger Garlic Paste 
● In a mortar and pestle, add the green chillies, ginger, garlic and grind to a coarse paste.
● Keep it aside for further use.
 
For Onion Salad

● Transfer to a serving bowl and serve with prepared mutton tahari.

For Garlic Butter
● In a pan, add oil, once it's hot, add garlic cloves, green chillies and cook it until golden in color.
● In a bowl, add coriander leaves, garlic cloves, cooked garlic & green chilies, oregano, butter, black pepper powder and chili flakes.
● Transfer it to a mixer grinder jar and grind it smoothly.
● Transfer it to a bowl and keep it aside for further use.

 For Yeast Mixture
● In a bowl, add dry yeast, water, refined flour, sugar and mix it well.
● Keep it aside to activate the starter.

For Dough
● In a bow, add refined flour, add prepared yeast mixture, salt to taste, sugar and knead it into a smooth dough.
● Drizzle some oil and keep it aside to ferment for a while.

For Rolled Garlic Bread 
● On bread, spread prepared garlic butter, stack it on top of each other and roll it.
● Transfer it to a baking tin, top it up with some prepared garlic butter, pizza cheese, oregano, chilli flakes and cover it with a silver foil.
● Bake it at 180°c for 10 minutes in the oven.
● Transfer it to a serving dish and garnish it with coriander sprig.

● Heat a pan, add prepared garlic bread and cook it on low flames for 10-12 minutes.
● Transfer it to a serving dish and garnish it with coriander sprig.

● Take ladi pav, apply prepared garlic bread and stack them in a baking tin.
● Top it up with pizza cheese, oregano, chilli flakes and cover it with a silver foil.
● Bake it at 180°c for 12-15 minutes in the airfryer.
● Drizzle some oil and bake it for a minute.
● Transfer it to a serving dish and garnish it with coriander sprig.

name: Peas Kaju Samosa
instructions: To make the dough, take refined flour in a bowl.
Add carom seeds, salt, ghee and 4 tbsps water and knead to stiff dough.
Cover with a moist muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.
Heat a pan.
Add coriander seeds, fennel seeds and cumin seeds and dry roast till fragrant.
Transfer in a mortar and crush coarsely with the help of a pestle.
Heat oil in a pan.
Add ginger, green chillies, crushed spices and asafoetida and sauté for 30 seconds.
Add cashew nuts, dried mango powder, red chilli powder and salt and mix well.
Add green peas, boiled potatoes and mix well.
Cook for 2-3 minutes or till the stuffing is thoroughly heated.
Transfer in a bowl and allow to cool.
Divide the dough into 5 equal portions and roll into thick oval shapes.
Cut into half, apply water on edges and shape into a cone.
Stuff the potato stuffing and seal the edges.
Preheat the air fryer at 180°C for 2-3 minutes.
Spray oil on air fryer basket and arrange the prepared samosas.
Spray some oil and air fry for 40-45 minutes.

name: Chawal Ka Parantha
instructions: Add whole wheat flour, salt, 2 teaspoons ghee, yogurt in a bowl. Add sufficient water, 2 tsps oil and knead into soft dough. Cover with a moist cloth and set aside for 15-20 minutes.
Add cooked rice, red chilli powder, cumin powder, green chillies, chopped coriander, salt, onion in a bowl. Mix well.

On a worktop, dust some flour and roll the dough and divide into equal portions. Make balls and press between palms of your hand. With a rolling pin flatten each dough into thick roundels and drizzle 1 teaspoon ghee on the disc and stuff it with a spoonful of the rice mixture and seal the edges.
Roll out into parantha with a rolling pin.
Heat a tawa. Place the prepared parantha on tawa, heat and cook well. Drizzle 2 teaspoons ghee on both the sides of parantha and shallow-fry till golden brown on both the sides.
Cut paranthas into quarters and place on a serving plate.
Serve hot with pickle.

instructions: Transfer the soaked green gram in a grinder jar and grind coarsely.
Transfer in a bowl.

Add whole wheat flour, semolina, asafoetida, onion seeds, carom seeds, baking soda, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, black pepper powder, turmeric powder, salt, dried fenugreek leaves and melted ghee and mix well.
Add 2-3 tbsps water and knead to soft dough.
Add oil and knead well.
Grease worktop with little oil, take a portion of dough and roll into semi thick disk.
Dock all over and cut into small roundels with the help of a cookie cutter.
Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
Deep fry prepared mathris till golden brown and crisp on medium heat.
Drain on absorbent paper and allow to cool completely.
Store or serve.

name: Chickpea Pumpkin Dip
instructions: Take boiled chickpeas in a grinder jar.
Add cottage cheese, red pumpkin, extra virgin olive oil, paprika powder, fried garlic, salt and cooking liquor and grind to fine mixture.
Transfer in a serving bowl, sprinkle pumpkin seeds on top and serve with lavash.

name: Air Fryer Snacks
instructions: Recipes are made in the air fryer.
Air frying gives golden, crunchy results without extra oil.

name: Sui Mai (Chinese Steamed Dumplings)
instructions: Take ¾ cup water in a small jug. Add turmeric powder and mix well.
Take refined flour in a bowl. Add salt, egg yolk and turmeric water and knead to stiff dough. Set aside for 30 minutes.

Take chicken mince in a bowl. Add ground prawns, spring onion greens, dried shitake mushrooms, spring onion bulbs, dark soy sauce, blended sesame oil, castor sugar, chicken stock powder and salt and mix well.
Divide the dough into small portions, dust some refined flour and roll into balls.
Dust some more flour and roll out the balls into thin disks.
Place the disk between thumb and index finger and stuff the prepared stuffing. Press lightly. Pinch the sides simultaneously.
Sprinkle some chopped carrots on top and arrange in dim sum basket.
Heat sufficient water in a deep nonstick pan and arrange the dim sum basket on top. Steam for 8-10 minutes.
Serve hot with chilli oil dip.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Take butter in a bowl.
Add icing sugar and brown sugar and beat till light and fluffy.
Add vanilla essence and mix well.
Sift refined flour, cocoa powder and baking soda directly in the bowl, add chocolate chips and mix with light hands.
Refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.
Preheat the air fryer at 175°C for 2-3 minutes.
Line air fryer basket with a parchment paper
Divide the mixture into equal portions and roll into balls.
Flatten slightly and arrange on air fryer basket.
Air fry for 10-12 minutes.
Allow to cool and serve.

name: Winter Vegetable Recipes
instructions: This playlist focuses on recipes that use seasonal vegetables in easy, practical ways while still delivering on taste and comfort.
Ideal for days when you want something warm, wholesome, and reliable on your plate.
Watch all the recipes and let us know which one you would cook first without a second thought.

name: Mushroom Satay
instructions: Take shallots in a grinder jar. Add garlic, galangal, lemongrass, coarse red chilli powder and 1 tbsp water and grind coarsely.
Add coconut milk, Thai red curry paste and brown sugar and grind to fine paste.
Take mushrooms in a bowl. Add ground paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder and salt and mix well.
Thread mushroom pieces on wooden skewers and set aside.
Heat oil in a nonstick grill pan. Arrange the skewers and cook on medium heat for 3-4 minutes.
Flip and cook for 3-4 minutes more on other side as well.
Transfer on a serving plate, sprinkle spring onion greens and serve hot with peanut sauce.

name: Green Moong and Avocado Hummus

ingredients.name: Green Moong
ingredients.quantity: 1 cup (soaked and boiled, approximate inference based on common hummus recipes and video description of protein content.) Note: Exact quantity not specified in provided text, but necessary for recipe completion.)

ingredients.name: Avocado
ingredients.quantity: 1 medium (approximate inference based on common hummus recipes.) Note: Exact quantity not specified in provided text, but necessary for recipe completion.)

ingredients.name: Tahini
ingredients.quantity: 2 tablespoons (approximate inference based on common hummus recipes.) Note: Exact quantity not specified in provided text, but necessary for recipe completion.)

ingredients.name: Lemon Juice
ingredients.quantity: 2 tablespoons (approximate inference based on common hummus recipes.) Note: Exact quantity not specified in provided text, but necessary for recipe completion.)

ingredients.name: Garlic
ingredients.quantity: 2 cloves (approximate inference based on common hummus recipes.) Note: Exact quantity not specified in provided text, but necessary for recipe completion.)

ingredients.name: Olive Oil
ingredients.quantity: 2 tablespoons (approximate inference based on common hummus recipes.) Note: Exact quantity not specified in provided text, but necessary for recipe completion.)

instructions: Soak green moong overnight, then boil until soft.
Combine boiled green moong, avocado, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, salt, and cumin in a food processor.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Serve as a dip with vegetables, pita bread, or crackers.
description: A healthy, creamy, and protein-packed hummus made with green moong and avocado.

name: Adai

ingredients.name: split pigeon peas (toovar dal)
ingredients.quantity: ½ cup, soaked for 1 hour and drained

ingredients.name: split red lentils (masoor dal)
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup, soaked for 1 hour and drained

ingredients.name: split skinless green gram (dhuli moong dal)
ingredients.quantity: ½ cup, soaked for 1 hour and drained

ingredients.name: split Bengal gram (chana dal)
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup, soaked for 1 hour and drained

ingredients.name: short grain rice
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup, soaked for 1 hour and drained

instructions: Take a grinder jar. Add toovar dal, masoor dal, dhuli moong dal, chana dal, rice, ginger, curry leaves, dried red chillies, cumin seeds, asafoetida and salt.
Add 1½ cups water and grind to fine batter.
Heat a nonstick tawa. Spread a ladleful of batter and drizzle some oil around. Cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook for 2-3 minutes more.
Serve hot with coconut chutney.

name: Chicken Popcorn

ingredients.name: boneless chicken breast
ingredients.quantity: 300 grams, cut into ½ inch pieces

instructions: Take chicken pieces in a bowl. Add salt, red chilli powder, black pepper powder, ginger- garlic paste and vinegar mix well.
Sift refined flour, salt and baking powder in a bowl.
Roll the chicken pieces in refined flour mixture and dip in ice cold water for 30 seconds.
Roll in the refined flour mixture again.
Preheat the air fryer at 190°C for 2-3 minutes.
Spray some oil on air fryer basket and arrange the chicken pieces in a single layer.
Air fry for 6 minutes. Flip the chicken pieces, spray some more oil and air fry for 6 minutes more.
Serve hot.

name: Quick Chicken Tikka

ingredients.name: boneless chicken breasts
ingredients.quantity: 400 gms, cut into ½ inch pieces

ingredients.name: green capsicums
ingredients.quantity: 2 medium, cut into ½ inch pieces

instructions: Marinate chicken pieces with red chilli paste, salt, ginger-garlic paste, yogurt, garam masala powder and juice of lemon and mix.
Add 2 tbsps extra virgin olive oil and mix and marinate for a few hours in the refrigerator.
Heat a non stick pan and pour orange juice into it.
String the chicken pieces and capsicum pieces alternately onto skewers.
Heat a non stick tawa, drizzle a little oil and place the skewers on it.
Pack rice into a mould, demould it on a serving plate and drizzle 1 tbsp extra virgin oil over it.
Add salt, pepper powder and sugar to the orange juice and cook.
Turn the skewers so that the chicken gets cooked evenly all around.
When the sauce thickens a little, take it off the heat. Add butter and mix well.
Place the skewers over the rice, drizzle the sauce over the chicken and rice and serve immediately.
Use up the remaining chicken and rice similarly.

name: Gajar Recipes

ingredients.name: Carrots
ingredients.quantity: Various Quantities (see recipes below for details). Recipes include: Gajar Halwa, Gajar Ki Burfi, Gajar Ki Kanji, Carrot Poriyal, Gajar aur Mirch Ka Achar (Carrot and Chili Pickle))

ingredients.quantity:
1 cup (soaked overnight and boiled with salt and turmeric powder until soft but not mushy, approx. 3-4 cups water used for boiling ) Reserved the stock after boiling the moong dal. Approx 2 cups of stock after boiling the moong dal. The moong dal should be soft but not mushy.)

instructions: Soak 1 cup whole moong overnight.
Next day, boil the soaked moong with salt and turmeric powder until soft but not mushy.
Reserve the stock after boiling the moong dal (approximately 2 cups).
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds, followed by asafoetida.
Add chopped green chilies and ginger, sauté well.
Pour in the reserved moong stock and bring to a boil.
Add the boiled moong dal to the stock.
Season with salt and garam masala.
Simmer for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot.

name: Saffron Cookies

ingredients.name: saffron
ingredients.quantity: a generous pinch of saffron soaked in 2 tbsps warm milk (milk included in dairy category below.)

instructions: Take warm milk in a bowl. Add saffron and mix well.
Take butter in a bowl and beat lightly. Add icing sugar and beat till light and fluffy.
Add refined flour, green cardamom powder and salt and beat well.
Transfer the mixture in a piping bag fitted with a star nozzle.
Line a greased baking tray with parchment paper and pipe small portions of the mixture.
Sprinkle pistachios on top and freeze for 10-15 minutes.
Preheat the oven at 180°C.
Bake in preheated oven for 10-12 minutes.
Allow to cool. Store or serve.

name: Mushroom and Turmeric Soup

ingredients.name: dried shitake mushrooms
ingredients.quantity:
5-6 pieces, soaked for 40-45 minutes, drained and sliced

{message: [],

instructions: Heat 2 tbsps butter in a shallow nonstick pan.
Add garlic and sauté till golden brown.
Add onion and sauté till translucent.
Add turmeric, shitake mushrooms, button mushrooms and toss well.
Add salt, crushed black peppercorns and dried mixed herbs and mix well.
Cook for 4-5 minutes.
Add 2½ cups water and mix well.
Once the mixture comes to a boil, lower the heat, cover and cook for 6-8 minutes.
Allow to cool slightly and transfer in a grinder jar.
Add 1 cup water and grind to fine mixture.
Heat a deep nonstick pan.
Add the ground mixture, ¾ cup water and mix well.
Once the mixture comes, to a boil, discard the scum, add fresh cream and mix well.
Meanwhile, heat remaining butter in shallow nonstick pan.
Add shimeji mushrooms and saute on high heat for 2-3 minutes.
Sprinkle salt and mix well.
Take the pan off the heat and set aside.
Pour the soup in a serving bowl.
Add sauteed shimeji mushrooms in the centre, sprinkle crushed peppercorns and serve hot with lavash.

name: Air Fried Coconut Shrimps

ingredients.name: Shrimps
ingredients.quantity: 250g cleaned and deveined, tail on optional, medium size (26/30 count per pound is a good size for this recipe). Pat dry with paper towels before coating to ensure the coating adheres well.)

ingredients.name: Desiccated Coconut
ingredients.quantity: 1 cup (unsweetened, finely shredded. If the shreds are too large, pulse them in a food processor until finer.)

ingredients.name: All-Purpose Flour
ingredients.quantity: 1/2 cup (for dredging. You can also use gluten-free all-purpose flour.)

ingredients.name: Eggs
ingredients.quantity: 2 large (lightly beaten in a shallow dish.)

ingredients.name: Panko Bread Crumbs
ingredients.quantity: 1/2 cup (for extra crispiness. If you don't have panko, regular bread crumbs will work too.)

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.quantity: 1/2 teaspoon (or to taste. Add to the flour mixture.)

ingredients.name: Black Pepper
ingredients.quantity: 1/4 teaspoon (freshly ground, or to taste. Add to the flour mixture.)

ingredients.name: Garlic Powder
ingredients.quantity: 1/2 teaspoon (optional, for added flavor. Add to the flour mixture.)

ingredients.name: Paprika
ingredients.quantity: 1/4 teaspoon (optional, for color and flavor. Add to the flour mixture.)

ingredients.name: Cooking Oil Spray
ingredients.quantity: as needed (for spraying the air fryer basket. Olive oil or avocado oil spray works well.)

ingredients.name: Sweet Chili Sauce
ingredients.quantity: for serving (or your favorite dipping sauce. Mango salsa, tartar sauce, or a spicy mayo are also great options.)

ingredients.name: Lime Wedges
ingredients.quantity: for serving (optional, for a burst of citrus flavor.)

instructions: Gather all ingredients and prepare your workstation. Set up three shallow dishes: one with flour seasoned with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika (if using), one with beaten eggs, and one with desiccated coconut mixed with panko bread crumbs.
Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels. This helps the coating adhere better.
Dredge each shrimp in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess. Ensure the shrimp is fully coated.
Dip the floured shrimp into the beaten eggs, allowing any excess egg to drip off.
Press the shrimp into the coconut-panko mixture, ensuring it is fully coated on all sides. Gently press the coating to help it adhere.
Preheat your air fryer to 400°F (200°C). If your air fryer requires preheating, do so for about 3-5 minutes.
Lightly spray the air fryer basket with cooking oil spray to prevent sticking.
Arrange the coated shrimp in a single layer in the air fryer basket, ensuring they are not overcrowded. You may need to cook them in batches.
Spray the shrimp lightly with cooking oil spray. This helps them get extra crispy.
Air fry for 6-8 minutes, flipping halfway through, until the shrimp are pink and cooked through, and the coconut coating is golden brown and crispy.
Remove the air-fried coconut shrimp from the air fryer and let them cool slightly before serving.
Serve immediately with sweet chili sauce or your favorite dipping sauce and lime wedges, if desired.
description: Crispy and delicious coconut shrimp made in the air fryer for a healthier twist.

name: Chilli Chicken Toast

ingredients.name: bread slices

ingredients.name: onion

ingredients.name: capsicum

instructions: Prepare the chilli chicken mixture by cooking the chicken with chilli sauce, soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, onions, capsicum, green chilies, coriander leaves, salt, and pepper.
Spread butter on bread slices.
Top the bread slices with the prepared chilli chicken mixture.
Toast the bread slices in a pan or oven until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Tamatar Moongfalli Ki Chutney

ingredients.name: peanuts
ingredients.quantity: 1 cup (estimated based on description of richness of peanuts in chutney, adjust to preference.)

ingredients.name: tomatoes
ingredients.quantity: 2 medium (estimated based on description of freshness of tomatoes in chutney, adjust to preference.)

instructions: Heat a pan and dry roast the peanuts until they turn slightly brown.
Let the peanuts cool down and then remove the skin by rubbing them between your palms.
In a blender, add the roasted peanuts, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, garlic, ginger, cumin seeds, salt, and sugar (if using).
Blend to a coarse or smooth paste, adding a little water if needed to achieve the desired consistency.
In a small pan, heat oil for tempering.
Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add curry leaves and asafoetida, and sauté for a few seconds.
Pour the tempering over the chutney and mix well.
Add lemon juice (if using) and adjust the seasoning to taste.
Serve the chutney as a side dish with meals or as a dip with snacks.
description: Tangy, spicy, and flavorful chutney combining peanuts and tomatoes.

name: Ice Halwa

ingredients.name: roasted saffron
ingredients.quantity: a generous pinch of roasted saffron, ½ cup +2 tbsps milk, ½ cup ghee, ½ cup refined flour (maida), ½ cup castor sugar, Almond flakes to sprinkle, Pistachio powder to sprinkle

instructions: Crush roasted saffron coarsely. Add 2 tbsps milk and mix well.
Heat a nonstick kadai. Add remaining milk and once it becomes warm, add ghee and refined flour and cook for 3-4 minutes or till the mixture is thick.
Add castor sugar and cook till the mixture starts to leave the sides of the pan.
Add saffron milk and mix well.
Take a plate and spread little mixture on it. After cooling, if it easily gets rolled and doesn’t stick to your hands, the mixture is ready.
Take a piece of butter paper, spread the mixture, keep another piece of butter paper in top and roll into thin sheet with the help of a rolling pin.
Sprinkle almond flakes, pistachio powder and roll a rolling pin lightly. Air dry for 2 days.
Cut into squares and serve.

name: Moogacha Kadhan
instructions: Heat a pressure cooker.
Add sprouted green gram, salt and 2 cups water and mix well.
Cover and cook on medium heat till the pressure is released once.
Open the lid once the pressure settles completely.
Heat oil in a nonstick pan.
Add mustard seeds and once they start to splutter, add cumin seeds, asafoetida and curry leaves and sauté for a few seconds.
Add garlic and sauté till golden brown.
Lower the heat, add turmeric powder and mix well.
Add cooked green gram, salt and 1 cup water and mix well.
Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes.
Add coriander and mix well.
Transfer in a serving bowl and serve hot.

name: Rawa Paniyaram

ingredients.name: Semolina (Rawa)
ingredients.quantity: 1 cup (estimated from video and common recipes for Rawa Paniyaram, though not explicitly stated in transcript.)

ingredients.name: Vegetables (Onions, Carrots, Green Chilies)
ingredients.quantity: To taste (estimated from video and common recipes for Rawa Paniyaram, though not explicitly stated in transcript.)

ingredients.name: Curd (Yogurt)
ingredients.quantity: 1/2 cup (estimated from video and common recipes for Rawa Paniyaram, though not explicitly stated in transcript.)

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.quantity: To taste (estimated from video and common recipes for Rawa Paniyaram, though not explicitly stated in transcript.)

ingredients.name: Eno (Fruit Salt)
ingredients.quantity: 1 tsp (estimated from video and common recipes for Rawa Paniyaram, though not explicitly stated in transcript.)

ingredients.name: Oil
ingredients.quantity: For cooking (estimated from video and common recipes for Rawa Paniyaram, though not explicitly stated in transcript.)

instructions: Mix semolina with curd and salt.
Add chopped vegetables (onions, carrots, green chilies) to the semolina mixture.
Let the mixture rest for some time.
Add eno (fruit salt) to the mixture just before cooking.
Heat a paniyaram pan and grease it with oil.
Pour the batter into the paniyaram molds.
Cook on medium heat until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot.
description: Rawa Paniyaram is a delicious, crispy and soft South Indian snack made from semolina, perfect for breakfast or an evening snack.

name: Mathri Tart
instructions: Take pearl millet flour in a bowl. Add salt, carom seeds, ghee and whole wheat flour and mix well.
Add ½ cup warm water and knead to soft dough. Cover with a moist muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.
Preheat the oven at 180°C.
Place a silicone sheet on the worktop and place the dough. Keep another sheet on top and roll into thin sheet. Flip the sheet.
Cut into roundels with the help of a cookie cutter.
Grease small tart tins with ghee and line the cut roundels in tart moulds. Dock with the help of a fork.
Place the moulds on a baking tray and bake for 10- 12 minutes. Allow to cool completely and demould.
Deseed, peel and chop avocado.
Take sweet potato in a bowl. Add tomato, green chillies, salt and crushed black peppercorns.
Squeeze lemon, add avocado and mix well. Add coriander and mix well.
Place tarts in serving plate and stuff the avocado mixture. Drizzle little date and tamarind chutney, garnish with micro greens and serve.

name: Mushroom Kali Mirch
instructions: 1. Halve the mushrooms.
2. Heat 1 tbsp ghee in a shallow nonstick pan. Add the mushrooms and sauté on high heat for 4-5 minutes. Add salt and toss well.
3. Heat remaining ghee in a deep nonstick pan.  Add green cardamoms and black peppercorns and sauté till fragrant.
4. Add the boiled onion paste, green chilli paste and sauté for 5 minutes on low heat.
5. Add yogurt and sauté for 5-6 minutes.  Add khoya, cashew – melon seeds paste and mix well. Sauté for 2-3 minutes
6. Add 2 cups water and allow to boil. Lower the heat and cook for 5-6 minutes.
7. Add white pepper powder, green cardamom powder, dried fenugreek leaves powder, crushed black peppercorns and salt and mix well.
8. Add sauteed mushrooms and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes,
9. Add fresh cream and mix well.
10. Transfer in a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and a swirl of fresh cream.
11. Sprinkle crushed black peppercorns on top and serve hot with paranthe.

name: Onion Pakoda
instructions: Slice onions thinly and transfer in a bowl.
Add salt and mix well. Set aside for 10-15 minutes.
Add gram flour, crushed coriander seeds, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder and carom seeds and mix well.
Preheat the air fryer at 200°C for 2-3 minutes.
Line the air fryer basket with parchment paper and brush some oil.
Divide the onion mixture into equal portions and place in air fryer basket in single layer.
Brush some more oil on top and air fry for 6 minutes.
Flip, apply some more oil and air fry for 8 minutes.
Serve hot.

ingredients.name: chickpeas (kabuli chana)
ingredients.quantity:
350 gms, soaked
Salt to taste
1 tsp tea leaves
2 tsps coriander seeds
1½ tsps fennel seeds (saunf)
2-3 dried red chillies
1 medium onion
1 inch ginger piece, roughly chopped
100 gms cottage cheese (paneer)
Oil for shallow frying

Method

1. Boil the kabuli chana with salt and tea leaves tied in a potli till completely soft. Drain and reserve the cooking stock.
2. Heat a non stick pan, add coriander seeds, fennel seeds and red chillies and roast till fragrant.
3. Roughly chop onion and add to the pan.  Add ginger and roast for 2 minutes. Set aside to cool.
4. Mash the paneer in a bowl, add a little salt and shape into small balls.
5. Transfer the roasted spices into a mixer jar and grind with a little of the reserved cooking stock.  Add the kabuli chana and grind, without adding any more water, till the chanas are well mashed. Transfer into a bowl.
6. Heat a little oil on a non stick tawa.  Grease your palms, take a portion of the chana mixture and spread it.  Place a paneer ball in the centre and enclose it completely.  Flatten slightly and place on the tawa.  Make other chops in a similar manner and place on the tawa. Turn once and cook till both sides are cooked evenly.  Take care not to turn them more than once.  This way they will remain soft and will be melt-in-the-mouth.
7. Serve hot.

instructions: Heat a shallow nonstick pan. Add saffron and dry roast on low heat for 30 seconds.
Transfer in a mortar and crush with the help of a pestle. Add 2-3 tbsps warm water and mix well.
Heat a nonstick kadai. Add 3 cups water and once it comes to boil, add rice, saffron water and cook on medium heat for 12-15 minutes or till the rice is completely cooked.
Add castor sugar, green cardamom powder and mix well. Cook till sugar melts.
Add Butter and mix well.
Transfer in individual serving bowls, sprinkle cinnamon powder, garnish with pistachios, almonds and allow to cool down to room temperature.
Serve.

name: Kashmiri Dum Aloo

ingredients.name: baby potatoes, peeled
ingredients.quantity:
16-20 baby potatoes, peeled
2 tbsps mustard oil + for deep frying
1 bay leaf
1 inch cinnamon stick
2-3 cloves
2 black cardamoms
1¼ tsps Kashmiri red chilli powder
A pinch of asafoetida (hing)
2 tsps fennel powder
½ tsp dried ginger powder
¼ tsp turmeric powder
1 cup whisked yogurt
Salt to taste
½ tsp garam masala powder
Steamed rice for serving

Method

1. Heat mustard oil in a kadai. Prick the potatoes with the help of wooden satay stick.
2. Once the oil starts to smoke, add the potatoes and deep fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside.
3. Heat 2 tbsps mustard oil in a nonstick pan. Add bay leaf, cinnamon and cloves. Crush black cardamoms and add to the pan. Sauté till fragrant. 
4. Lower the heat, add Kashmiri red chilli powder, asafoetida, fennel powder, dried ginger powder and turmeric powder and mix well.
5. Add yogurt and cook till oil separates. Add fried potatoes and salt and mix well.
6. Add ¾ cup water and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
7. Add garam masala powder and mix well. Cook for a minute.
8. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Air Fried Kurkuri Bhindi

ingredients.name: fresh bhindi (okra)
ingredients.quantity: 500g (estimated based on common recipe sizes for Kurkuri Bhindi, adjust accordingly based on preference.)

ingredients.name: spices (turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala)
ingredients.quantity: to taste (adjust based on spice preference, approximately 1-2 tsp each.)

ingredients.name: oil
ingredients.quantity: 1-2 tsp (for tossing, minimal amount needed for air frying.)

instructions: Wash and thoroughly dry the fresh bhindi (okra).
Cut the bhindi into thin, lengthwise pieces.
In a bowl, toss the bhindi with all the spices and salt.
Add a small amount of oil (1-2 tsp) and mix well to coat the bhindi evenly.
Preheat the air fryer to 200°C (392°F).
Place the spiced bhindi in the air fryer basket in a single layer. Avoid overcrowding.
Air fry for 10-15 minutes, shaking the basket halfway through, until the bhindi is golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot as a side dish or snack.
description: Crispy and delicious okra without any extra oil, air-fried to golden perfection.

name: Crispy Spinach Parcels
instructions: To make the dough place flour in a bowl, add baking soda, salt, 2 tbsps melted butter and sufficient water and knead into a soft dough.
Blanch spinach in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain, squeeze out excess water and chop. Chop onion.
Heat 1 tbsp butter in a non stick pan, add onion and let it sweat. Add spinach, salt, pine nuts and cook till dry. Transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool.
Heat sufficient oil in a deep pan on medium heat.
Divide the dough into 4 portions and roll out each portion, dusting with flour, into thin sheets. Dust a round cookie cutter with dry flour, place it on the rolled out dough and cut out roundels.
Dampen the edges of the roundels, place a little spinach mixture in the centre and fold into a crescent shape. Seal the edges well.
Slide them into the hot oil and deep fry on medium heat till golden and crisp.
Drain on absorbent paper and serve hot.

name: Carrot and Saffron Risotto
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan. Add arborio rice and 2 tbsps butter and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add onion, garlic and sauté till onion turns translucent.
Add 1 cup vegetable stock and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add remaining vegetable stock and cook for 6-8 minutes.
Add saffron, boiled carrot puree and mix well. Cook for 1 minute.
Add salt and black pepper powder. Separate the leaves from thyme sprigs and add to the pan. Cook for 1 minute.
Grate parmesan cheese. Add remaining butter and fresh cream and mix well.
Transfer in a serving plate and arrange blanched carrot slices on top. Grate some parmesan cheese, garnish with micro greens and serve hot.

name: Indian Vada Pav Recipe (Mumbai Street Food Vada Pav)

ingredients.name: For the Vada:
ingredients.quantity:
1 cup besan (gram flour) (100 grams ) ,sifted
1/4 tsp turmeric powder
1/4 tsp red chilli powder
1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
1/2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
1/4 tsp baking soda
salt to taste
Oil for deep-frying

For the Dry Garlic Chutney:
1/2 cup roughly chopped garlic (lehsun)
1/2 cup dry coconut (khobra) pieces
2 tbsp red chilli powder
1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
salt to taste

For the Green Coriander Chutney:
1 cup roughly chopped coriander (dhania)
1/2 cup roughly chopped mint (phudina)
2 green chillies
1/2 inch ginger (adrak)
1 tbsp lemon juice
salt to taste

Other Ingredients:
6 potatoes (aloo) ,boiled ,peeled and mashed
1/2 tsp mustard seeds (rai)
1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
1/4 tsp turmeric powder
1/2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
6 ladi pav
Oil for deep-frying

{

instructions: Vada Pav is a popular Mumbai street food.
It consists of a deep-fried potato patty (vada) served in a bread roll (pav) with chutneys and fried green chillies.
Here is the recipe:
For the Vada:
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl with sufficient water and mix well to make a batter of dropping consistency.
Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a deep non-stick pan, divide the potato mixture into 6 equal portions and shape each portion into a round flat vada.
Dip each vada in the batter and deep-fry a few vadas at a time on a medium flame till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and keep aside.
For the Dry Garlic Chutney:
Combine all the ingredients in a mixer and blend to a coarse powder.
Keep aside.
For the Green Coriander Chutney:
Combine all the ingredients in a mixer and blend to a smooth paste using a little water.
Keep aside.
How to proceed:
Slit each pav into two horizontally, spread green chutney and dry garlic chutney evenly over it, place a vada and press it lightly.
Serve immediately with fried green chillies.
description: Vada Pav is a popular Mumbai street food consisting of a deep-fried potato patty served in a bread roll with chutneys and fried green chillies.
