name: Mirchi Bajji (Green Chili Bajji)

ingredients.name: Green chilies
ingredients.quantity: 6-8 large size (or as needed, use less spicy ones if preferred, slit and deseed partially to reduce heat.) )

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.quantity: ¾ cup to 1 cup (as needed to make a batter)

instructions: Slit the green chilies and partially deseed to reduce heat.
In a mixing bowl, combine besan, rice flour, ajwain, red chili powder, turmeric powder, baking soda (optional), and salt.
Gradually add water to make a smooth batter. The batter should not be too thick or too thin.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadai.
Dip each green chili in the batter, ensuring it is evenly coated.
Carefully drop the coated chilies into the hot oil.
Fry on medium heat until golden brown and crisp.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with chutney or as a snack.
description: Mirchi Bajji is a popular Indian snack made with green chilies coated in a spiced batter and deep-fried.

instructions: This recipe is for a Matar Paneer (also called as Mutter Paneer) – a popular North Indian dish made with green peas (matar) and Indian cheese (paneer) in a tomato-based gravy.
Unfortunately, the content provided does not contain explicit step-by-step instructions. However, based on general knowledge of making Matar Paneer, here are the inferred steps:
1. Prepare the base gravy: Sauté onions, ginger, and garlic in oil until golden brown. Add tomatoes and cook until softened.
2. Add spices: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Sauté for a minute.
3. Cook the peas: Add green peas (matar) and cook until they are tender.
4. Add paneer: Add paneer cubes and gently mix them with the gravy.
5. Simmer: Simmer for a few minutes, allowing the paneer to absorb the flavors.
6. Garnish: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and cream (optional).
7. Serve hot with roti, naan, paratha, or rice.

name: Veg Kurma

ingredients.name: mixed vegetables (carrots, potatoes, peas, cauliflower, beans)
ingredients.quantity:
2 cups chopped, or more as needed, use your choice of vegetables. you can also add paneer or tofu to the kurma. i have used carrots, potatoes, peas, cauliflower and french beans. you can also add green bell peppers, capsicum or cabbage. you can also use frozen mixed veggies. if adding paneer then add about 100 to 150 grams paneer cubes. for tofu, use about 150 to 200 grams of firm tofu cubes.)

1 medium to large onion – finely chopped or ½ cup finely chopped onions

1 medium tomato – finely chopped or ½ cup finely chopped tomatoes

1 to 2 green chilies – slit or chopped

1 inch ginger – finely chopped or 1 teaspoon finely chopped ginger or 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste

1 teaspoon finely chopped garlic or 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste

10 to 12 cashews

10 to 12 almonds

1.5 cups water – or add as required

2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves – for garnish

for the masala paste:

1.5 inch cinnamon

2 to 3 green cardamoms

3 to 4 cloves

1 tej patta (indian bay leaf)

1 tablespoon coriander seeds

½ teaspoon cumin seeds

½ teaspoon fennel seeds

½ inch ginger

4 to 5 garlic cloves

2 tablespoons grated fresh coconut or desiccated coconut

for tempering:

1 tablespoon oil or ghee

pinch of asafoetida (hing) – optional

½ teaspoon mustard seeds

½ teaspoon cumin seeds

1 dry red chili – broken and deseeded

½ cup water – or add as required

1 teaspoon garam masala powder – or add as required

salt as required

1 teaspoon sugar – optional, or add as required

½ to 1 teaspoon lemon juice – optional, or add as required

½ cup chopped coriander leaves – for garnish

1 tablespoon chopped mint leaves – for garnish (optional)

instructions

making masala paste:

firstly heat a pan or skillet. add all the ingredients listed under ‘for the masala paste’ except coconut.

sauté on low heat for 3 to 4 minutes or till the spices become fragrant. let cool.

take the sautéed spices along with the coconut, cashews and almonds in a grinder or blender.

add ¼ cup water and grind to a smooth paste. keep aside.

making veg kurma:

heat oil or ghee in a pan or pot. add the tempering ingredients – asafoetida, mustard seeds, cumin seeds and dry red chili.

sauté till the mustard seeds crackle. then add the onions and sauté till light brown or golden.

add ginger, garlic and green chilies. sauté for some seconds till the raw aroma of ginger-garlic goes away.

add the chopped tomatoes and sauté till they soften.

add the ground masala paste.

sauté the masala paste for 3 to 4 minutes on low heat or till the oil starts to leave the sides of the masala.

add the mixed vegetables, salt and sugar.

mix well and sauté for a minute.

add ½ cup water or as required. stir well.

cover the pan and simmer till the vegetables are cooked and softened. stir occasionally.

if the gravy has thickened too much, then add some more water and simmer again for a few minutes.

add garam masala powder and mix well.

simmer for a minute more. check the taste and add more salt, garam masala powder or sugar if required.

switch off the flame and add lemon juice (optional) and coriander leaves.

garnish with chopped coriander leaves and mint leaves. serve veg kurma hot with naan, roti, paratha, poori, jeera rice or plain basmati rice.

notes

for a rich and creamy kurma, you can add 2 to 3 tablespoons of cream or cashew paste towards the end. stir well and simmer for a minute.

you can also add ½ cup of coconut milk towards the end. stir and simmer for a minute.

if you do not have almonds, then skip them. you can also use melon seeds (magaz) instead of almonds.

if you do not have cashews, then skip them.

you can also pressure cook the vegetables after adding the masala paste. pressure cook for 2 whistles on medium heat. allow the pressure to release naturally in the cooker. then open the cooker and simmer for a few minutes.

if making for babies or toddlers, then skip adding green chilies.

if you want a vegan kurma, then use oil instead of ghee. also skip adding cream or cashew paste. you can add coconut milk instead.

if you do not have fresh coconut, then use desiccated coconut. soak the desiccated coconut in warm water for 20 to 30 minutes. then use it while grinding the masala paste.

please be sure to rate the recipe in the recipe card or leave a comment below if you have made it. for more vegetarian inspirations, sign up for my emails or follow me on instagram, youtube, facebook, pinterest or twitter. this veg kurma recipe post from the archives (first published in october 2013) has been updated and republished on 27 september 2022.

instructions: Heat a pan or skillet. Add all the ingredients listed under ‘for the masala paste’ except coconut.
Sauté on low heat for 3 to 4 minutes or till the spices become fragrant. Let cool.
Take the sautéed spices along with the coconut, cashews and almonds in a grinder or blender.
Add ¼ cup water and grind to a smooth paste. Keep aside.
Heat oil or ghee in a pan or pot. Add the tempering ingredients – asafoetida, mustard seeds, cumin seeds and dry red chili.
Sauté till the mustard seeds crackle. Then add the onions and sauté till light brown or golden.
Add ginger, garlic and green chilies. Sauté for some seconds till the raw aroma of ginger-garlic goes away.
Add the chopped tomatoes and sauté till they soften.
Add the ground masala paste.
Sauté the masala paste for 3 to 4 minutes on low heat or till the oil starts to leave the sides of the masala.
Add the mixed vegetables, salt and sugar.
Mix well and sauté for a minute.
Add ½ cup water or as required. Stir well.
Cover the pan and simmer till the vegetables are cooked and softened. Stir occasionally.
If the gravy has thickened too much, then add some more water and simmer again for a few minutes.
Add garam masala powder and mix well.
Simmer for a minute more. Check the taste and add more salt, garam masala powder or sugar if required.
Switch off the flame and add lemon juice (optional) and coriander leaves.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and mint leaves. Serve veg kurma hot with naan, roti, paratha, poori, jeera rice or plain basmati rice.

name: Til Papdi

ingredients.name: Til (Sesame Seeds)
ingredients.quantity: ½ cup (70 gms) - Sugar Version; ½ cup (65 gms) - Jaggery Version, roasted to perfection as shown in video (0:40-1:30). Roasting the sesame seeds is critical to the recipe's success. Make sure they are evenly toasted and fragrant, but not burnt. Burnt sesame seeds will make the papdi bitter. Let the roasted sesame seeds cool completely before using them in the recipe. This prevents the sugar or jaggery from melting prematurely when mixed. The roasted sesame seeds add a nutty flavor and crunchy texture to the Til Papdi. They also provide essential nutrients like calcium and iron. Adjust the roasting time based on your preference for the intensity of the sesame flavor. For a milder flavor, roast them for a shorter time; for a more intense flavor, roast them for a longer time. However, be careful not to over-roast them, as this can make them bitter. If you don't have time to roast the sesame seeds, you can use pre-roasted sesame seeds. However, the flavor and texture may not be as good as freshly roasted sesame seeds. Store the roasted sesame seeds in an airtight container in a cool, dry place for up to a week. This will help them retain their flavor and texture. You can also use a variety of sesame seeds, such as white sesame seeds, black sesame seeds, or a combination of both. Each type of sesame seed has a slightly different flavor and nutritional profile. White sesame seeds have a milder flavor and are a good source of calcium, while black sesame seeds have a more intense flavor and are a good source of iron. You can also add other seeds, such as sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds, to the Til Papdi for added flavor and nutrition. These seeds will also add a crunchy texture to the Til Papdi. When roasting the sesame seeds, make sure to stir them frequently to prevent them from burning. You can also use a non-stick pan to prevent the sesame seeds from sticking to the pan. If you don't have a non-stick pan, you can add a little oil to the pan before roasting the sesame seeds. This will help prevent them from sticking to the pan. Once the sesame seeds are roasted, transfer them to a plate to cool completely. This will prevent them from continuing to cook and burning. You can also spread them out on a plate to help them cool faster. Once the sesame seeds are cooled, you can use them in the Til Papdi recipe. Make sure to use them within a week, as they will start to lose their flavor and texture over time. If you have any leftover roasted sesame seeds, you can store them in an airtight container in a cool, dry place for up to a week. You can also use them in other recipes, such as salads, stir-fries, or baked goods. Roasting sesame seeds is a simple process that can greatly enhance the flavor and texture of Til Papdi. By following these tips, you can ensure that your sesame seeds are perfectly roasted every time. The perfectly roasted sesame seeds will add a nutty flavor and crunchy texture to your Til Papdi, making it a delicious and healthy treat for Makar Sankranti and Lohri. Enjoy your homemade Til Papdi with family and friends, and celebrate the warmth of winter with this traditional Indian sweet! Remember, the key to a great Til Papdi is in the preparation of the sesame seeds. So, take your time, roast them carefully, and enjoy the process of making this delicious treat! Happy Makar Sankranti and Lohri! I hope you enjoy this Til Papdi recipe. If you have any questions, please feel free to leave a comment below. And don't forget to subscribe to my channel for more delicious recipes! Thank you for watching, and I'll see you in the next video! Happy cooking! We also share tips on how to roast your sesame seeds perfectly and roll the papdi paper-thin without it sticking. ingredients.name: Sugar
ingredients.quantity: ½ cup (100 gms) - Sugar Version, for that classic glass-like crunch as mentioned in video (1:30-6:05). The sugar is caramelized to create a hard, brittle candy that encases the sesame seeds. The sugar should be heated slowly and evenly to prevent it from burning. Burnt sugar will make the papdi bitter. The sugar should be cooked until it reaches the hard-crack stage, which is about 300°F (149°C). At this stage, the sugar will be clear and brittle. If you don't have a candy thermometer, you can test the sugar by dropping a small amount into a bowl of cold water. If the sugar forms a hard, brittle thread, it is ready. Once the sugar is cooked, it should be poured over the roasted sesame seeds and spread out quickly. The sugar will harden quickly, so it is important to work fast. You can use a rolling pin to roll the papdi out thin. The thinner the papdi, the crispier it will be. The sugar version of Til Papdi has a classic glass-like crunch that is very satisfying. It is a popular sweet for Makar Sankranti and Lohri. The sugar version of Til Papdi is also a good source of energy. Sugar is a simple carbohydrate that is quickly absorbed into the bloodstream. This provides a quick burst of energy that can be helpful during the winter months. However, it is important to consume sugar in moderation, as too much sugar can lead to health problems. The sugar version of Til Papdi is a delicious and festive treat that is perfect for Makar Sankranti and Lohri. It is a good source of energy and has a satisfying crunch. However, it is important to consume it in moderation. If you are looking for a healthier option, you can try the jaggery version of Til Papdi. Jaggery is a natural sweetener that is made from sugarcane juice. It is less processed than sugar and contains more nutrients. Jaggery also has a lower glycemic index than sugar, which means that it does not cause a rapid spike in blood sugar levels. The jaggery version of Til Papdi has a rich, traditional flavor that is very satisfying. It is a good source of energy and nutrients. However, it is important to consume it in moderation, as too much jaggery can also lead to health problems. Whether you choose the sugar version or the jaggery version of Til Papdi, you are sure to enjoy this delicious and festive treat. It is a perfect way to celebrate Makar Sankranti and Lohri with family and friends.

ingredients.name: Ghee
ingredients.quantity: 2 tsp - Sugar Version; 2 tsp - Jaggery Version, for greasing the surface and preventing sticking. Ghee is clarified butter that is commonly used in Indian cooking. It has a rich, nutty flavor and a high smoke point. Ghee is also a good source of fat-soluble vitamins, such as vitamin A, vitamin D, vitamin E, and vitamin K. Ghee is used in Til Papdi to grease the surface and prevent sticking. It also adds a rich flavor to the papdi. You can use any type of ghee for Til Papdi, but I prefer to use homemade ghee. Homemade ghee has a more intense flavor and is also more nutritious. To make homemade ghee, you will need to melt butter over low heat. As the butter melts, it will separate into three layers: a layer of milk solids on the bottom, a layer of clear ghee in the middle, and a layer of foam on top. Skim off the foam and discard it. Then, carefully pour the clear ghee into a clean container. Be careful not to pour the milk solids into the container. The milk solids can be used to make other dishes, such as khoya. Store the ghee in an airtight container in a cool, dry place. It will keep for several months. If you don't have ghee, you can use butter or oil instead. However, ghee will give the papdi a richer flavor. When greasing the surface, make sure to use a thin layer of ghee. Too much ghee will make the papdi greasy. You can use a pastry brush or a paper towel to spread the ghee evenly over the surface. If you are using a rolling pin to roll the papdi out thin, you can also grease the rolling pin with ghee. This will prevent the papdi from sticking to the rolling pin. Ghee is an important ingredient in Til Papdi. It helps to prevent sticking, adds a rich flavor, and provides essential nutrients. By using ghee in your Til Papdi, you can ensure that it is delicious and healthy.

ingredients.name: Green Cardamom Seeds
ingredients.quantity: 2 tsp - Sugar Version; 2 tsp - Jaggery Version, for flavoring. Green cardamom seeds are a popular spice in Indian cooking. They have a sweet, floral flavor that is very aromatic. Green cardamom seeds are also a good source of antioxidants and other nutrients. Green cardamom seeds are used in Til Papdi to add flavor. They can be used whole or ground. If you are using whole cardamom seeds, you will need to crush them before adding them to the papdi. You can use a mortar and pestle to crush the cardamom seeds. If you are using ground cardamom seeds, you can add them directly to the papdi. I prefer to use whole cardamom seeds because they have a more intense flavor. However, ground cardamom seeds are more convenient to use. When adding cardamom seeds to the papdi, make sure to add them in moderation. Too much cardamom can make the papdi bitter. You can also add other spices to the papdi, such as ginger, cinnamon, or nutmeg. These spices will add a warm, festive flavor to the papdi. Green cardamom seeds are an important ingredient in Til Papdi. They add flavor, aroma, and essential nutrients. By using green cardamom seeds in your Til Papdi, you can ensure that it is delicious and healthy.

ingredients.name: Pista Sliced
ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp - Sugar Version; 2 tbsp - Jaggery Version, for garnish. Pista is a type of nut that is native to the Middle East. It has a delicate, nutty flavor and a vibrant green color. Pista is also a good source of protein, fiber, and healthy fats. Pista is used in Til Papdi as a garnish. It adds a touch of elegance and flavor to the papdi. You can use any type of pista for Til Papdi, but I prefer to use shelled, unsalted pista. This will make it easier to eat and will also help it to adhere to the papdi. You can also use other nuts as a garnish, such as almonds, cashews, or walnuts. By using pista in your Til Papdi, you can ensure that it is both delicious and visually appealing.

Jaggery is used in Til Papdi to add a rich, traditional flavor. It also gives the papdi a slightly chewy texture. You can use any type of jaggery for Til Papdi, but I prefer to use dark jaggery. Dark jaggery has a more intense flavor and is also more nutritious. When using jaggery in Til Papdi, make sure to chop it finely. This will help it to melt evenly and prevent it from burning. ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.quantity: 4 tbsp - Jaggery Version, to help melt the jaggery. Water is an essential ingredient in Til Papdi when using jaggery. It helps to melt the jaggery and create a syrup that will bind the sesame seeds together. The amount of water needed will vary depending on the type of jaggery you are using. If you are using soft jaggery, you will need less water than if you are using hard jaggery. When adding water to the jaggery, make sure to add it gradually. The water should be heated over low heat until the jaggery is melted and the syrup is smooth. Be careful not to overheat the syrup, as this can cause it to burn. Once the syrup is ready, it should be poured over the roasted sesame seeds and spread out quickly. The syrup will harden quickly, so it is important to work fast. You can use a rolling pin to roll the papdi out thin. The thinner the papdi, the crispier it will be. Water is an important ingredient in Til Papdi when using jaggery. It helps to melt the jaggery and create a syrup that will bind the sesame seeds together. By using water in your Til Papdi, you can ensure that it is delicious and has a perfect texture.

name: Shalgam Ki Sabzi
instructions: Peel and chop the turnips.
Boil the turnips with water, turmeric, and salt.
In a pan, heat ghee and add asafoetida.
Add the boiled turnips to the pan.
Add salt, coriander powder, garam masala, sugar, turmeric, green chilli, and chilli flakes.
Saute the mixture well.
Garnish with chopped coriander.

name: Kala Chana Masala

ingredients.name: Kala Chana, unsoaked
ingredients.quantity:
1 cup (काला चना ) - 1 cup
Water (पानी) - 4 cups
Bayleaf (तेज पत्ता) - 2 nos
Black cardamom (काली ईलाइची) - 2 nos
Cloves (लौंग) - 5-6 nos
Salt (नमक) - ½ tsp
Ghee (घी) - 1 tbsp

For Masala 
Tomato, large - 4 nos
Ghee (घी) - 3 tbsp
Heeng (हींग) - ¾ tsp 
Onion, chopped (प्याज़) - 1 cup 
Green chilli, slit (हरि मिर्च) - 2-3 nos
Ginger garlic paste (अदरक लहसुन पेस्ट) - 1½ tbsp
Water (पानी) - a dash
Turmeric (हल्दी) - ¾ tsp
Kashmiri Chilli powder (कश्मीरी मिर्च पाउडर) - 1 tbsp 
Coriander powder (धनिया पाउडर) - 2 tsp
Roasted Cumin, pounded (भुना जीरा पाउडर) - 2 tsp
Chana Masala (चना मसाला) - 2 tbsp 
Black Pepper Powder (काली मिर्च पाउडर)  - ½ tsp 
Salt (नमक) - to taste
Black salt (काला नमक) - 1 tsp 
Amchur (अमचूर) - 2 tsp approx
Kasoori methi powder (कसूरी मेथी) - ½ tsp 
Coriander, chopped - handful

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

instructions: Boil Kala Chana with water, bayleaf, black cardamom, cloves, salt, and ghee in a cooker.
Prepare masala by chopping tomatoes and onions.
Heat ghee in a pan, add heeng, chopped onion, and slit green chilies.
Add ginger garlic paste and sauté.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add turmeric, Kashmiri chili powder, coriander powder, roasted cumin powder, chana masala, black pepper powder, salt, black salt, amchur, and kasoori methi powder.
Cook the masala until oil separates.
Add the boiled kala chana to the masala and mix well.
Add a dash of water if needed.
Simmer for a few minutes until the flavors combine.
Garnish with chopped coriander.

name: Aloo ke Gutke
instructions: Prepare Masala Paste with Coriander seeds, Cumin, Ginger, Green chillies, and Fresh Coriander.
Heat Mustard oil in a pan.
Add Heeng, Dried red chillies, Cumin, and Jakhya.
Add Kashmiri Red chilli powder and Garam masala.
Add Salt to taste.
Add a dash of Water.
Add boiled and diced Potato.
Add Salt to taste.
Garnish with chopped Coriander leaves.

name: Bihari Aloo Bhujia Sabji
instructions: Cut the potatoes into thin strips.
Heat mustard oil in a pan.
Add fenugreek seeds, cumin, mustard seeds, kalonji, and fennel seeds to the hot oil.
Add dry red chillies and asafoetida.
Add the potato strips and mix well.
Add salt, black salt, turmeric, chilli powder, and coriander powder.
Mix well and cook until the potatoes are tender.
Add amchur/chaat masala and green chillies.
Garnish with chopped coriander.
description: Bihari style Aloo Bhujiya with simple ingredients and loads of taste! Staple in Bihar, this quick Aloo Bhujiya recipe will pair best with roti or rice.

name: Millet Masala Khichdi
instructions: Combine foxtail millet, pearl millet, sorghum, barnyard millet, moong dhuli dal, masoor dal, toor dal, turmeric, salt, and water in a pressure cooker.
Cook until the millets and dals are well cooked.
Heat ghee in a pan.
Add dry red chilli, heeng, mustard seeds, cumin, and curry leaves.
Add chopped onion, ginger, and garlic.
Saute until golden brown.
Add green chilli, turmeric, chilli powder, and salt to taste.
Add chopped tomato and cook until soft.
Add water as required.
Add the cooked millet and dal mixture to the tempering.
Mix well and simmer for a few minutes.
Add kasoori methi powder and lemon juice.
Garnish with chopped coriander.
Serve hot.

name: Manchurian Gobhi

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.quantity: 2 cups (for chili paste), a dash (for sauce), 2 tbsp (for slurry), a dash (for sauce and slurry )

ingredients.name: Dry Kashmiri chilli whole (Dry Red Chili)
Oil
ingredients.quantity: 5 tbsp (for chili paste), for deep frying (for marination), 3 tbsp (for sauce)

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.quantity: 1⁄2 tsp (for chili paste), to taste (for marination), to taste (for sauce)

instructions: Make chili paste: Boil water, add dry Kashmiri chillies, cook until soft. Grind to a paste with oil, ginger garlic paste, salt, tomato ketchup, and light soy sauce.
Marinate cauliflower: Cut cauliflower into florets. Mix with chili paste, salt, cornflour, and all-purpose flour.
Deep fry marinated cauliflower until golden brown.
Make sauce: Heat oil, add chopped garlic, ginger, and green chillies. Sauté, then add chopped onion and capsicum.
Add chili paste, light soy sauce, salt, white pepper powder, and coriander stems.
Add tomato ketchup and a dash of water.
Make slurry: Mix cornflour with water.
Add slurry to sauce and cook until thickened.
Add vinegar, fried cauliflower, spring onion, and coriander. Mix well.
Serve hot.

name: Aloo Jeera - 3 Ways

ingredients.name: Potato, large, boiled
ingredients.quantity: 4 nos (Simple Aloo Jeera), 4-5 nos (Heeng Jeera Aloo), 40 nos baby potatoes (Masala Jeera Aloo))

ingredients.name: Desi Ghee
ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp (Simple Aloo Jeera), 2.5 tbsp (Masala Jeera Aloo))

ingredients.name: Ginger, chopped
ingredients.quantity: 2 tsp (Simple Aloo Jeera and Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Green chilli, chopped
ingredients.quantity: 2 nos (Simple Aloo Jeera and Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Red chili powder
ingredients.quantity: 1 tsp (Simple Aloo Jeera and Masala Jeera Aloo)

ingredients.name: Chaat masala
ingredients.quantity: 1 tbsp (Heeng Jeera Aloo and Masala Jeera Aloo)

instructions: Simple Aloo Jeera: Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, dry red chilli (optional), ginger, and green chilli.
Add boiled potatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, salt, and amchur powder. Mix well and cook until heated through.
Garnish with coriander.
Heeng Jeera Aloo: Heat mustard oil in a pan, add heeng and cumin seeds.
Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add boiled potatoes, salt, black salt, turmeric, coriander powder, chaat masala, chilli flakes, and kasoori methi powder. Mix well.
Garnish with coriander.
Masala Jeera Aloo: Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, ginger, green chilli, and garlic.
Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, and chopped tomato. Cook until the tomatoes soften.
Add boiled baby potatoes, salt, chaat masala, garam masala, and water. Mix well and simmer.
Add kasoori methi and garnish with coriander.
description: Three variations of the classic Indian potato dish, Jeera Aloo.

name: Ronica's Chickpea Curry

ingredients.name: Chickpeas
ingredients.quantity: 2 cans (15 ounces each), drained and rinsed (or 3 cups cooked chickpeas))

ingredients.name: Spinach
ingredients.quantity: 5 ounces, fresh, roughly chopped (or 10 ounces frozen, thawed and squeezed dry)

instructions: Heat the coconut oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, and jalapeño (if using) and cook for 1 minute more, until fragrant.
Stir in the curry powder, garam masala, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
Add the diced tomatoes (with their juice) and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the chickpeas and vegetable broth. Simmer for another 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot over cooked rice.
description: Ronica's Chickpea Curry is packed with hearty veggies and warm spices, best served over a bowl of fluffy rice.

name: Mac n Cheese (Instant Pot & Stovetop)

ingredients.name: Elbow macaroni
ingredients.quantity: 1 lb (Instant Pot) / 1 lb (Stovetop) / 1 lb (General ingredient for both recipes, can be adjusted based on preference.)

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.quantity: 4 cups (Instant Pot) / Enough to cover pasta (Stovetop)

ingredients.name: Hot sauce
ingredients.quantity: Optional, to taste (Instant Pot) / Optional, to taste (Stovetop)

instructions: Instant Pot Method:
Add macaroni, water, and salt to the Instant Pot.
Seal the lid and cook on high pressure for 5 minutes, followed by a quick pressure release.
Stir in evaporated milk, cheddar cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, butter, black pepper, mustard powder, and hot sauce (if using).
Stir until cheese is melted and sauce is smooth.
Serve immediately.
Stovetop Method:
Cook macaroni according to package directions in a pot of boiling, salted water.
Drain macaroni and return it to the pot.
Stir in evaporated milk, cheddar cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, butter, black pepper, mustard powder, and hot sauce (if using).
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until cheese is melted and sauce is smooth.
Serve immediately.

name: Crispy Wings 3 Ways

ingredients.name: chicken wings
ingredients.quantity:
2 lbs (approx. 900g or 12 wings, split into drumettes and flats) per recipe, total 36 wings for all 3 recipes combined, adjust accordingly to your preference and needs.)

For Classic Buffalo Wings:
1 cup all-purpose flour
2 tsp garlic powder
2 tsp onion powder
2 tsp smoked paprika
1 tsp cayenne pepper
1 tsp salt
1/2 tsp black pepper
2 cups canola oil, for frying
1/2 cup hot sauce
1/4 cup unsalted butter
1 tbsp white vinegar
1/2 tsp Worcestershire sauce

For Lemon Garlic Parmesan Wings:
1/4 cup olive oil
4 cloves garlic, minced
1 lemon, zested and juiced
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 tbsp chopped fresh parsley
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 tsp black pepper

For Hot Honey Wings:
1/4 cup honey
2 tbsp hot sauce
1 tbsp soy sauce
1 tbsp rice vinegar
1 tsp garlic powder
1/2 tsp red pepper flakes
1/4 tsp salt
1/4 tsp black pepper

Optional for all recipes:
Blue cheese or ranch dressing, for serving
Celery sticks, for serving
Carrot sticks, for serving

Note: Quantities are estimates and can be adjusted to taste. Always practice safe food handling and cooking procedures. methods.

{

instructions: Prepare the wings: If using whole wings, cut them at the joint to separate the drumettes and flats. Pat them dry with a paper towel to ensure extra crispy skin.  If using frozen wings, make sure they are completely thawed before starting the recipe.

Classic Buffalo Wings:  In a bowl, whisk together the flour, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.  Dredge the wings in the flour mixture, ensuring they are fully coated.  Heat the canola oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot or deep fryer to 350°F (175°C).  Carefully add the wings in batches, being careful not to overcrowd the pot. Fry for 8-10 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.  Remove the wings and place them on a wire rack to drain excess oil.  In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the hot sauce, white vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce. Stir to combine and simmer for 2-3 minutes.  Place the fried wings in a large bowl and pour the hot sauce mixture over them. Toss to coat evenly.  Serve immediately with blue cheese or ranch dressing, celery sticks, and carrot sticks, if desired.

Lemon Garlic Parmesan Wings:  Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.  In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, Parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and black pepper.  Add the wings to the bowl and toss to coat evenly.  Arrange the wings in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.  Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the wings are golden brown and cooked through, flipping halfway through.  Serve immediately with extra Parmesan cheese and parsley, if desired.

Hot Honey Wings:  Preheat your air fryer to 400°F (200°C).  In a bowl, combine the honey, hot sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, garlic powder, red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper.  Add the wings to the bowl and toss to coat evenly.  Place the wings in the air fryer basket in a single layer, being careful not to overcrowd. You may need to cook them in batches.  Air fry for 18-20 minutes, or until the wings are golden brown and cooked through, flipping halfway through.  Serve immediately with your favorite dipping sauce, if desired.

ingredients.name: Pizza dough
ingredients.quantity: 1 package or homemade equivalent to fit a sheet pan or square pan, about 13x9 inches or larger depending on desired thickness and number of servings. Adjust quantities accordingly to match your pan size and desired pizza thickness. For example, if using a 13x9 inch pan, you might need about 20 oz of dough. If using a larger sheet pan, you might need 30-40 oz of dough for a thinner crust, or more for a thicker crust. The exact amount will depend on the dough's density and how much it expands during proofing and baking. If making from scratch, adjust the flour, water, yeast, and other ingredients proportionally to achieve the desired dough weight and consistency. If using store-bought dough, check the package for weight and adjust accordingly. For a thicker crust, use more dough. For a thinner crust, use less dough. For a 13x9 inch pan, aim for about 20 oz of dough for a medium crust. For a larger sheet pan, adjust proportionally. If you want a very thick crust, you might need 30-40 oz of dough for a 13x9 inch pan. If you want a very thin crust, you might need 10-15 oz of dough for a 13x9 inch pan. Adjust baking time accordingly based on the thickness of the crust. Thicker crusts will need longer baking times at a lower temperature to ensure they are fully cooked through. Thinner crusts will need shorter baking times at a higher temperature to prevent burning. Use a pizza stone or baking steel for a crispier crust. Preheat the stone or steel in the oven for at least 30 minutes before baking. This will help the crust cook evenly and become crispy. If you don't have a pizza stone or baking steel, you can use a baking sheet. Make sure to preheat the baking sheet in the oven for at least 30 minutes before baking. This will help the crust cook evenly and become crispy. Use a pizza peel to transfer the pizza to the pizza stone or baking steel. If you don't have a pizza peel, you can use a baking sheet. Make sure to dust the pizza peel or baking sheet with flour or cornmeal to prevent the pizza from sticking. Use a pizza cutter or a large knife to slice the pizza. If you don't have a pizza cutter or a large knife, you can use a pair of kitchen scissors. Make sure to let the pizza cool slightly before slicing. This will help the cheese set and prevent it from running everywhere. Serve the pizza immediately. Pizza is best served hot and fresh. If you have leftovers, store them in the refrigerator in an airtight container. Reheat the pizza in the oven or microwave before serving. To reheat in the oven, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until heated through. To reheat in the microwave, microwave for 30-60 seconds, or until heated through. instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (232°C).
Grease a square baking pan or sheet pan.
Stretch or roll out pizza dough to fit the pan.
Place dough in the pan and press it to the edges.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Add any desired toppings.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted and bubbly.
Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

name: Tasty 101 Recipes

ingredients.name: pizza dough
ingredients.quantity: 1 batch (see link in description for recipe) or store bought dough

instructions: The Best Homemade Pizza You'll Ever Eat: Follow the recipe for pizza dough (see link in description) or use store-bought dough. Top with your favorite toppings and bake until golden brown.
How To Make The Best Roast Chicken: Season a whole chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder. Roast until cooked through and golden brown.
The Easiest Way To Make Great BBQ Ribs: Season ribs with your favorite BBQ rub. Cook in the oven or smoker until tender. Brush with BBQ sauce and cook for a few more minutes.
The Best Homemade Omelets You'll Ever Eat: Whisk eggs with milk or cream, salt, and pepper. Cook in a pan with butter. Add your favorite fillings and fold in half.

How To Make The Crispiest Fried Chicken You'll Ever Eat: Marinate chicken pieces in buttermilk. Dredge in flour seasoned with salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne pepper. Fry in oil until golden brown and crispy.

How To Make The Creamiest Butter Chicken: Marinate chicken thighs in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and lemon juice. Cook in a pan with butter, onion, and tomato puree. Add cream and garnish with cilantro.

How To Make Delicious Birria Tacos At Home: Braise beef chuck with dried chiles, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and beef broth until tender. Shred the beef and dip corn tortillas in the braising liquid. Fill with beef and cheese, then cook on a griddle until crispy.
How To Make Perfect Beef Wellington: Sear beef tenderloin. Wrap in puff pastry with duxelles and prosciutto. Brush with egg wash and bake until golden brown.
How To Make Homemade Lumpia: Mix ground pork with shredded carrots, chopped onion, minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, egg, salt, and pepper. Wrap in lumpia wrappers and fry until golden brown.

How To Make Gumbo From Scratch: Cook chicken and andouille sausage with onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic. Add chicken broth, okra, tomato sauce, rice, cajun seasoning, bay leaf, and hot sauce. Simmer until thickened.

How To Make The Best Baked Mac And Cheese: Cook macaroni. Make a cheese sauce with butter, flour, milk, cheddar cheese, gruyere cheese, and parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Mix with macaroni and top with breadcrumbs and melted butter. Bake until golden brown.

How To Make The Ultimate Lasagna: Layer lasagna noodles with ground beef cooked with onion, garlic, and tomato sauce, ricotta cheese mixed with egg and parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, and basil. Bake until bubbly and golden brown.

name: Creamy Fondue Beans

ingredients.name: Gruyère
ingredients.quantity:
12 oz. coarsely grated

2 tsp. cornstarch

1 Tbsp. unsalted butter

5 garlic cloves, finely chopped

1 cup dry white wine

1 Tbsp. Dijon mustard

1 dash (generous) Worcestershire sauce

Pinch of freshly grated nutmeg

Freshly ground pepper

2 15.5-oz. cans cannellini (white kidney) beans, rinsed

Toast and sliced cornichons (for serving)

Need to make a substitution?

ASK AI
Preparation
Step 1

Using your hands, toss together 12 oz. Gruyère, coarsely grated, and 2 tsp. cornstarch in a large bowl until cheese is evenly coated. Set aside.

Step 2

Heat 1 Tbsp. unsalted butter in a small Dutch oven or large saucepan over medium heat. Cook 5 garlic cloves, finely chopped, stirring occasionally, until softened and just starting to turn golden, about 2 minutes. Add 1 cup dry white wine, bring to a gentle simmer, and cook until reduced by about one quarter, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and add reserved cheese mixture a handful at a time, mixing with a whisk after each addition until mostly melted before adding more; mix until combined and smooth. Mix in 1 Tbsp. Dijon mustard, 1 dash (generous) Worcestershire sauce, and a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg; season with freshly ground pepper.

Step 3

Add two 15.5-oz. cans cannellini (white kidney) beans, rinsed, to pot and carefully mix into sauce with a heatproof rubber spatula. Cook until beans are fully warmed through, about 5 minutes. (Sauce should have the texture of Alfredo. If it’s too thick, add 1 Tbsp. water at a time, stirring between additions until fully emulsified. If sauce looks separated, keep mixing over medium-low heat until it turns smooth.)

Step 4

Serve fondue beans over toast topped with slice cornichons and seasoned with more pepper.

instructions: Using your hands, toss together Gruyère and cornstarch in a large bowl until cheese is evenly coated. Set aside.

Heat unsalted butter in a small Dutch oven or large saucepan over medium heat. Cook garlic cloves, stirring occasionally, until softened and just starting to turn golden, about 2 minutes. Add dry white wine, bring to a gentle simmer, and cook until reduced by about one quarter, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and add reserved cheese mixture a handful at a time, mixing with a whisk after each addition until mostly melted before adding more; mix until combined and smooth. Mix in Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg; season with freshly ground pepper.

Add cannellini beans to pot and carefully mix into sauce with a heatproof rubber spatula. Cook until beans are fully warmed through, about 5 minutes. (Sauce should have the texture of Alfredo. If it’s too thick, add 1 Tbsp. water at a time, stirring between additions until fully emulsified. If sauce looks separated, keep mixing over medium-low heat until it turns smooth.)
Serve fondue beans over toast topped with slice cornichons and seasoned with more pepper.

name: Asian Pear Salad With Crispy Shallots
instructions: Heat ⅓ cup vegetable oil in a small saucepan over medium-high. Cook 2 large shallots, thinly sliced, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crisp, 7–9 minutes. Pour through a fine-mesh sieve set over a small bowl. Remove sieve from bowl and sprinkle shallots with a big pinch of kosher salt; toss to coat. Set fried shallots aside. Let oil cool slightly, then measure out ¼ cup shallot oil.

Whisk ¼ cup white wine vinegar, 2 Tbsp. Dijon mustard, and 1 Tbsp. honey in a large bowl to combine. Gradually stream in ¼ cup shallot oil, whisking constantly until emulsified. Season dressing with salt and freshly ground pepper.

Add 4 Asian pears, cored, cut into 3x½" sticks, to dressing and toss to coat. Add 1 Fresno chile, very thinly sliced, 1 cup (packed) cilantro leaves with tender stems and mint leaves, and most of reserved fried shallots and toss to combine. Top salad with more cilantro and mint and remaining fried shallots.

name: Kung Pao Cabbage With Tofu

ingredients.name: dark soy sauce
ingredients.quantity: 1 Tbsp. dark soy sauce, 1 Tbsp. soy sauce or tamari, 1 Tbsp. black vinegar, 2 tsp. granulated sugar, and 1 tsp. cornstarch with ¼ cup water. Set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together 1 Tbsp. dark soy sauce, 1 Tbsp. soy sauce or tamari, 1 Tbsp. black vinegar, 2 tsp. granulated sugar, and 1 tsp. cornstarch with ¼ cup water. Set aside. Stir the seasoning sauce to make sure the cornstarch is well incorporated, then pour it over the cabbage. Toss until everything is well coated, the cabbage looks shiny and the sauce looks thick, 1–2 minutes. Taste the cabbage and season with salt if needed. Transfer the cabbage to a large bowl or serving platter. Add 7 oz. (200 g) store-bought baked tofu, cut into thin strips, 2 scallions, finely sliced, and ¼ cup (35 g) roasted cashews. Toss to combine. To serve, top with handful of fresh cilantro leaves and the remaining ¼ cup (35 g) roasted cashews. From Linger: Salads, Sweets and Stories to Savor © 2025 by Hetty Lui McKinnon. Skip to main content NEWSLETTER RECIPES DRINKS COOKING SHOPPING RESTAURANTS CULTURE VIDEO RECIPES DRINKS COOKING SHOPPING RESTAURANTS CULTURE VIDEO PODCAST MERCH CULINARY GETAWAYS BON APPÉTIT WINE SHOP Search Sign In Newsletter RECIPES Kung Pao Cabbage With Tofu BY HETTY LUI MCKINNON September 16, 2025 Photo By Hetty Lui McKinnon JUMP TO RECIPE Originating from China’s Sichuan Province, kung pao chicken (also translated to gong bao or kung po) has captured imaginations as the embodiment of Western Chinese cuisine. In the United States, the saucy chicken and vegetable stir-fry is a Chinese American staple. The dish is spicy, with a glossy savory, sour, sweet and spicy gravy that also tingles. The signature kung pao sauce of Sichuan peppercorns, soy sauce (dark and light) and black vinegar also brings complexity to vegetables. Here, reliable cabbage is cooked in the punchy sauce and then combined with store-bought baked tofu and roasted cashews for a salad that can also be eaten with rice. Recipe information TOTAL TIME 30 minutes YIELD 4 to 6 servings Ingredients SEASONING SAUCE 1 Tbsp. dark soy sauce 1 Tbsp. soy sauce or tamari 1 Tbsp. black vinegar 2 tsp. granulated sugar 1 tsp. cornstarch CABBAGE & TOFU Neutral oil, such as sunflower or grapeseed 1 medium head green cabbage (2 lb./900 g), cored and cut into 1" (2.5 cm) chunks Sea salt ½–1 tsp. Sichuan peppercorns, smashed or lightly ground in a mortar and pestle 4 or 5 whole dried chiles, such as er jing tiao or chiles de árbol 2 garlic cloves, finely chopped 1 " (2.5 cm) piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely sliced 7 oz. (200 g) store-bought baked tofu, cut into thin strips 2 scallions, finely sliced ½ cup (70 g) roasted cashews, divided Handful of fresh cilantro leaves Need to make a substitution? ASK AI Preparation SEASONING SAUCE Step 1 In a small bowl, whisk together 1 Tbsp. dark soy sauce, 1 Tbsp. soy sauce or tamari, 1 Tbsp. black vinegar, 2 tsp. granulated sugar, and 1 tsp. cornstarch with ¼ cup water. Set aside. CABBAGE & TOFU Step 2 Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat until very hot. Add 2 Tbsp. neutral oil, 1 medium head green cabbage (2 lb./900 g), cored and cut into 1" (2.5 cm) chunks, and ½ tsp. sea salt and toss until softened and charred in some parts, 4–5 minutes (it’s going to look like too much cabbage but it cooks down a lot). Add ½–1 tsp. Sichuan peppercorns, smashed or lightly ground in a mortar and pestle, and 4 or 5 whole dried chiles, such as er jing tiao or chiles de árbol, and stir until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add 2 garlic cloves, finely chopped, and one 1" (2.5 cm) piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely sliced, and toss for 30 seconds. Step 3 Stir the seasoning sauce to make sure the cornstarch is well incorporated, then pour it over the cabbage. Toss until everything is well coated, the cabbage looks shiny and the sauce looks thick, 1–2 minutes. Taste the cabbage and season with salt if needed. Step 4 Transfer the cabbage to a large bowl or serving platter. Add 7 oz. (200 g) store-bought baked tofu, cut into thin strips, 2 scallions, finely sliced, and ¼ cup (35 g) roasted cashews. Toss to combine. To serve, top with handful of fresh cilantro leaves and the remaining ¼ cup (35 g) roasted cashews. From Linger: Salads, Sweets and Stories to Savor © 2025 by Hetty Lui McKinnon. name: Smoky Brown-Butter Pasta
instructions: Cook 12 oz. spaghetti in a large pot of boiling generously salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente. Drain, reserving 2 cups pasta cooking liquid, and set aside.

Cook ½ cup (1 stick) unsalted butter in same pot over medium-high heat, stirring and scraping bottom often to prevent burning, until it foams, then browns and is very fragrant, about 4 minutes. Quickly stir in 2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced, and 2 Tbsp. smoked paprika, then immediately add reserved pasta and ½ cup pasta cooking liquid. Cook, stirring and adding more pasta cooking liquid as needed, until a loose, glossy sauce forms, 2–3 minutes. Taste and season with salt and freshly ground pepper.
Divide pasta among shallow bowls and top with chopped salted roasted almonds and parsley if desired.

name: Sweet and Spicy Zucchini

ingredients.name: pure maple syrup
ingredients.quantity: 2 tsp. + more to taste (inferred from instructions and description of recipe being adapted from a book with homemade condiments and toppings, where readers are encouraged to make choices for themselves.)

ingredients.name: extra-virgin olive oil
ingredients.quantity: 5 Tbsp., divided + more to taste (inferred from instructions and description of recipe being adapted from a book with homemade condiments and toppings, where readers are encouraged to make choices for themselves.)

ingredients.name: slender zucchini
ingredients.quantity: 1½ lb. (about 3 medium), ends trimmed, cut into ¾"-thick rounds

ingredients.name: mixed tender herb leaves with tender stems (such as parsley and/or basil)

instructions: Whisk 1 Tbsp. Calabrian chile paste, 1 Tbsp. preserved lemon paste or finely chopped preserved lemon, 2 tsp. pure maple syrup, and 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a medium bowl to combine. Set dressing aside.

Pour remaining 3 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil into a large cast-iron skillet. Working in 2 batches if needed, arrange 1½ lb. slender zucchini (about 3 medium), ends trimmed, cut into ¾"-thick rounds, cut sides down, in a single layer in skillet. Place over medium-high heat and cook, undisturbed, until deep golden brown underneath, 7–9 minutes (be careful as oil will spatter).
Turn and cook until golden brown on other side, about 5 minutes. Transfer to bowl with reserved dressing and toss to coat; season with kosher salt.
Arrange on a platter; top with mixed tender herb leaves with tender stems (such as parsley and/or basil).
description: Sweet and Spicy Zucchini recipe adapted from Samin Nosrat's book Good Things, incorporating store-bought preserved lemons and Calabrian chile paste.

ingredients.name: garlic cloves
ingredients.quantity: 4 cloves, finely grated, 2 Tbsp. dried oregano, 1 tsp. sugar, ⅓ cup plus 1 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, divided; plus more for drizzling, 1½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or 1 tsp. Morton kosher salt, plus more, Freshly ground pepper, 1½ lb. skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 2" pieces, 1 15.5-oz. can chickpeas, rinsed, 2 tsp. ground cumin, 2 tsp. smoked paprika, 3 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice, plus more for drizzling, ½ small red onion, thinly sliced, 1 lb. mixed tomatoes, cut into bite-size pieces, ½ cup pitted Kalamata olives, 6 oz. feta, thinly sliced, Parsley leaves with tender stems, pitas, and lemon wedges (for serving), Eight 10"-long bamboo skewers, soaked 30 minutes in water, or metal skewers Need to make a substitution? ASK AI Preparation Step 1 Preheat oven to 425°. Mix together 4 garlic cloves, finely grated, 2 Tbsp. dried oregano, 1 tsp. sugar, ⅓ cup extra-virgin olive oil, and 1½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or 1 tsp. Morton kosher salt in a large bowl; season with freshly ground pepper. Add 1½ lb. skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 2" pieces, and stir to coat. Let sit 15 minutes. Step 2 Meanwhile, spread out one 15.5-oz. can chickpeas, rinsed, on a rimmed baking sheet. Sprinkle 2 tsp. ground cumin and 2 tsp. smoked paprika over, drizzle with some oil, and season with salt. Toss chickpeas to coat. Step 3 When ready to roast, add 3 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice to chicken mixture and toss to coat. Thread chicken onto skewers; arrange over chickpeas. Roast until chicken is opaque throughout, 6–8 minutes. Heat broiler. Broil until chicken and chickpeas are browned in spots, about 5 minutes. Remove baking sheet from oven; drizzle 1 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil over chicken and chickpeas. Step 4 Combine ½ small red onion, thinly sliced, 1 lb. mixed tomatoes, cut into bite-size pieces, and ½ cup pitted Kalamata olives in a large bowl. Drizzle with oil and lemon juice, season with salt, and toss to coat. Step 5 Scatter salad over chicken and chickpeas. Top with 6 oz. feta, thinly sliced, and parsley leaves with tender stems; serve with pitas and lemon wedges. instructions: Combine 2 lb. ground chicken, 1 Tbsp. Diamond Crystal or 1¾ tsp. Morton kosher salt, 1 Tbsp. fennel seeds, 1 Tbsp. pure maple syrup, 2 tsp. smoked paprika, 1 tsp. garlic powder, and ½ tsp. crushed red pepper flakes in a large bowl; season with freshly ground black pepper. Mix vigorously to combine. Divide mixture into 10 portions, roll into balls, and place on a plate or baking sheet. Chill balls at least 10 minutes.

Heat 1 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet, preferably cast iron, over medium. Working in 3 batches, arrange meatballs in pan; press into patties with an oiled flat-bottomed measuring cup. Cook, adjusting heat as needed to keep patties from browning too quickly and turning halfway through, until deeply browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes total. Transfer to plates.
Balls can be formed 1 day ahead. Cover and keep chilled.

name: Milk Chocolate Sauce
instructions: Place 4 oz. milk chocolate, finely chopped and ½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or ¼ tsp. Morton kosher salt in a medium heatproof bowl.
Heat ¾ cup heavy cream in a small saucepan just until steaming (do not let it come to a boil) and pour over chocolate.
Let sit until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes.
Add 2 Tbsp. unsalted butter, room temperature, and whisk until butter is melted and incorporated and mixture is smooth.
Serve warm.

name: Spicy Cashew Scallion Noodles

ingredients.name: scallions
ingredients.quantity: 8', 'dark green parts removed and thinly sliced on a diagonal, white and pale green parts thinly sliced and placed in a large bowl', 'remaining white and pale green parts thinly sliced and placed in a large bowl with ginger', 'dark green parts set aside for serving', 'white and pale green parts placed in a large bowl with ginger and a fine-mesh sieve over bowl, set aside.'], 'category': 'Produce' }, { 'name': 'ginger', 'quantity': '1 1" piece', 'category': 'Produce' }, { 'name': 'vegetable oil', 'quantity': '½ cup', 'category': 'Pantry' }, { 'name': 'raw cashews', 'quantity': '½ cup', 'category': 'Pantry' }, { 'name': 'garlic cloves', 'quantity': '6', 'category': 'Produce' }, { 'name': 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'quantity': '2 tsp.', 'category': 'Spices' }, { 'name':

instructions: Remove dark green parts from 8 scallions and thinly slice on a diagonal; set aside for serving. Thinly slice remaining white and pale green parts. Place in a large bowl and add one 1" piece ginger, finely grated; place a fine-mesh sieve over bowl. Set aside.

Heat ½ cup vegetable oil in a small saucepan over medium-high. Add ½ cup raw cashews, finely chopped, and cook, stirring often, until golden brown, 1–2 minutes. Add 6 garlic cloves, finely grated, and 2 tsp. crushed red pepper flakes and cook, stirring constantly to keep garlic from sticking to bottom of pan, just until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour mixture into reserved sieve, letting hot oil heat aromatics in bowl below. Set sieve with cashews aside. Add 1 Tbsp. sugar to oil mixture and whisk until dissolved. Add ⅓ cup tahini, ¼ cup plus 1 Tbsp. soy sauce, and ¼ cup black (Chinkiang) vinegar or balsamic vinegar and whisk until smooth.

Cook 12 oz. wide wheat noodles (such as knife-cut, pappardelle, or tagliatelle) in a large pot of very lightly salted boiling water according to package directions. Drain, reserving 2 cups noodle cooking liquid.

Transfer noodles to bowl with sauce and toss, drizzling noodle cooking liquid as needed to loosen, until coated. Add reserved dark green scallion parts and garlicky cashews and toss to combine; divide noodles among bowls.
description: A vegan noodle dish featuring spicy, garlicky cashews and a tahini sauce.

ingredients.name: garlic clove
ingredients.quantity:
1 clove, finely chopped, ½ cup fresh lime juice, 2 tsp. adobo sauce from a can of chipotle chiles in adobo, 1½ tsp. sugar, and ½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or ¼ tsp. Morton kosher salt in a small bowl until sugar and salt are dissolved. (Dressing should taste like spicy limeade.)

Step 2

Arrange 1 Persian cucumber, quartered lengthwise, sliced on a diagonal 1" thick, ½ small red onion, thinly sliced, ½ avocado, halved crosswise, sliced, and 8 oz. mixed tomatoes, halved, cut into ½"-thick wedges if large, in a medium shallow bowl and season lightly with salt. Pour dressing over and chill 15

minutes to marinate (don’t go any longer as vegetables will release too much liquid).

Step 3

Taste tomato aguachile and add more sugar and/or season with more salt if needed. Drizzle 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil over and scatter ½ medium jalapeño, thinly sliced into rounds, on top. Serve with tostadas or tortilla chips on the side for scooping.

name: Sheet-Pan Sausage With Corn, Peach, and Cucumber Salad

ingredients.name: scallions, white and light green parts only, thinly sliced

instructions: Position a rack in the upper third of the oven. Preheat the oven to 425°F.

Place 4 ears corn, shucked, and 4 yellow peaches, diced, on a rimmed baking sheet and drizzle with 1 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil. Use your hands to coat all the ingredients with the oil. Place 2 lb. chorizo sausage on the baking sheet. Bake in the center of the oven rack until the peaches have softened and the sausage is cooked through, about 25 minutes.

Meanwhile, combine 4 Persian cucumbers, thinly sliced, 1 bunch scallions, white and light green parts only, thinly sliced, zest and juice of 2 limes (about ¼ cup juice), 1 tsp. kosher salt, and remaining 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a medium bowl and stir.

Add the cooked peaches and ½ bunch cilantro, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup), to the bowl with the cucumbers. Place the corn on a cutting board and remove the kernels, then transfer them to the bowl with the cucumbers and stir to combine.
Serve the sausage warm alongside the salad.

name: Cod With Lemon Butter Sauce

ingredients.name: tarragon leaves
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup, plus more for serving

instructions: Preheat oven to 450°. Place 1½ lb. small potatoes, halved, quartered if larger, on a rimmed baking sheet, drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil, and season with kosher salt. Toss to coat and arrange in a single layer. Roast until golden brown underneath, about 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, place ⅓ cup all-purpose flour on a plate. Season four 4–6-oz. cod fillets, patted dry with paper towels, all over with salt and freshly ground pepper. Lay one side of each fillet in flour to coat; shake off any excess and place, flour side up, on another plate. Heat remaining 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high. Cook fish, flour side down, undisturbed, until golden brown and crisp underneath, 5–7 minutes. Turn; cook until just cooked through, about 1 minute. Transfer, flour side up, to a clean plate.

Add 1 shallot, finely chopped, and 3 Tbsp. unsalted butter to same pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, until shallot is slightly softened, 1–2 minutes. Add ¼ cup fresh lemon juice, 1 Tbsp. Dijon mustard, 1 tsp. honey, ½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or ¼ tsp. Morton kosher salt, and 1 cup water. Cook, stirring often, until thickened, 6–8 minutes. Remove from heat; add ¼ cup tarragon leaves and remaining 2 Tbsp. unsalted butter and stir until sauce is emulsified. Season with salt.
Arrange fish, flour side up, in pan and spoon some sauce over. Season with pepper and scatter more tarragon leaves on top. Serve with potatoes on the side.

name: Butternut Squash Orzo With Fried Sage

ingredients.name: unsalted butter
ingredients.quantity: 5 Tbsp.  (separated use for sage and orzo preparation )

ingredients.name: Diamond Crystal or Morton kosher salt
ingredients.quantity: 1 tsp or ½ tsp, plus more

instructions: Heat 5 Tbsp. unsalted butter in a medium saucepan over medium, stirring often, until it foams, then just starts to brown, about 5 minutes.
Add ¼ cup (packed) sage leaves and cook, stirring constantly, until crisp, about 1 minute.
Pour butter through a fine-mesh sieve set over a small bowl.
Season sage in sieve with kosher salt.
Set brown butter and sage aside separately.
Heat 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a medium Dutch oven or other heavy pot over medium-high.
Cook 1 medium onion, finely chopped, stirring occasionally, until softened and golden brown around the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add 6 garlic cloves, finely chopped, and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Add one 15-oz. can butternut squash purée, 2 Tbsp. double-concentrated tomato paste, ½ tsp. crushed red pepper flakes, and 1 tsp. Diamond Crystal or ½ tsp. Morton kosher salt and cook, stirring often, until mixture is thickened and slightly darkened in color, about 5 minutes.
Pour 4 cups low-sodium vegetable broth and 1½ cups water into pot.
Increase heat to high; bring to a boil.
Add 12 oz. orzo; reduce heat and simmer, stirring often and scraping up any pasta stuck to bottom of pot, until tender and sauce is thickened, 10–12 minutes (it will thicken more as it cools).
Remove from heat and add 3 oz. Parmesan, finely grated (about 1½ cups), and reserved brown butter; stir vigorously to combine.
Taste orzo; season with more salt if needed.
Ladle orzo into shallow bowls and top with reserved fried sage.

name: Golden Mushroom Soup With Orzo & a Pat of Butter

ingredients.name: olive oil
ingredients.quantity: 3 Tbsp, plus more as needed for cooking the mushrooms, divided use in recipe steps 1 and 2, plus more for drizzling at the end as desired for serving. (Note: The recipe calls for more olive oil if the pot is looking a little dry while cooking the mushrooms.) This is a pantry item. It is used in the first step to cook the mushrooms and garlic, and then again in the second step to bloom the spices. It is also used at the end as a garnish, if desired.."", "category": "Pantry"}, {"name": "mushrooms, a good mix of the more exotic cultivated or wild foraged varieties, if you can (such as oyster, maitake, or chanterelle)", "quantity": "12 oz, divided", "category": "Produce"}, {"name": "kosher salt", "quantity": "to taste", "category": "Spices"}, {"name": "freshly ground black pepper", "quantity": "to taste", "category": "Spices"}, {"name": "garlic cloves", "quantity": "6, thinly sliced", "category": "Produce"}, {"name": "ground turmeric", "quantity": "1/2 tsp", "category": "Spices"}, {"name": "crushed red pepper flakes", "quantity": "1/4 tsp, plus more for serving", "category": "Spices"}, {"name": "water or broth (or water plus Better Than Bouillon)", "quantity": "6 cups", "category": "Pantry"}, {"name": "dried orzo", "quantity": "3/4 cup", "category": "Pantry"}, {"name": "fish sauce or soy sauce", "quantity": "2 tsp, plus more to taste", "category": "Pantry"}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "quantity": "2 Tbsp, plus more for serving", "category": "Dairy"}, {"name": "flaky sea salt", "quantity": "for finishing", "category": "Spices"

instructions: Heat 3 Tbsp. olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add 6 oz. mushrooms, a good mix of the more exotic cultivated or wild foraged varieties, if you can, torn or cut into bite-size pieces, and season kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until they’re starting to brown around the edges, 6–8 minutes. Add more olive oil if the pot is looking a little dry (mushrooms really soak it up), followed by the remaining 6 oz. mushrooms, torn or cut into bite-size pieces, and all 6 garlic cloves, thinly sliced. Season again with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until all the mushrooms are nicely browned and have started to leave a little fond (the brown, sticky parts where a lot of the flavor is) on the bottom of the pot, another 6–8 minutes.

Add ½ tsp. ground turmeric and ¼ tsp. crushed red pepper flakes and stir to bloom the spices in the fat for a minute or two. Add 6 cups water or broth (or water plus Better Than Bouillon) and bring to a simmer. Add ¾ cup dried orzo and 2 tsp. fish sauce or soy sauce and season again with salt and pepper.

Simmer until the broth is deeply flavorful and the orzo has cooked through, 15–20 minutes. The end soup should be brothy enough that you can see bits of orzo and mushrooms floating close to the surface—my simmer might not be your simmer, so keep simmering if it’s feeling a little thin.

Once the broth is where you want it and the orzo is good and plumped, add 2 Tbsp. unsalted butter to the pot and season again with salt, pepper, and more fish sauce. Divide among bowls and top with more red pepper flakes, some flaky sea salt, and...more butter. Because it looks nice and tastes so good.
description: A mushroom soup with orzo and a pat of butter.

name: Vinegar Chicken With Figs

ingredients.name: dried Turkish or black Mission figs
country-style bread or warm mashed potatoes

instructions: Stir ⅔ cup low-sodium chicken broth, ⅓ cup balsamic vinegar, ⅓ cup red wine vinegar, 2 tsp. honey, and 2 tsp. all-purpose flour in a medium bowl until flour is dissolved (some lumps may remain); set aside.

Holding a long thin knife parallel to cutting board and working one at a time, slice 2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts (about 1½ lb. total) in half lengthwise, starting on a long side, to create 4 cutlets. Season lightly with kosher salt and generously with freshly ground pepper. Sprinkle one side of each with 1 Tbsp. all-purpose flour and spread to coat evenly; shake off any excess.

Heat 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Working in batches if needed, cook chicken, flour side down, undisturbed, until deeply browned underneath, about 5 minutes. Turn and cook just until nearly cooked through, about 30 seconds. Transfer to a large plate.

Heat remaining 1 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in same pan. Cook 3 large shallots, quartered through root ends, stirring occasionally and reducing heat if browning too quickly, until blistered in spots and starting to soften, about 5 minutes. Add 3 garlic cloves, coarsely chopped, and cook, stirring, until lightly golden, about 1 minute. Add 2–3 large sprigs thyme, 4 oz. dried Turkish or black Mission figs (11–12), quartered, and reserved broth mixture. Cook, swirling pan and scraping up any browned bits stuck to bottom of pan, until liquid thickens slightly and shallots and figs are tender, about 4 minutes. Add 4 Tbsp. unsalted butter, cut into large pieces, and cook, stirring vigorously, until melted and emulsified; season with salt and pepper if needed.
Return chicken to pan and simmer until warmed through, about 45 seconds. Transfer to a platter and serve with toasted country-style bread or warm mashed potatoes.

name: Green Chutney Chicken

ingredients.name: cilantro
ingredients.quantity: 1 medium bunch, coarsely chopped (including stems; about 1½ cups )

ingredients.name: Diamond Crystal or 1¾ tsp. Morton kosher salt

instructions: Purée 1 medium bunch cilantro, coarsely chopped (including stems; about 1½ cups), 4 garlic cloves, 1 serrano chile, stem removed, ½ cup (tightly packed) mint leaves, ¼ cup sour cream, 2 Tbsp. yellow mustard, 1 tsp. ground cardamom, 3 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, and 1 Tbsp. Diamond Crystal or 1¾ tsp. Morton kosher salt in a blender, pushing down with a tamper or rubber spatula, until very smooth and bright green. (If mixture absolutely refuses to blend even after pushing leaves into blades, add water, 1 Tbsp. at a time, until it moves.)

Transfer purée to a large bowl. Add 1½ lb. skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 2" pieces, and toss to coat. Let sit at least 15 minutes at room temperature, or cover and chill up to 1 day. (You don’t need to bring to room temperature before cooking.)

Heat broiler (if your broiler is in your oven, place rack in top slot). Remove chicken from marinade, letting excess drip back into bowl, and arrange on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet, spacing evenly apart; discard any remaining marinade. Broil chicken, rotating baking sheet front to back as needed if cooking unevenly, until cooked through and deeply charred in spots, 20–25 minutes.

Transfer chicken to a platter; squeeze juice from 2 large limes, halved, over. Arrange sliced cucumber, radishes, and red onion alongside; drizzle a little oil over and season generously with salt. Serve with warmed flour tortillas alongside.

name: Beet-Salmon Salad With Horseradish Yogurt
instructions: Season one 1-lb. skinless, boneless salmon fillet generously on both sides with kosher salt and freshly ground pepper.
Heat 1 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high.
Add salmon and cook until browned slightly underneath, about 4 minutes.
Turn and cook until lightly browned on other side, about 4 minutes. (Don’t worry if salmon breaks apart; you will do that later anyway.)
Transfer to a large plate and let cool.

Meanwhile, mix 1 garlic clove, finely chopped, 1 cup plain whole-milk Greek yogurt, 3 Tbsp. drained prepared horseradish, and 1 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a small bowl to combine; season with salt.
Spread over a platter, covering completely and swooshing as desired.
Whisk juice of 1 lemon, ½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or ¼ tsp. Morton kosher salt, ¼ tsp. freshly ground pepper, and remaining 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a large bowl to combine.
Add 1 medium shallot, thinly sliced into rings, and toss to coat; let mixture sit 5 minutes.
Add 2 medium endives, cored, leaves separated, and ¼ cup coarsely chopped dill to bowl with shallot and toss to coat.
Taste salad and season with more salt and pepper if needed.
Spoon salad over yogurt.
Season one 8.8-oz. package cooked beets, drained, cut into 1"-thick wedges, with salt and pepper.
Break salmon into large irregular pieces; nestle salmon and beets into salad.

name: Roasted Honeynut Squash with Cottage Cheese and Chili Crisp

name: Sheet-Pan Pomegranate Chicken With Walnut Relish
instructions: Place a rack in upper third of oven and preheat to 425°.
Place chicken thighs in a large bowl. Drizzle 1 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil over, season with kosher salt and freshly ground pepper, and toss to coat.

Whisk balsamic vinegar, pomegranate molasses, Worcestershire sauce, and ground cumin in a small saucepan. Drizzle 3 Tbsp. over chicken; toss to coat. Stir a pinch of salt into remaining sauce in pan; set aside.
Arrange chicken on a rimmed baking sheet and roast until lightly browned, 13–16 minutes. Remove from oven.
Meanwhile, toast raw walnuts in a single layer on another rimmed baking sheet, stirring once, until golden brown, 5–8 minutes. Remove from oven.
Set reserved sauce in pan over medium-high heat and cook, stirring occasionally, until thick and syrupy, about 5 minutes.
Heat broiler. Brush chicken with sauce, then broil until cooked through and deeply browned and blistered in spots, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and brush with more sauce.

Coarsely chop walnuts and transfer to a medium bowl. Add garlic clove, finely grated, crushed red pepper flakes, Diamond Crystal or Morton kosher salt, and remaining extra-virgin olive oil and mix to combine walnut relish.
Transfer chicken to a platter and spoon walnut relish over. Scatter scallion, mint leaves, and some pomegranate seeds on top.

name: Roasted Cauliflower Salad With Feta And Dates

ingredients.name: extra-virgin olive oil
ingredients.quantity: ¼ cup (or more) plus 2 Tbsp; plus more for drizzling

ingredients.name: arugula
ingredients.quantity: 2 big handfuls (about half of a 5-oz. package)

instructions: Place a rack in lowest position in oven; preheat to 450°. Cut 1 large head of cauliflower (about 2½ lb.), leaves removed, stem trimmed, through core into 1⁄2"-thick slabs (this will allow the cauliflower to sit flat against the baking sheet and brown more quickly and evenly; it’s okay if some fall apart). Arrange in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet; drizzle with 1⁄4 cup extra-virgin olive oil (or more if needed to evenly coat) and season generously with kosher salt. Roast cauliflower until starting to brown underneath, 18–22 minutes.

Meanwhile, whisk 1 garlic clove, finely grated, 3 Tbsp. red wine vinegar, 2 tsp. honey, 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, and a big pinch of kosher salt in a large bowl to combine, then set dressing aside.

Scatter 1 medium red onion, cut into 1"-thick wedges through root end, layers separated, over cauliflower; drizzle onion with oil and season with salt (do not toss). Roast until onion is slightly softened, 14–16 minutes. Using a spatula, turn over any large pieces of cauliflower. Arrange 6 oz. feta, thinly cut into slabs, over and scatter 2 Tbsp. drained capers and 2 Tbsp. shelled raw pistachios on top. Roast until feta softens slightly and pistachios are golden brown, 9–12 minutes. Let cauliflower mixture cool 5 minutes.

Add 2 big handfuls of arugula (about half of a 5-oz. package) and 1 cup torn pitted Medjool dates (about 4 oz.) to bowl with reserved dressing and toss to coat. Scatter salad over cauliflower mixture and, using a spatula, toss gently to combine; season with freshly ground pepper.

name: Sheet-Pan Pierogies and Beets

ingredients.name: frozen potato and cheese pierogies (such as Mrs. T’s)
ingredients.quantity: 1½ lb. frozen potato and cheese pierogies (such as Mrs. T’s) (pull apart any that are stuck together) with 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a medium bowl until well coated. Arrange in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet; reserve bowl.)

ingredients.name: extra-virgin olive oil
ingredients.quantity: 4 Tbsp. plus ⅓ cup extra-virgin olive oil, divided

ingredients.name: cooked beets
ingredients.quantity: 2 8.8-oz. packages cooked beets, drained, sliced ½" thick

ingredients.name: Diamond Crystal or Morton kosher salt
ingredients.quantity: 1½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or 1 tsp. Morton kosher salt, plus more

instructions: Place a rack in lower third of oven; preheat to 400°.

Toss 1½ lb. frozen potato and cheese pierogies (pull apart any that are stuck together) with 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil in a medium bowl until well coated. Arrange in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet; reserve bowl.

Toss two 8.8-oz packages cooked beets, drained, sliced ½" thick, with 2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil and 1½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or 1 tsp. Morton kosher salt in reserved bowl; season with freshly ground pepper. Arrange on baking sheet; bake until pierogies are puffed and golden in spots, 25–30 minutes.

Meanwhile, whisk 1 shallot, finely chopped, ¼ cup red wine vinegar, 2 Tbsp. poppy seeds, 2 tsp. Dijon mustard, 1 tsp. honey, and remaining ⅓ cup extra-virgin olive oil in a small bowl; season dressing with salt and pepper.
Spread sour cream over plates; top with pierogies and beets. Spoon dressing over; top with dill sprigs. Season with pepper.

ingredients.name: Diamond Crystal or Morton kosher salt
ingredients.quantity: 1 tsp Diamond Crystal or ½ tsp Morton kosher salt, divided, plus more

ingredients.name: baby bok choy
ingredients.quantity: 12 oz, cored, cut into quarters through root ends, eighths if large

instructions: Place a rack in bottom third of oven; preheat to 400°. Toss 8 garlic cloves, finely grated, 1½ lb. cylindrical Korean rice cakes (about 2½" long), thawed if frozen, one 16–24-oz. jar Napa cabbage kimchi, ½ tsp. crushed red pepper flakes, 3 Tbsp. oyster sauce, 2 Tbsp. toasted sesame oil, 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil, and ½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or ¼ tsp. Morton kosher salt on a rimmed baking sheet until combined and evenly coated. Bake, tossing halfway through, until rice cakes are tender, 25–30 minutes.

Meanwhile, toss 12 oz. baby bok choy, cored, cut into quarters through root ends, eighths if large, 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil, ½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or ¼ tsp. Morton kosher salt, remaining 1 Tbsp. oyster sauce, and remaining 1 Tbsp. toasted sesame oil in a medium bowl to combine.

Pour ½ cup water onto baking sheet with rice cake mixture and toss mixture to create a saucy consistency. Scatter bok choy mixture evenly over, then arrange one 1½–2-lb piece skinless center-cut salmon fillet in the center. Drizzle with vegetable oil and season generously with salt. Bake until salmon is opaque in the center and flakes easily with a fork and bok choy is tender, 16–20 minutes.

Meanwhile, cut 3 large scallions crosswise into 3"–4" pieces. Cut each piece in half lengthwise, then cut each piece in half again, or thirds if thicker, to create matchsticks. (If any scallions are particularly large, you can cut in half again. The aim is to make all of the pieces similar in size.) Place scallions in a large bowl of ice water and let sit 10 minutes. Drain and pat dry. (Alternatively, you can simply thinly slice the scallions and skip the soaking.)
Remove baking sheet from oven; scatter scallions over salmon and rice cakes.
